1111.title: A Big New World

11111.content:
You figure you're only an inch high. You look around and wonder just what world you have entered. It's obviously based on anime but which one. Just then you hear some low rhythmic booms; they seem like... footsteps.

They are footsteps! Looking round you see to gigantic feet heading your way, clad in <insert colour here> slippers. You take a few steps back and look up and up and up. Now you recognise the giant figure as Tohru Honda. The protagonist of Fruits Basket.

You consider your options: She's walking towards you, so there's danger. She knows about the zodiac curse, so she might not be too surprised by your diminuitive stature. On the other hand, she can take breaking news quite giddily before she settles down so she might faint, result a major earthquake.

What do you do? Her feet are coming nearer and nearer.
11111.title: Tohru the Titan

111111.content:
"Hey!" You cry out, jumping up and down and waving your arms at Tohru. "Honda-san! Look down here!"

Tohru seems to pause in her pace. Has she heard you? Has she seen you?
111111.title: What will Happen?

1111111.content:
Tohru's gaze sets down upon your tiny form. You continue to wave but save your voice, considering how feeble it must be to her. She lets out a sound of curiousity as she seems to study your figure.

Tohru goes onto her knees to get a closer look at you. Her knees come down so close to you that you instictively take a few steps back.

Tohru's face comes in closer and closer, examining you as you stand before her. Will she recognise you as a human? At your size she may think that you're an insect or something.
1111111.title: Eyes Upon You

11111111.content:
"Amazing!" Tohru booms; you're stunned by the fact that you can understand her. "A tiny person." She slowly lowers her hand down next to you; getting the hint you climb into her palm and let her lift you up into the air.

"Um," Tohru comments as she holds you in front of her face, "My name is Tohru Honda. What is your name?" Looking up into her great turquoise eyes you answer.
11111111.title: Introductions

choices: Have Tohru give you a tour...
111111111.content:
"My name is Christopher," You said. "But my friends call me 'Chris'." You feel a bit stunned by her pretty face.

"How did you get here? At such a small height?" Tohru asked.

"You know what? I can't remember a thing." You replied, being unable to recall a thing of your arrival nor your size change. "Least I remember who I am."

"Well, you're alright. That's the important thing." Tohru replied. "What do you want to do? Get to know each other better? Or give you a tour of the place?" You answer.
111111111.title: Your name

1111111111.content:
After thinking about it for a short while, you've come to the conclusion that the tour might not be such a good idea. If you remember the series very carefully, there are some people of the Sohma household you do NOT wish to introduce yourself to any time soon for very good reason. Specifically, the one who's the MOST cursed...

Besides, Tohru's kindhearted, gentle, trustworthy, and everything you'd like in a best friend. Not to mention kinda cute... It wouldnt be a bad idea spending a little more time with a decent girl instead of hanging out with the not-so-decent guys of the household... (specifically, the one who's the MOST cursed!)

"Eh... can we save the tour for a little later?" you suggested to Tohru, "I'm a little more interested in knowing a bit more about you." You even grinned as you said that!

Unfortunately, either youre too small to see the grin or she couldnt detect the hidden meaning in that last sentence!

"Ok, Chris!" she said, still keeping that carefree smile on her face, "but I'm not really all that interesting. Uh... I'm 16, I'm a highschool student, housekeeper and cook of the Sohma family who were kind enough to let me stay with them after my er.... my 'castle' was destroyed in a horrible landslide..." You notice her look a little uneasy when she said that last part.

Although you already know what she's refering to, to pretended to play dumb and rather skip a long confusing story about her life being inside a fictional cartoon!
"Castle?" you tilted your head feigning curiosity.

Tohru kinda blushed a little, "Uh... y...yeah. It uh... wasnt a big castle, but... it was still cozy. Anyways, I've been living there since my mom died."
"I'm... I'm sorry to hear that."
"Eh, dont worry about it," Tohru assures you, still keeping that carefree smile on her face, "anyway Chris, now that I told you about myself, how about telling me about yourself?"

Not wanting to turn down a humongous yet rather cute lady, you introduce yourself. "Well, I'm 18, college student from the States, and-"

"The States?" the big blue pupils of her big blue eyes eyed you with a hint of intrigue, "As in the United States?"
"Um... yes," you answered as you scratched the back of your head, "also-"
"Isnt that a whole ocean away from here?" Tohru interrupted you again.

You just scratch the back of your head again and answer, "Uh... yes Tohru." The way her gigantic head seemed to lean even closer to you, she seemed even more interested than ever. Not that you dont mind the attention, but the way the big dark shadow casted over you seemed a little scary.
"How did you manage to end up all the way in Japan?" she asked, even more curios than ever, "especially at your size! I mean you couldve been swallowed by a goldfish before you could ever get across the ocean!"

A question you just did not know the answer to. All you remember is who you are. You dont even remember the last day BEFORE you woke up in your condition stuck in the middle of a world that shouldnt be real, yet for some reason is. It seems far too real to be a dream... maybe you've been caught in a terrible car accident and in a deep coma! Whatever the reason, it just seems so weird that it involves 'Fruits Basket'!

"Oh right! I'm sorry!" just then, Tohru interrupted your train of thought and blushed, "I forgot! YOU forgot! ...Heh. Hey, that's funny. I forgot that you forgot!" A simple girl, but still lovable!
You laugh a little along with her, but only because you were kinda mesmerized by those big beautiful blue eyes of hers!

But in a quick flash, her carefree smile quickly changes to a much more serious look as she looked down at you with her hand to her chin. "Hmm... this doesnt seem like it's cause by the Chinese Zodiac curse like the Sohma family." That's when you could almost see the lightbulb over her head! "...Maybe it's another type of Zodiac curse! Quick! Tell me! What's your sign?"

"Um... Gemini," you answer.
"Gemini?" the way those big blue eyes shined as she looked down at you told you the simple girl was on to something, "isnt that the one with the twins? Then that must mean another you wandering around somewhere!"
"Another me?" your head was REALLY itching!
"Yes!" she nodded, "maybe the other you might know what's been going on with you and your curse. Perhaps we should start looking for him." Oh dear. Just what exactly is she up to?

*Knock knock!* "Excuse me, Tohru. Could I speak with you for a moment?"

Just then, you overheard a knock on the door followed by someone's voice call out Tohru's name. You recognized that voice too! It was...
1111111111.title: Simple Girl

1122211.content:
Walking out from underneath a bed after regaining conscious, you find yourself in a young girl's room and only 1 inch tall. On the bed was a young girl, who was waking up from her sleep. She sat up on the side of her bed as she rubbed the sand from her eyes. She got up and stretched before she walked into the bathroom. She brushed her teeth and took a shower. After coming out, she, with a towel on, walks into her closet and puts on her casual clothing  . Looked like she was going somewhere. It would be best to try to get her attention before she leaves.

"HEY!!!" You shouted at the top of your lungs. The girl manage to hear the cry as she looked around the room. "Down Here!!!" She looked down and saw you waving your arms.

"What in the world?" She gasp as her eyes widen in shock and surprise to see a human smaller than a mouse. The girl put a hand on as you climbed into it. "Are you okay?" She asked.
"Yeah, I'm fine." You replied.
"How did you get so small?"
"I don't know. The only thing I knew is who I am..."
"My name is Hotaru Tomoe, 12-years-old. What's yours?" When you hear that name, you realized that your in the Sailor Moon world. And your being held by your most favorite of all the Senshi.
"M-my name is Christopher, but my friends call me 'Chris' for short. I'm also 12 years of age."
"Christopher, that's a nice name."
"Thanks. My mother named me. Where am I?"
"You're in my room, obviously." Hotaru giggled.
"Not what I mean."
"Oh, this is the Tomoe Mansion."
"Mansion? Are you rich?"
"My dad's a scientist."
"What about your, mother?"
"She died when I was still young."
"I see... sorry to hear that..."
"What about your parents?"
"My father is a baker and my mother is the housekeeper. Wait, what country am I in?"
"Japan."
"JAPAN!!!" You stood up in shock. "How can I understand you? I'm not from here and don't speak Japanese."
"Where are you from then?"
"USA."
"Wow, that's many of oceans away from here. What do you do?"
"I'm actually a mage."
"You mean you can do magic tricks?"
"No, not those fake imitations you see. Real magic." You wave over the palm of your hand. "Like this." A fireball appeared.
"Wow!" Hotaru was amazed at the fireball floating in your hand. She looks up at the clock. "Oh no! I'm suppose to meet up with Chibi-Usa!"
"Your friend?"
"Yes. Do you wanna come along with me or stay here?"

113211.content:
You wake up lying in what you assume is your bed and the room looks the same at first. After a few moments you get up and look around; things start to look different. There are some things in this room that look out of place and others that you don't even remember having.

You exit your room and the landing looks different again. The staircase is practically in the middle forming an almost E shape instead of being up against one of the walls.

Looking in the bathroom it seems much grander than before, almost upper class. What's curious is that you have seen stuff you remember having, such as your toothbrush above the sink.

If you had been kidnapped then only you and whatever the kidnappers were interested in would've been taken and you certainly wouldn't have been left alone to explore such a grand house. It's as though someone has moved you against your will while being conscientious enough to make you comfortable and even take all your belongings along with you.

'This is very strange.' You think to yourself.
113211.title: Next Morning

choices: Go Downstairs for a Further Goosey
Open a pair of Curtains to see Outside
1132111.content:
You exit the bathroom and check out the rest of the house to see if anyone else is here and to see if any more of your possessions have been brought with you. Across the landing from the bathroom you find the master bedroom; a magnificent décor fit for a lord. It doesn't look like anything belonging to anyone else is here. Since you never kept anything in your parents' bedroom you wouldn't expect any of your stuff here but it's suprising to see no evidence of an owner living here, since the owner is likely to sleep in the master bedroom.

You go downstairs, the light levels being limited since, for some reason, all the curtains were closed. You leave at that since it's best to know the inside first before seeing what's outside. As you look at your hand on the bannister you're suprised to see that it looks animated, like everything else. You dash back to the bathroom.

Looking in the mirror you're so shocked to see an anime face staring back at you that you do a stiff-leg faint. So it seems like you've crossed dimensions but have also had your belongings sent over as well. You can't comprehend what's going on.
1132111.title: Having a Gander

11321111.content:
After descending the staircase you find yourself standing in a high-class hallway. The hallway stretches behind the staircase and is flanked by doors, most likely leading to rooms; in front of you theres a classic porch with your coats and shoes! This is getting wierd in that all of your belongings have come with you. The glass at what must be the front door is difficult to see through but it's too far away to determine whether it's stained glass or gauzey glass.

So there are doors to the right and to the left. Which way to you want to go?
11321111.title: Downstairs

113211111.content:
You go through the door on your left. You find a spacious living room with bay windows, curtains drawn as expected. There's everything you could possibly imagine belonging in a living room or lounge or whatever you call it.

So what do you decide to do now you've seen the lounge.
113211111.title: The Lounge

choices: You Consider What to do Next
1132111112.content:
You cross the hall and enter the door opposite the lounge. You find a most capacious dining room with such high quality crockery, cutlery and everything else you'd find on a classic dining room table. Once again the curtains at the front are closed while a door and hatchway opposite lead to a kitchen.

It is strange in that you'd expect a house like this to have servants, especially kitchen staff, but it's deserted. In fact, compared to the rest of the house, the kitchen is very modern with a more late 20th Century working class look to it; the sort you find in typical family homes.

Looking in the cupboards and fridge you are surprised at the absence of any food, drink or even cooking ingredients. This is one strange kidnapping.

Just then...
1132111112.title: Dining Room and Beyond

11321111121.content:
*CRASH!!!* *BOOM!!!* "AAAAAAHHHHHH!!!" "EEEEEEKKKKKK!!!!!"

After hearing the sound of a crash and a boom followed by screaming, you have a bad feeling that this certain dimension you 'magically appeared' in not a quiet and peaceful one. In fact, you could probably assume it's like some sort of action-anime type. DEFINITELY a bad place for someone like you to be shrunken down in the middle of!

On the plus side (or minus side) the back door was left open. Which could mean the certain giant/giantess of this household forgot to close it... or someone broke in. So far, you didnt see anyone else inside, but you'd rather not take the risk that there could be someone else here that you missed!

You run out the door!

You blindly pace through the dirt and grass, not sure where youre going or whether you'll even get far before someone spots OR whether the someone that spots you is good or evil, but you just keep on going. You can however see black smoke up in the sky as well as hear sirens. There's a fire nearby. You have a bad feeling youre in a lot more danger than you assume.

"Th...this is all just a dream," you tell yourself, "yeah, that's it. It's all just a dream! Sooner or later, Im gonna wake up back in my nice comfy bed and this'll all be forgotten. Yep! Just a dream... just a-"

You stop in mid-sentence at the sight of a big blue boot standing in front of you. A pair of big blue boots, actually. You look up towards the sky to see that they belong to a giant towering over you.
A girl. A greyish teenage girl with cropped shoulder length hair and four ponytails, two long and two short wearing a Chinese blue leotard with white trimmings and a pair of blue thigh-length boots. Little to no emotion was shown on her face as her blue dilated pupils were staring into your soul.

Wait. This woman... looks familiar. Wasnt she from Cardcaptor Sakura? YES! That's it! She's a physical form of one of the Clow Cards. The Fight! ....The Fight?
Not exactly a good choice to be spotted by. Considering her expertise in fighting, that's a character you stay as far away from as possible! And by the way she's staring down at you, you have her undivided attention.

"I...I....I...." you stutter a little as you continue to tell yourself, "It's just a dream. It's just a dream. I'm gonna blink and my head and she's gonna disappear!" You blink and turn your head, then turn back around. She's still there. You do it again. She's still there. One more time! Still didnt work!

Either this dream is really stubborn or this aint a dream. Either way, perhaps you better not take any chances.
"Um...uh...h.....h....Hi!" you look up to her and greet her hoping to show her you mean no harm. She doesnt respond. Fight continues to look at you with a blank stare and slight intrigue in her eyes.

You try it again. "Um....Konnichiwa?" Doesnt really do much better. The stare in Fight's eyes is still giving you the creeps.
Just then, Fight lifted her foot and took one step closer to you.
Out of instinct, you jumped back, fearing she's trying to step on you!

Thankfully, she wasnt. However, Fight leaned down toward your tiny body and reached for you...
Her huge hand came down toward you ready to pick you off the ground!!
11321111121.title: Round 1: Fight!

choices: She is gentle and concerned for your well being.
she is curious and wants to know what you are.
113211111211.content:
You have to admit, your terrified. You couldn't tell if Fight was a good person or a bad person, but the fact that a one inch tall guy being picked up by someone called "the fight" didn't sound safe. Your instincts take over and you run the opposite way further into the house. You hear a gasp of surprise from behind you but continue to run. It took you a second to realise you were even running.

The sound of footfalls makes you run even faster, manuvering around chairs and anything in your way. If Fight wanted to kill you she would have done it already however she apparently wants to get to you alive, and again you don't know if that is a good thing or a bad thing.

you find a small hiding spot under a couch in the living room breathing large breaths. Fight came into the living room to looking around carefully. You try to keep your gasping down to keep her from hearing you When you realize that you hear something else breathing. At ther other end under the couch and it has spotted you. At your size it looked like a bear.

You run out from under the couch but don't get too far. You were already exhausted from running away from Fight. You tiredness distracts you and you trip over the carpet. The mouse is closing up the gap between you two. You close your eyes and wait for the inevitable when your hear something hit the floor.

You open your eyes to see a large pale blue hand with a blue glove in the middle between you and the mouse. Her palm facing the mouse and back hand facing you, Fight's had stops the mouse in it's tracks and it runs away.

Fight looks back to you and picks you up, You curl up in her hand trying to protect yourself when your eyes lock. She looks at you with intensity, she's either curious as to what you are or she is concerned for your well being.
113211111211.title: Run!!

1132111112111.content:
She could be feeling any emotion right now and you wouldnt be able to understand it since her face is too unemotional. She could be happy youre safe, she could be mad that you tried to run away, she could be worried that she almost lost her little 'friend', and she could be hungry.

No matter what the look in her eyes means, youre still terrified of her. She was created for the sole purpose of fighting and youre about the size of a bug to her. You couldnt bear to imagine what would happen if it was the Nothing that spotted you! You failed to hide your sweating and shivering. 'Please....' you think to yourself, 'PLEASE let this be a bad dream!!!'

Finally, after a moment of staring, a huge finger came down toward your head. You wanted to jump out of the way, but you were too scared to budge. You closed your eyes and waited for that finger to squish you into tiny human paste....

...She patted your head! A little rough, but it didnt hurt. Fight was actually being careful enough not to hurt you! Could she actually be concerned for your well being?! A simple card come to life?! Is that even possible?
So far it looks that way. She DID save your life from that evil mouse that tried to come at you. Speaking of, you never properly thanked her for that.

You swallowed hard and bowed your head showing your gratitude as well as saying it, "Thank you.... for saving my life. Arigato!" Youre not sure if she understood you or not, but for some reason you dont feel quite as scared of her anymore!

In fact, you even tried to start conversation. "Um... I dont think I've properly introduced myself," you smiled at Fight while she still stared back at you with the slightest bit of intrigue. You patted your chest and said, "I am [your name]. [Your name]. Nice to meet you!"

"...." Fight mouthed something, but no sound came out of her mouth. Judging by the way her lips were moving, it looked almost as if she was trying to say your name. Wow... she must like you!

"Hello? Little one? Where are you? Are you still there? Little o-"
Just then, someone else entered the room and stopped in their tracks at the sight of Fight. A young familiar looking girl with long flowing black hair and blue eyes....
"T... Tomoyo?"

"D...DEMO!!" Tomoyo shouted before questioning the stranger (in ENGLISH!), "W...who are you? What are you doing with-"
...With you?!
Fight stared back at her, then gently set you in one of the loops of her ponytails just before raising her arms and assuming fighting stance!

Tomoyo, possibly not being as skilled a fighter started backing away, possibly out of fear. You dont wanna see your new friend hurt this poor girl!
"FIGHT, WAIT!! STOP!!!" you shouted, not causing Fight to flinch even the tiniest bit, "It's ok! She's friendly! Dont hurt her!" You hope that she'll understand what youre saying at this point... as well as listen!
1132111112111.title: The Determined, but Caring Titaness

choices: Ask Tomoyo to give you back.
Stay in Tomoyo's hand a little longer...
11321111121111.content:
Moments pass. Moments that seem like seconds or minutes or even hours pass. As time slowly moves on, you stare into the eyes of the poor scared girl in front of you possibly fearing the worst reaction from your new friend! Poor Tomoyo... where's Sakura when you need her?!

...thankfully, you notice Fight lowering her arms. Good! She's not resorting to such a barbaric approach to the new girl. Either that, or she really is listening to what youre telling her! You wipe the sweat off your forehead with your free hand while the other hand's gripping Fight's white hair strands for dear life!

Youre not the only one relieved. Tomoyo sighed a little too, now knowing that this pale woman wasnt gonna pummel her to death!
"Um....uh....um...." Tomoyo's cheeks started turning red as she was trying to find the right words to say as she seemed to pointing up towards you, "Um... could you... well... err..."

You had a good idea as to what she was trying to ask Fight. Since you know by heart that she's very kind-hearted, gentle, and less intimidating than the Fight Card..... why not?

"It's alright," you try to tell your current captor/heroine, "I trust her. You can hand me to her. Go ahead." The Fight seemed to have stalled for a couple of seconds. She mustve been reluctant to give you up.
Nevertheless, she finally picked you out of the hair loop and brought you toward Tomoyo.

The young girl extended her hands ready to accept the offer.... however again, the Fight stalled for a couple more seconds before finally putting you down slowly and carefully into the palm of Tomoyo's hand. The moment you landed, you could see something slightly different about Fight through the corner of your eye. You could almost detect a slight hint of uneasiness on her barely-emotional face!

Meanwhile, Tomoyo raised her hand a bit, bringing you much closer to that gigantic, adolescently curious smiling face looking back you kinda nervously.
Since you know now that she does speak English, it shouldnt be too hard for you to break the ice!
"Hi!" you raised your hand and greeted her, trying to your own fear and nervousness. Unlike the woman opposite your direction, it doesnt take Tomoyo long to respond!

"Hello!" she nodded and smiled, "A...are you alright? Sh-she didnt hurt you, did she?"
You shook your head, "No. No! Not at all. Fight was very gentle to me. She even saved my life just a little while ago!" Granted, you were very grateful of your new friend. That mouse was terrifying! At least for someone your size, anyway!

Tomoyo looked back toward Fight and said, "Thank you so much, Miss... for helping my little friend, [your name]!"

...Did she just say your name?! Youre pretty sure she said your name!! How does she know your name? And 'little friend'? Does she know you?
"Um... how do you know my name?" you ask her, "Have we met?" Come to think of it, you DID wake up in the middle of her house! And she seemed to be looking for a 'little one' before she stumbled before the Fight.

Tomoyo simply responded by scratching the back of her head and smiling while blushing a bit, "Um.... it's... kind of a long story." It looks like she owes you quite a bit of an explanation.

But it looks like the explanation will have to wait. After the talk between you and Tomoyo, you noticed the Fight acting more and more unusual... Nothing dangerous or life-threatening, just a bit off for someone like her. She seems to be breathing a little heavier, her fingers were twitching, and the cheeks of her emotionless face were turning red! If you didnt know any better, you'd think she's starting to feel more and more anxious about something.

Perhaps she's getting impatient with Tomoyo keeping her little friend in her hand. Will you ease the Fight Card and give her what she wants? Or stick with Tomoyo a little longer?
11321111121111.title: Everybody loves me!

113211111211111.content:
As cute as you find Tomoyo's look of interest on her face and Fight's obvious hint of jealousy on her semi-unemotional face, perhaps you should focus more on keeping the peace. The thought of them literally fighting over you might not exactly be a GOOD thing, especially if youre caught in the middle of the two! It looks like Tomoyo's possibly long explanation explaining how she knows your name. Maybe she might know why youre small, too!

"Um... uh..."
"Yes? What is it?" Tomoyo's eyes practically twinkled with interest, making your question even harder to try and ask!
"Well... um.... uh..." you sweat a little as you pointed over to the pale-colored uneasy titaness right in front of your current captor, "could you...er... umm....?"

Good news is Tomoyo knew immediately what you were trying to ask. Bad news is, the twinkle in her eye kinda faded a bit. "Oh! Well, um..." she looked over to the living Clow Card and carefully extended her hand with you in it to her new friend. Speaking of, despite the slightly scary site of her head practically looking down at you from Heaven itself, the way her cheeks were kinda reddened and the loud sounds of her inhaling and exhaling with every quick breath made her slightly less intimidating. In fact, she looks... CUTE! Er.. for a card come to life, of course!

"You... you'll give him back, right?"
Fight's eyes widened a little (almost exactly like Tomoyo's when Fight gave you to her) despite her unemotional facade. With both hands, she gently and carefully scooped you out of your younger captor's hand and carefully tightened her grip on you a bit. The grip wasnt very tight seeing as though you had plenty of breathing space and space to squirm around a bit. You even managed to notice her blowing a quick gentle sigh of relief thanks to the fact her breath was kinda chilly!

After moments of merely staring into your soul in complete silence, Fight raised you back up over her head and placed you back in one of her ponytail loops. How long are you gonna be there? Who knows...

"So.... uh... um..." it looks like Tomoyo is trying to make conversation with the titaness below you, "I.. I dont believe we've been introduced. I am Daidouji Tomoyo! Pleased to meet you!" Fight merely looked back at her with a blank expression. Nonetheless, she continued, "Um... well... say..." just then, the young lady started looking the big lady over from all sides, "that is a nice outfit you have on! Where did you get it?"

Although you couldnt see from your angle, you could imagine Fight starting looking back at her questionably.

Nonetheless, Tomoyo continues eyeing her gettup like a kid in a candy store. "It's SOOO cool! I HAVE to learn how to make a costume like that! Do you mind if I borrow it one day? I promise I'll make you an extra one! ...Do you mind if it's pink? I think you'd look SO cute in pink!"

"Heheheh!" just then, you overheard girlish laughter coming from just inches away from you! You turned your head slightly to a girl's face staring at you only an inch away from your face!
"Wah!" you jumped back and almost lost your balance on the hair loop! Though it didnt surprise you as much as the fact that there was a girl about your size with you! But not just any girl... this fellow tiny was yellowish colored with a yellow cape, a yellow robe with baggy-bottoms, and a yellow double pointed hat. You recognize this girl as well....

"L...Little?" ANOTHER one of the Clow Cards come to life. One you can possibly relate to. However, her touch could make you shrink. ANOTHER potential threat to someone as small as you! If she touches you, you'll probably be too small for the average human eyeball to see. Microscopic, even! Kinda worried of that outcome, you do your best to remain calm and quiet, being extremely careful not to agitate her. So screaming for help is out of the question.

However, Little seems to be eyeing you curiously. You so much as backed away a little and she edged a little closer to you, keeping her dilated yellow eyes locked on to yours. You didnt want to take the risk of getting shrunk even smaller, but you couldnt back away any further. You were at the very edge of the hairloop and it was a long drop down from Fight's head to the ground if her ponytail doesnt break your fall! Either way, youre putting yourself in a really big situation with a really harsh consequence! Which situation sounds better for you?
113211111211111.title: A Little too close for comfort

1132111112111112.content:
You fear the thought of if there are already two Clow Cards in Tomoyo's house, there could be more hiding around nearby. You also fear the thought of being shrunk even further by the one just in front of you. As Little tilted her head a little, gazing at you with almost as much intrigue as Fight did, you pondered really hard about what to do. On one hand, it's a long way down. On the other, you could end up the size of a flea! On one hand, splat. On the other, you'd be next to being completely wiped off the face of the earth. No one other than Little would know what would become of you...

You wrestled around the question for what seemed like forever until you made sort of a mental coin-toss...
...TAILS!
You took a long hard sigh, looked down at the hairloop's edge... and jumped!
"!!" The last thing you saw was Little's face change to a shocked expression before you plummeted.

On your way down, you reached for Fight's hairstrands. You grabbbed a hold of one... unfortunately, you started losing your grip. The hair felt too smooth and slippery. Either Fight musta put some sort of mousse in her hair before she met you (that would explain how she's able to keep that 'unique' hairstyle standing!) or your hands were far too sweaty. Either way, you couldnt hold on for long. No matter how hard you tried climbing back up the pony tail, you only slipped further down. Soon, you reached the very end... and it was STILL a long way down!

Above you, you could see Little defying the laws of physics hopping down the ponytail itself and racing toward you! Just when your hand slipped off the end, Little grabbed you and held you tightly! You were grateful that she saved your life... for about a few seconds! Her touch caused your arm to glow.
"Aw.. no...." You knew what was gonna happen!
The glow became brighter and brighter until finally the brightness flashed right in your eyes, blinding you for a while! You couldnt so much as see your arm in front of you! Just feel Little holding onto it.

"?!"
"What the?!" Sure enough, even Tomoyo and Fight noticed the flash coming from your direction! You felt the entire world around you shift 180 degrees and you didnt feel anything touch your arm anymore!
This was it. Your final fate... as a microscopic splat on the carpet. You wont even get to see your last moments of life. Nothing but bright light all around as you felt gravity pulling you down....

It wasnt much of a fall. In fact, there wasnt much of a splat! There wasnt even a splat at all! Not only did you survive the drop, it was an incredibly soft landing. 'What just happened?!' you thought to yourself as the white light started to fade away and your vision was coming back to you!

"[Your.... name]?" you heard Tomoyo's voice call out to you. In an instant, you saw Tomoyo's head leaning down at you in a mixture of concern and confusion. Strange thing is that her head doesnt look very humongous from your point of view. And she was leaning only a couple inches away from you! "W....What's happened to you?! Youre... big!"
BIG?! You immediately got up off the ground and took a good look at your surroundings. Same room.... only smaller. MUCH smaller. Even Fight was a little shorter than you and Tomoyo was almost half your size! Your new little friend was right! Your back to normal size... at least in THIS universe, anyway! Could the Little have done this? Maybe her shrinking power mixed in with whatever power shrunk you in the first place and canceled eachother out! Speaking of which, where is she? OH WHO CARES?! YOURE BIG AGAIN!

"I'm big again! I'M..." but before you could start jumping for joy, you noticed a different look on Fight's face. Her emotionally-void face looked a bit more threatening as she stared over at you. She even put her arm in front of Tomoyo and stepped in front of her like she was trying to defend her from someone! But from WHO?!
She raised her fists as she glared your direction. Out of curiosity, you turned around... no one else was behind you, which meant she was glaring at YOU!
"F...Fight?" you spoke calmly as you backed away, "Wh-what are you doing?! It's me!" She didnt seem to listen!
Thankfully, Tomoyo even spoken on your behalf. "Wait! Dont hurt him! Dont you remember? That's our friend, [Your name]!" Sadly, Fight ignored her as she stepped closer, assuming her offensive stance!

Geez, what was wrong with her?! Is it because of the size that she doesnt recognize you? Too bad she wasnt in the mood to listen to a lengthy explanation. She's the FIGHT card, not the LISTEN TO REASON card!
"FIGHT! PLEASE WAIT! I-UNGH!!" in a quick instant, she grabbed both your arms and pinned them against a wall! You gotta give her credit. She was strong. VERY strong! You couldnt break free of her no matter how hard you tried. Such is the power of a Clow Card. You finally stopped struggling the moment she squeezed your arms almost to the point where it hurt!

As for your other friend, Tomoyo could only stare in horror as her new friend was left at the mercy of his former colossal captor!
"F-FIGHT!! L...LET HIM GO!!" she screamed to no avail. She couldnt help you.She knew there was no way someone like her could stand a chance against the Fight. Maybe her friend Sakura could... but she was nowhere to be found.

Fight breathed heavily, blowing ice-cool air in your face as her widened aqua-blue eyes stared deeply into yours. With no other options left, you closed your eyes and waited for whatever your gentle captor has in store...
After almost a minute, Fight finally reacted by...
1132111112111112.title: The little one's gone but the fight goes on...

1132111112112.content:
The look on your captor's face doesnt seem very different from earlier. It's practically still her typical blank stare with no emotion... however, you can detect something out of place by the way she's slightly tilting her head and blinking every few seconds as she stares at you.

It's almost as if she's rather curious of the tiny creature in her hand. Despite her serious, unemotional exterior, it seems that Fight is still a child at heart. Almost like a little girl eyeing a brand new Barbie through the window of a toystore!

Although you find it kinda cute, it's very uncomfortable for someone like you. Fight is almost a hundred times your size and she's getting way too close for comfort. That mouse from earlier was big enough to eat you in a single bite or two. All she would need do is barely tip the edge of her hand and take one very slight breath and you'll never be heard from again!

To make matters worse, she's pushing the back of your body closer to her face with the edge of her finger! You want to tell her to stop but the way those huge eyes of hers are staring into your soul with sheer interest make it easier said than done!

"C...c....could you please put me down?" you ask her as politely as possible. Fight doesnt answer. She just continues her stare.
"Please. PLEASE.... PUT ME DOWN!" you say it even louder and stricter, but nothing happens.
"PUT... ME... DOWN!!" you usher your arms downwards trying to 'explain' what youre saying, "DOWN!!! DOOOOWWWNN!!!" It's not working. Out of desperation, you try to use what little Japanese you know once more, "Uh...um.... Shita ni! Shita ni! C'mon, SHITA NI!!"

If you didnt know any better, you coulda sworn you saw a slight smile appear across Fight's face for a brief second. Is she enjoying your little panic attack? Personally, you dont really think of her as sadistic. She did save your life after all. Maybe because she's far too adept in fighting that she's far too inexperienced socially. She IS the Fight card. And fighting's what she's best at!

Just then, she clenched her fist... with you in it! She clenched you in the palm of her hand tightly, but not too tight for you to breath and move around freely. As you wondered just what she was up to, you could overhear her footsteps again as your glove-prison was slowly rocked back and forth! Fight's leaving and taking you with her!

"W...Where are you taking me?!!" you shouted to you even though you know she wont answer, "Where are we going?!"
Wonderful, not only are you shrunk and in a completely different world, youre being kidnapped! All because of a living card's keen interest in the said shrunken creature trapped in her very hand...

"STOP RIGHT THERE!" Just then, you overheard someone's voice call out toward your direction. IN ENGLISH! Is someone calling out Fight?!
Besides that, the voice sounded rather feminine... and familiar. You peeked through the space between your captor's fingers and see the shouter glaring back at Fight...
It's....
1132111112112.title: 'I HAS A TINY!'

11321111122.content: You think about your situation and wonder what you are going to do. Eventually you decide to...
11321111122.title: What now?

113211111222.content:
You decide to go back to the bedroom because you're still in your pyjamas and wish to get changed into whatever's available. You're still bewildered by the fact that someone's kidnapped you but seems to want to make you feel comfortable.

Back in the bedroom you look through the wardrobe and the drawers and are suprised to find that all your clothes and all your other possessions have been brought with you. It's like all your property (both real and sentimental) has been brought along with you regardless as to whether or not it would be of any value to the kidnappers.

Once your dressed...
113211111222.title: Dressed

1132111112221.content:
You hear a strange noise outside the window; it's like a sort of groan, as though a woman is stretching as she wakes only it seems rather echoey. You soon realise that it is the sound of a female when you hear her say.

"I wonder if he's up yet." The voice sounds sweet and familiar, not really the kind of voice you'd expect from a kidnapper.

Just then you feel a series of earth tremors accompanied with faint 'booms' from outside. You can't stand the suspense anymore and throw open the curtains. You gasp in suprise, amazement and alarm. There in front of the window, crouched so she can look into the window, is a gigantic version of Tomoyo Diadouji! You can't believe all this is happening.
1132111112221.title: Setting Eyes on Tomoyo

choices: You were unsatisfied with your life.
11321111122211.content:
"Good morning, little man." Tomoyo greets you, you are still stunned so your reply is a bit iffy.

"G...g...good morn'." You answer, Tomoyo smiles in sympathy for how intimidating she is to you.

"I guess you're not sure what you're doing here." She comments and you nod your head slowly, eyes fixed on her great orbs of deep blue. She holds out her hand to the window as her head rises above the roof of the dollhouse and you hesitantly climb into it. Every one of her digits is longer than you are tall, her thumb alone is twice as big as you. She effortlessly lifts you up into the air as she stands up straight and carries you over to her sofa where she sits down and holds you as close as she can to her face without giving her arm too much discomfort. Your view is of nothing but her beautiful face, looking upon you with affection.

"I know this must be quite scary for you," Tomoyo comments, "But please be assured that you'll come to no harm." You can't understand what she's inferring at the moment but she goes on. "My friend, Sakura, brought you here along with all of your belongings." You are surprised and confused by this, so much so that it shows in your tiny face. Tomoyo smiles at the sight of this and continues. "I told her that I always wanted to take care of a tiny human and, although she was hesitant at first, she decided to try and create one for me. It turns out that, instead, she made a connection with another dimension where she could select any person to become my pet." You let this sink in and ask.

"So why did she choose me?" And Tomoyo answers.

"Because..."
11321111122211.title: Surprising News

113211111222111.content:
"So Sakura summoned you and all your possessions while you were asleep." Tomoyo finishes. "Stuff that you shared were duplicated." You feel ambivalent about this.

"But people will miss me." You answer. Tomoyo nods and explains.

"There's a computer in your dollhouse. You can maintain contact with all your friends and family with it; it's got an address book with e-mails for all of them." You take this in and sit in Tomoyo's palm while you decide how you feel.
113211111222111.title: Satisfaction for Both Parties?

11321111122212.content:
Thinking that it's all a dream you pinch your arm as hard as you can; the sensation of pressure comes through indicating that this is no dream. Somehow you and all your belongings have crossed into a universe based on the anime Cardcaptor Sakura and you're now living in what seemse to be a suprisingly hi-tech dollhouse in Tomoyo's bedroom. The curious thing is that Tomoyo seems to know you're supposed to be here.

Tomoyo giggled at the sight of you pinching yourself.

"I think you would like to know why you're here." She says. It is interesting that you can understand her as though all Japanese and English are automatically translated between you.

"That would be useful." You answer. With that Tomoyo holds out her hand to the window; getting the hint you open it and climb into her palm, confident that she means you no harm. Tomoyo goes to sit down...
11321111122212.title: It's No Dream!

113211111222121.content:
As she went to sit down on her bed, that big carefree smile never left her face. She seems rather excited for some reason. Nonetheless, you waited patiently for her explanation as to what youre doing here of all places... in the some young girl's bedroom in the middle of Japan shrunken down to your size!!

"WELCOME TO YOUR NEW HOME!!!!" Tomoyo shouted in announcement, causing you to fall over surprised. Of course you were more surprised of WHAT she just said over HOW she said it!

"N..n...new home?" those words took you by surprise. Tomoyo simply smiled and nodded her head enthusiastically, "Allow me introduce myself. I am Daidouji Tomoyo, daughter of the Daidouji family household and your new owner. Nice to meet you!" You already knew by heart who she was (except for that last part), but you played along.

"Um... likewise!" you bowed your head, "I'm-"
"[your name]?"
You almost did a double take after you heard her say your name, "W...WHA... H-HOW DID YOU KNOW MY NAME?!"

"It said in the instructions you came with," Tomoyo answered as she pulled out a piece of paper with words written on it, "it also says that youre an exact living replica of actual human being. You do the same things we do, you speak the same languages we do, you eat the same foods we do, only um...." she pinched her finger and thumb together, "...much smaller!"

This is really odd. Does she think youre some kind of pet? ...Or living Ken doll? What couldve possibly gave her that idea?! "Um.. I think there might be some sort of misunderstanding here."

But she just shook her head and continued to smile, "Nope. It says so right on the instructions that youre a gift to me!" She brought the piece of paper close to you to read it. Not that it matters... it's in Japanese. "See? 'To: Daidouji Tomoyo'!"
A gift? Is someone playing a little joke on you?! "Um... just who exactly sent me to you?" you ask her. Unfortunately, Tomoyo just scratched her head, "I dont know. You were left on the doorstep in a little shoebox when I found you. Along with your instructions and a couple of accessories."

So whoever done this to you dropped you off in front of Tomoyo's house and ditched you? Someone's gonna pay for this. In the meantime, you'll need to convince your owner that youre not really a toy!
"Listen, um.. Ms. Daidouji-"
"Please! Call me Tomoyo!" she politely insisted.
"Alright, Tomoyo. The truth is I'm not a toy. I am really a human being... apparently shrunken down to this size. I'm not sure how I've gotten this way in the first place, but-"

"The instructions said that you believe youre a real human, too," Tomoyo interrupted again and you could not believe what she said!
"W...WHAT?"
"It says that you've been pre-installed with fake memories of a life that never existed. You remember friends and family that arent real. They must seem very real to you, dont they?"
You were left speechless after hearing that bit of news. It cant possibly be true, but what if it is?! Everything that you remember before you woke up here... your own life that you thought you had... your mom, your dad... your friends... all those years of growing up... even memories of watching the very show you seem to be stuck in! Could they've all been fake?!

"I....it's not true!! It cant be!!" you try very hard not to panic. You dont wanna believe this, but it's kinda hard not to! It's really scary to think about it.

"Dont worry, little one," Tomoyo smiles at you, "I promise I'll take good care of you. I'll treat you right, give you a nice little home, plenty of food and water, and take you wherever I go!"
That's when she looked out her window, "That reminds me! Why dont we go pay a visit to my friend, Sakura-chan? I'm sure she'd love to meet you."
It doesnt look like you'll be going anywhere for a while... why not?
"Um... or we could just stay here if you like. I dont mind."
113211111222121.title: Everything you knew was a lie.

choices: Let her film start filming you.
1132111112221212.content:
You dont know whether what she's telling you is true or not, heck you dont even know whether or not this is even a dream! It does seem a little odd. Not only are shrunk, in the world of CCS, and in a young Japanese girl's doll house with said young Japanese girl smiling down at you, she's even speaking English (or maybe youre speaking Japanese, but dont realize it!). Hey, it could be worse! You could be trapped in the Berserk world!

"Um... I hope you dont mind," you look up to the towering Tomoyo, trying your best not to shiver and shake, "but I'd like to stay here a little longer."

"Not at all!" your new owner closed her eyes and smiled, "Mi casa es su casa! Whatever that means..." You saw her big hand coming down at you again, but this time she stopped just before she could touch you. "Um... may I hold you?" she politely asked. You couldnt help but 'AWWW' at her politeness.

"Sure, go ahead," you tell her. Joyfully and anxious, she immediately picked you up. This time, she wrapped her fingers and thumb around your body. Not too tightly. She knew youre very delicate. In fact, she could FEEL youre very delicate.

"Wow..." her big blue eyes widened as she stared at you, "you feel so real. You dont feel anything like my Ken dolls." For some reason, you couldnt help but blush at that comment. Unfortunately, she took that the wrong way! "OH NO! Am I squeezing you too hard?! Can you breathe?!" she quickly set you back down, "I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I didnt mean to squeeze you so hard, it's just that I-"
"No no no no NO!" you usher your arms and shaking your head, "Dont worry, I'm fine! You werent squeezing me hard at all!"

"Then... then why was your face turning red?"
A question you did not know how to answer! "Um... uh... it's a..um... just a normal thing that happens to me once in a while!" you tell her as you blushed even more, "S-See? Completely normal!"
Thankfully, she bought it. "Oh. Ok." Not only that, she immediately changed the subject.

"That reminds me!" Tomoyo opened her closet and pulled out that little handy device you know her very well of carrying around... that mini-camcorder! No doubt the tape's filled to the brim with shots of Sakura in compromising positions!
"I think it's about time I start filming someone else instead of just Sakura-chan all the time," she said as she strapped the camera to her hand, "I dont want all my friends thinking I'm weird or something."

'Gee, now why would ANYONE think she of all people is weird?!' you thought to yourself as you snickered a little, which didnt go unnoticed by your young owner!

"HEY! What's so funny?!" she glared rather cutely at you.
"Nuuuuuuthing!" you smiled sweetly at her. Anyways, despite raising her eyebrow a little, she continued, "I have a special project I'm doing at school."
"What kind of special project?"
"A SPECIAL special project," she answers as she popped the lens cap off her camera. Is there something going on she aint telling you? "Anyways, ever since you were brought to my house, I had an idea on what my project's gonna be about. I was thinking sortof a documentary on my little artificial human. I wanna film you in your natural daily habitat... display the differences and similarities between your kind and ours. Compare your outlook on the humongous world around you to ours. See what makes you tick. And most importantly, to show the world how much we have in common despite our size."

Was she serious? "You...you mean..."

"Yep!" she smiled brightly as she stuck the camera a couple inches away from you and looked through it, "I call it 'A Big Day... In A Small World'!"
She thought pretty hard about this, hasnt she? That would explain the rather high-tech dollhouse you woke up in. You could practically live in that alone. Maybe that was sort of her plan from the beginning! To film you in your 'natural habitat'!

On the plus side, it could make you famous. On the minus side, it could have you discovered by lots of people. Some of which are the BAD kind. Some of which might hurt you or kidnap you or use you as a science experiment or something along those lines!
...Nah. Youre thinking too hard. It's just a simple school project, right?

Of course you can trust a nice girl like Madiso-err, Tomoyo, right?

12112.content:
Tohru was very nervous; she knew of the dangers that could result from what she was about to undertake, but saw no alternative. She had to reason with Akito to help free the Sohma family of some of the darker aspects of the zodiac curse, most of which Akito had caused himself, though Tohru would not allow herself to think that way.

He had chosen the place for the rendevous; only he and Tohru would meet there and passersby wouldn't think anything strange if they spoke quietly enough. However there was one thing he hadn't counted on... Hana, Tohru's dangerously empathic friend.

Hana was originally going shopping until she felt a strong surge of electrical waves. One pattern was familiar as Tohru Honda, who seemed to be emitting stress and desperation; the other was unfamiliar to her and carried intense feelings of anger and hatred. Both of these wave patterns seemed to be focused on one particular spot. Hana immdiately set for this location

At their meeting Tohru continually talked about the importance of respecting fellow humans, regardless of their condition, and also expressed a strong moral feeling to help anyone in need, even if all she could do is give comfort to those in need. Akito wouldn't hear of it. Initially he would just shrug off her arguments before putting forward a cold-hearted motivation to leave things as they were. When Hana arrived Akito was becoming more confrontational; he started snapping at Tohru, demanding his right to boss the Sohma family around, to continue advocating the curse of the zodiac and to ensure that the cat remains seperate from the zodiac community. Tohru's pleas for peace and love amongst the Sohmas only infuriates him further and he pulls at her hair again.

"Hey!" Hana cries out in shock and anger. "Leave my Tohru alone!" Akito looks up at Hana in surprise but doesn't give her a second thought.

"There's nothing you can do!" He replies. "I'll be done by the time the police arrive and they're more likely to listen to me than you!" That was too much. Seeing her good friend being abused and receiving such arrogance from someone so mean, Hana unleashed her most formidable weapon.

The electro-poison waves struck Akito hard, causing him to lose conscoiusness and release Tohru. However Tohru had caught the recoil from Akito and fell with a feeling like she had been punched in the stomach, but not too serverely. Something else had happened; Tohru could feel a strange sensation inside her.
12112.title: A Strange Phenomena

12121.content:
Saki was out for the day. She had gone to the fields outside of town with Tohru and Arisa tagging along. Tohru was looking forward to a cheerful day relaxing in the sunny meadows but Saki was here for a different reason.

"I will require your cooperation and your discretion." She told them, Arisa raised an eyebrow in query while Tohru carried an expression of surprise as she always did when hit by a startling new fact.

"What do you mean, Hana?" She asked, Saki sighed and told them.

"The reason I've come here is I wish to try out this mysterious ritual I've been reading about. If worked properly it can enhance your cognitive senses." Both Tohru and Arisa were lost for words.

"Um, well," Tohru finally spoke, "I'm sure we'll do our best to help you. Right, Uo?" Arisa looked between them and finally said.

"Okay, but we must be careful. We have no idea of what we're dealing with."

"Actually," Saki informed them, "I have a pretty good idea."

The ritual was rather Neopagan/Shinto/Anglo-Saxon in its way. Saki meditated for a while while Tohru and Arisa aligned specific flowers in a pattern surrounding her. Once that was done Saki lit some incense sticks in yet another pattern at a closer proximity and began chanting while meditating, during which Tohru and Arisa clapped their hands rhythmically.

Eventually strange lights began to surround Saki and she seemed to be changing in some way. Then what happened next shocked both Tohru and Arisa while Saki seemed oblivious. She was growing!

Saki grew and grew and grew! Soon, even when sitting down, she loomed over her friends. Tohru was positively gobsmacked but was not afraid in any way while Arisa felt uneasy but showed no fear as she did her best to remind herself of who the giantess was.

12312.content:
"Please Sakura," Tomoyo begged her good friend, "It would be such an honour." Sakura had been constantly refusing Tomoyo's request although her pleading was wearing Sakura down.

Tomoyo had popped round to Sakura's house with Sakura knowing that Tomoyo had a request to make. Unfortunately if Sakura knew what sort of request it was going to be she would've probably hesitated to invite Tomoyo round. Tomoyo was asking her to use the Big card on herself.

"I'm not sure," Sakura commented, "Since it will draw attention to myself." Tomoyo was ready for this.

"Don't worry, Sakura," She responded, "I've got the cutest secretive costume for you to wear." She immediately extracted a garment that would hide Sakura's identity much better than any of her previous works. Sakura immediately performed an anime faint.

"I'm still not sure about this." Sakura mentioned.

"Please... Sakura." Tomoyo begged long and hard. "It would be an awesome experience." Sakura thought about this before making her decision.

12313.content:
"Yes." Sakura answered someone talking to her over the phone. "Yes. I understand, Eriol. But... I'm not too comfortable about this." She listened as he made further desciptions of what he wanted her to do. "Okay, see you there. Goodbye." Sakura replaced the receiver.

---

"Okay," Sakura commented, "Please explain to me why this must be done." She was at Tomoyo's house with Eriol and Tomoyo making a discussion with her. Eriol pointed out all the problems that world governments were causing or ignoring and how her magical power could bring an end to it once and for all.

He figured that if she became a giantess then her power would be clearly personified and a steady campaign of non-violent acts of dominance would surely bring various governments to her aid, if they did not actually end up handing over all political power to her.

"But..." Sakura argued back, "What good will it do? What if they see me as a threat?"

"I don't see how anyone could perceive you as a threat, Sakura." Tomoyo commented. While Sakura sweat-dropped Eriol just smiled knowingly.

"People don't usually take such a relaxed first impression, Miss Daidouji." He informed her. The discussion continued for a fair amount of time before Eriol's and Tomoyo's cunning arguments broke down Sakura's reluctance.
12313.title: A Brand New Mission

123132.content:
"Sakura, I was wondering how your power relates to the stars." Kero mentioned one evening.

"What do you mean?" She asked in a tone of puzzlement.

"Well, is it a singular star or plural? Could it be that every star connects with your power?" At this Sakura took a step back, feeling embarrassment and unease well up within Her at this.

"H...How could we find out?" Kero furrowed his brow at this and said.

"When someone's magic correlates with something that everyone knows exists, it is possible to directly tap into those things as an extra source of magic." There was a pause before Sakura offered an insight.

"You mean like with relativity?" She asked, causing him to look at Her in bewilderment. "It was one of the first things we learned in science physics this year. Matter converts to energy and energy converts to matter."

"Ah. That makes sense." Kero affirmed before continuing. "So the best time to look into this would be..."
123132.title: A Chronological Path for Sakura's Ascension

1231322.content:
"EH?!?" Sakura exclaimed. "Kero-chan, we're sleeping over with Tomoyo-chan for her twelfth birthday! Using it as an excuse to examine the source of my magic would be..."

"It would be no different to when you had to turn your back on your brother during a magical incident." Kero's voice had a tone of smugness to it. "Except no one would be in any real danger this time."

"That makes it worse!" Sakura argued. "When lives are at stake it makes sense to put off family meetings as much as possible, even if it is rude." She spoke the last few words quietly.

"Now, now. Tomoyo wouldn't hold it against you, especially if she got the chance to watch." At this Sakura sweat-dropped.

"Um, suppose something went wrong?" Kero took a moment to think about this before answering.

"The worst that could happen is that there's only one star you draw power from and you end up absorbing its power completely." Sakura started at this before he continued. "But even at this time the chances of that happening are thousands to one." Sakura thought back to when he offered to help Her with Her maths homework; it didn't fill Her with confidence.

"Well then, I'll see if Tomoyo-chan will let us when we go."

*****************************************************

In the afternoon on the second of September Sakura stood outside the gates to the Daidouji residence as they opened after She announced Her arrival. She was greeted with the typical enthusiasm and eagerly escorted to Tomoyo's bedroom. After a spot of tea Kero then made his announcement regarding the earlier subject matter.

"Really?" Tomoyo responded. "It's perfectly all right." Sakura was momentarily stumped by this reaction.

"But, we're here to celebrate your birthday, first." She pointed out. At this Tomoyo's eyes began to sparkle as she answered.

"To watch Sakura-chan in her efforts to boost her magic. It's the best birthday gift I could ever hope for!" Once again Sakura sweat-dropped upon hearing this.

During dinner Tomoyo made the suggestion to her mother that they might indulge in some stargazing before bedtime, a suggestion that was accepted but Sonomi advised they should not stay up too late in view of the party planned for tomorrow.

The time came and Tomoyo led Sakura and Kero out to a spot in the garden that offered the best view of the night sky.

"I suppose this does count as stargazing after all." She remarked once they reached the spot in question.

"Okay, Sakura." Kero prepared Her for the practice. "First, summon your wand." Accepting this, though not without a few qualms, She did so and then asked.

"So what do I do now?"

"Close your eyes." Kero advised. "Concentrate. Focus upon your magic. Think about where it comes from. Look deeper, deeper." After some time Sakura's vision was filled with stars of all types; She couldn't help but feel some deja vu.

"I've... been here... before." She murmured. There was a pause as She gazed around Her, every star shone bright, the power flowing through Her filled Her inner self with powerful magic before Kero's voice came through again.

"Find the source." A redundant statement from Her perspective. "Reach for it. Request more from it, just for a while." Sakura reached out, first with Her left hand and then stuck out Her staff, focusing as hard as She could. Suddenly two stars came shooting right for Her; startled all She could do was bring Herself into a more foetal position and stared as the two points of light came right up in Her face. Blinded for a moment She blinked several times before She started.

"Sakura-chan, are you all right?" Tomoyo was a little bit disappointed by the lack of visible magic but still felt she had received her present.

"Two stars," She answered unsteadily, "Just raced right at my face." Kero requested more information, prompting Her to recall everything that happened. Looking closely at Her he noticed two glints in Her eyes that weren't there before.

"They're there." He stated. "Those stars have lodged in your eyes, Sakura." This remark puzzled Her as Tomoyo moved closer to have a look.

"There does seem to be a cute glint in them." She suggested.

"Sakura, do you know what kind of stars they were?" When Kero asked this Sakura thought back very hard as She tried to discern how the stars could've been distinguished under the conditions in question.

"They were bright." She did Her best to recall. "I suppose they were about as big as my eyes." Thinking for a moment Kero spoke up.

"In that astral plain the scale of the stars is based on how they're observed from Earth. I guess they must've been..."
1231322.title: Where Star Power Comes From

12313221.content:
"A type stars?" Tomoyo confirmed what Kero was talking about.

"Since they made right for you, Sakura," He suggested, "They must've been stars that were outside the galaxy."

"How can we be sure, Kero-chan?" Tomoyo asked.

"Stars that can be spotted from the Earth are rather more stable in their positions, so the attraction of Sakura's magic isn't so effective for them, but stars that were not individually identified crave purpose and Sakura offered them that purpose." Sakura's reaction was not all that surprising but they both reassured Her that it was a relatively minor error compared to a few other times. "But now they've lodged in her eyes, their power will be continually boosting Sakura's magic."

"That's wonderful!" Tomoyo declared. "Hey, let's go inside and have some more tea." Sakura was only too happy to do so, although She was a little discomforted when it seemed She was looking down to look Tomoyo in the eyes. It seemed She was having another growth spurt although She was sure She was about level with Tomoyo when She arrived.

In the morning Sakura will have grown another...

Sakura found Herself floating in space. In front of Her was the Earth and She slowly reached out for it when She was startled upon seeing that Her hand actually looked bigger than the whole world.

Sakura stirred and looked around, satisfied that She was still at Tomoyo's place and what She last saw was a dream. Slowly getting up and attending to Her ablutions She returned to stand at Tomoyo's side and gave her a nudge.

"I can only think of three ways to know for sure. One, wait and see how big she'll get in the next few days. Two, measure her overall proportions against someone similar who has no magic. Three, let her give up something she uses every day and see if it still grows."

Naoko was strolling through the nearby forest after school, contemplating the variety of mysterious and frightening entities that could be found in a place like this in a typical ghost story, when she caught sight of a movement in the trees. At first she thought it might be an animal or someone else on a stroll, but she noticed that it seemed to glow an ethereal blue. Curious and thrilled at the possibilities she jogged in its general direction.

Meilin, meanwhile, had opted to pass through the same woods, thinking it would provide a shortcut between the shopping district and the apartment she was currently staying at.

Naoko rounded a corner and was surprised to find the path empty of any evidence of anything or anyone having gone through in the past few hours. As she pondered over this she had this feeling of someone approaching from behind in a stealthy manner. Turning she was stunned to see a female figure some nine feet tall, completely shrouding in that same ethereal blue from earlier on.

"A...Anatahadaredesu ka?1" She asked in a loud whisper. The only response she got was a smile and then found herself tapped on the head with what felt like and almost looked like a baton. "No... No sore wa nanideshita ka?2" But then she found this figure was now moving away from her deceptively fast. "Cho... Chotto, matte!" As soon as she said this Naoko felt a strange warm feeling creeping over her. It began with a sense of being inside an inflating balloon before developing into a sensation of stretching in the fashion of a tree. She watched as little blue dots danced about her and the whole world seemed to shrink away before her.

Footnotes
1  W...Who are you?
2  What... What was that for?

"Hoe?!?" Sakura cried at a modest volume. It was unexpected and not all that welcome, receiving news that there'd be an exam shortly before the summer holiday. There had been a bulletin asking for all girl students from years 4 to 6 to attend a briefing just after the last class; the headteacher there informed them that a new boarding school for girls was opening up and that there was to be an entry exam for anyone who would be willing to attend, albeit they need not accept the offer even if they took the exam as the details of this school would come after applications were submitted.

Stepping out of the school gates, Sakura looked down at the leaflet that highlighted the basics of this new school. She'd been reluctant to go along with this until she found that the new school's head would be Kaho Mizuki, which held great promise for her. Further reading showed a rather high-class accommodation program; apparently every student would have their own bedroom with en-suite, although the rest of the dorm would be communal. This did hold concern for Sakura since this insinuated it'd be very expensive.

"Don't worry, Sakura-chan."1 Tomoyo reassured her as she stepped up along side her, earning a slightly puzzled look.

"Tomoyo-chan, with this much promise the entry fee must be very high."2 Sakura stated in a rather uneasy manner. Tomoyo just smiled and said.

"We've still got some time before we decide one way or another."3

That evening Fujitaka was looking through this leaflet in an ambivalent manner while Touya kept making some seemingly awkward glances between it and Sakura, who was fidgeting slightly with a sense of unease. However it would turn out that...

Sakura was casually reaching into her locker to pull out her necessary materials for the upcoming class when she began to feel the ground shaking beneath her. This was something that she still hadn't completely gotten used to; it was a signal of the arrival of her best friend Tomoyo.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
It had been a few weeks now since both of them had taken and passed the school's entrance exam. During that time, they had come to know all too well that this was no ordinary school, and with a mage as powerful as Kaho running it, how could they have expected otherwise?

No, this school was far from normal. They found that out on their first official day as students, the instant they set foot onto the campus. The moment the two of them walked through those gates, they felt a strange magic entering their bodies. Sakura recognized it somewhat as a similar feeling to when she had used the Big card to grow to colossal size, but for Tomoyo it was an entirely new experience.

Instantly they both began to grow. Sakura's growth spurt only shot her up a couple feet beyond her original height before quickly petering out. As for Tomoyo's side of the deal, she continued growing until she towered over Sakura and even the school itself at a truly gargantuan size, just barely under 1,000 feet tall.

When both of them had stopped growing, Kaho appeared before them to welcome them to their new school. She walked them into a building through a front door that was magically enchanted to expand and accommodate students of any size. The hallways, much the same as the door, were enchanted to expand and allow even one as massive as the newly grown Tomoyo to walk around freely.

Kaho walked the girls through the halls and toward the principal's office, where she would explain to them how everything at this school would work. As they walked, they passed by many other students. Some were smaller than Sakura, some were taller than Tomoyo, but the vast majority of them sat somewhere in the middle. Once the girls arrived at the principal's office, Kaho sat down at her desk and began to reveal everything to them.

She explained their sudden growth spurts, revealing that she had set up a magical field around the school campus, and that for every 1,000 yen beyond the initial entrance fee that they donated, they gained an additional foot in height. This explained why Tomoyo now towered at such a massive size while Sakura's height had barely changed at all. Leaving the campus would revert them back to their normal height, but the extra size on campus was meant to serve as an incentive to encourage more donations from the students. She also explained the school curriculum to them, revealing that in addition to the basic subjects that any other school would teach, Kaho's school would be helping them learn the ways of the magical arts as well. After their briefing was concluded, Kaho handed each of them a class schedule and sent them both on their way.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Sakura was distracted as she thought about all that had happened in such a short time, but quickly snapped back to reality when she heard her titanic friend speak.

"Are you ready for class now, Sakura?" Tomoyo asked as she kneeled down and smiled at her much smaller friend.

"Yup, got all my stuff right here." Sakura replied, patting her bag.

"Alright then, would you like me to give you a lift today as well?" Tomoyo asked, extending her enormous hand out as a platform for Sakura to walk onto.

"Of course, thank you very much Tomoyo." Sakura answered, stepping into her friend's palm and then kneeling down so that she wouldn't fall to her feet as her friend stood back up.

Tomoyo gave her much smaller friend a cheerful smile before walking toward their next class, said class being...

12332222123.content:
Sakura Kinomoto stood at the airport's departure foyer with a strange sense of anticipation and uncertainty. She had only just said goodbye to Her family and to Sonomi Daidouji, which left Her with Her four friends awaiting the call to board their flight.

It seemed rather too crazy to believe, but for Sakura the impossible was merely all in a day's work. Shortly before the Vernal Equinox they had all received from Tomoeda Elementary's reception a letter, each individually addressed, inviting them to sign up for a new boarding school started by Kaho Mizuki on a little known island somewhere between Japan and Hawaii, apparently at a latitude that would allow for the possibility of snow in the winter. They had checked these together, going though them over and over in an effort to figure out just how it could be that she'd successfully opened a private school that didn't require any entry fees or the like but there seemed to be no clauses addressing the issue. However it soon transpired that Tomoyo's mother had actually provided a substantial investment and, as for the others, their parents had received separate letters making surprisingly reasonable donation suggestions.

Now they were here, about to board a plane chartered by Sonomi on their behalf to begin a new long-term style of education. The one thing they could feel reassured about was they knew Kaho Mizuki from before, so each and every one of them figured that it must be at least acceptable. Although the notification that stated it was an all-girl school struck them as being particularly unusual in the context of the rest of the information.

Soon they got the call to board and made their way to the gate and were guided aboard a relatively small turboprop with a cabin containing 12 seats in a 2x2 arrangement. Their boarding passes directed them to the wing seats, except that Naoko found herself sitting in the window seat behind Chiharu. As they sat there a single flight attendant boarded and told them that three more passengers were expected. Sakura was stunned to find that, when they arrived, She'd met them all before. There was Rei Tachibana, two years Her senior, Yuuki Tachibana, who She hadn't seen since sealing the Silent card and wondered if the two were related, and finally the youngest passenger was the girl called Akane who had looked after Kero for a day or two. Sakura cringed a little as She considered what would happen if they all recognised Her; however the more significant issue was the evidence that they too were invited to Kaho's new school. Akane was directed to the rear of the plane across from Naoko while Rei and Yuuki were given the corresponding seats at the front while the attendant seemed to be assigned to the seat right next to Yuuki once she'd made communication with the pilot(s).

There was a modest amount of chat during the flight as they got to know each other, except that the attendant didn't show any sign of being involved in the school itself. It didn't take too long for the three outside of Sakura's group of friends to recall their meetings with Her but Tomoyo did her best to ease things in so as to avoid any awkward explanations regarding at least two encounters. Akane seemed particularly worried about being away from her family and so received a more substantial amount of consoling.

It didn't seem like a particularly long flight, at least no longer than a flight to Hong Kong, before they caught sight of the island at last. It looked quite a bit bigger than they expected and the only discernible town seemed rather closely tucked into the coastline but when the airport came into view it seemed quite substantial all things considered. However Sakura caught sight of something that seemed out of place on the island, like some kind of grand arts gallery crossed with an array of hangers as if to suggest a second airport. As they came into land She noticed one more unusual element to the scenery; there was a great sign about the size of a hoarding upon which was written... ビッグ女の子のための水木学校 The Mizuki School for BIG Girls.

Such an apt name. Kaho's school has an all female staff and all students, along with most staff members, shall spend the school year as giants. However there is as of yet no information as to what scale they'll be at nor how long the period of study will ultimately last. Which is more important to consider?
