12332222123122323221.content:
Once the plane came to a stop the attendant gave the eight girls some instructions about departure on account that this airport had no actual gate for a plane as small as this, so they'd have to wait for a set of steps before they could disembark. Fortunately there were only a couple of minutes where the aircraft was sitting at a complete stop before the door could be opened, although they had a few moments of pause as they considered just who should exit first, eventually opting for an oldest to youngest arrangement with the attendant placing herself right at the back to help Akane along.

Almost as soon as She stepped off the bottom step Sakura caught sight of someone waiting for them, a figure She instantly recognised.

"Mizuki-sensei!" She declared with some surprise but mostly out of joy at seeing a familiar face after all this time.

"Greetings, Sakura-san." She replied as they gathered round her. "And I must say how happy it is to see all of you in attendance." She promptly marked off each of them on her clipboard before continuing. "There's a minibus at the exit ready for us, but due to the... extra special nature of our program I've decided that we should have some lunch in town. This would also help all of you to get any questions you have out of the way, although some of them may have to wait until the last minute before I can answer them." There was a general response of approval from them, just as the flight attendant came up.

"Are you Mizuki-sensei?" She asked with a touch of nervousness; once the reply came she continued. "I won't be available for any return flight until next week, so I want to know just what can I expect while I'm here." Looking a tad uneasy for a moment Kaho glanced between the girls and her before gently leading her away from them before answering in a quiet voice.

"Don't worry about any childish behaviour. Our students are not meant to be roaming the town for their first week, but if any do breach this rule we will have to detain them by way of special measures. As to the staff members, you shouldn't find any of us in town between nine and five during the week but rest assured they've all been cleared as being responsible enough." With that she let the flight attendant get on her way before guiding the girls out of the airport.

123322221231223232211.content:
Sakura was most surprised to find that the driver of the minibus was the same lady who worked as the school nurse in Tomoeda, causing Her to wonder just how many more familiar faces would turn up during the day. The seats on the minibus were similar to those on the aeroplane but with the typical rear bench commonly found on buses and there was no seating plan; Rei and Yuuki both took the left two seats just in front of the rear, Sakura and Tomoyo ended up on the right side on the row just behind the front with Kaho sitting on the aisle seat on the left right at the front, Akane ended up sitting at the window on the right of the corresponding row while Rika and Chiharu sat equidistant from Kaho and Tachibana on the left and Naoko sat on the right side from them.

Though the concept of having an airport at a substantial distance from a built-up area was not unknown the distance they had to travel did seem impractical for the island, especially regarding the distribution of hilly terrain as visible from the windows of the bus. However this did give everyone a good view of the town or city (they had yet to determine which would be a better description) as it sat a little bit below the level of the airport. The open sea glistened right up to the breakwaters of the port, bright yellow beaches branched off from either side of the port and, despite the distinctly modern vibe of the design of the buildings, there seemed to be a clear intent to capture the tone of old-style European construction. One interesting thing about the whole sight was that there was no building more than 10 stories high.

Once they entered the town/city proper another curiosity about the place came to light; the roads were rather wide for the area and traffic levels. Further progression led to further anomalies in that the blocks were generally long and thin and some rather unusual road signs were appearing, apparently reading as 'Beware: Falling Shoes' to the more rationally minded. It soon became apparent that the area covered would constitute a city but the distribution of facilities and the overall population seemed to suggest a town, especially with the periodical town squares appearing with indications of continual construction of what might've been considered works of modern or post-modern art.

1233222212312232322111.content:
Once everyone was settled down and lunch had been ordered Kaho was as ready as ever to answer their questions. The first came from Chiharu.

"How many students do you expect to be attending?" At this Kaho gave a rather wry smile and answered.

"Currently all of you are the only ones enrolled." This caused them to look at each other before Naoko asked the next question.

"So, how can you be sure of staying operational with so few students and with some of us barely having enough to pay entry fees?"

"Apart from Daidouji Sonomi-san providing approximately half of the investment," She answered, "There are a few ways that most of you may not be able to understand just yet?"

"Mizuki-sensei," Sakura spoke up, "If you're the headmaster, and I did recognise the bus driver, how many more members of staff might we recognise?" Kaho locked eyes with Her and replied.

"Quite possibly all of them." There was a pause as they digested this.

"Um, why is the school on this island?" Rei Tachibana asked. "I don't even remember anything about there being an island here."

"Security, Health and Safety." Kaho replied bluntly. "Our security and the safety of the general public."

"Sensei?" Akane ventured. "When might we see our families again?" Kaho gave her a mellow smile in an effort to reassure her and answered.

"Friends and family can book in a visit up to eight times a semester, also you can choose to return home during the holidays and some may even move here; there is a more conventional school available but it isn't run by the same authority as ours."

"Who runs the island anyway?" Tomoyo ventured to ask.

"Actually, it's jointly owned by my family and the Hiiragizawa family." Upon hearing this Tomoyo and Sakura shared a glance that effectively said That makes it easier to understand while their three friends looked at each other as if to say Does Hiiragizawa-san come from a well-to-do family?.

The questions ceased for a while as they enjoyed their lunch before Kaho invited them to ask any further questions.

"So, what makes your school so special?" Rika finally got her question in.

"Well," Kaho was rather more hesitant at this time, "You'll find out for sure when we get there but I suppose you could say it'll give you a whole new perspective on the world."

The total for the luggage had now reached such a level that the empty seats on the minibus were filled with shopping bags.

The journey out of the town was momentarily disturbed when a cargo plane flew in overhead, which caused the girls to catch sight of a rising mountain beyond the airport. Some of them had spotted it before but only now did its true scale really hit home.

There's so much space here, thought Rei as she stared towards the side of the mountain, And those peaks rise so high, surely this island wouldn't have been left off standard maps. But where can an entire island this size appear from in such a short space of time?

The bus rolled on straight past the airport entrance and along an open road running parallel to the runway; once they had effectively left the airport proper behind them Chiharu felt a tad uneasy as she wondered just what kind of school they were going to if it was so far away from the town. By the time they caught sight of any indication of there being any kind of structure out here the runway had run out and the sun sat low in the sky behind them. There, right at the base of a sheer cliff, was a protrusion that reminded them of the canopy found at most petrol stations and up above, about 1,000ft from the road, there was a large structure that looked like a glorified bird hide.

"If I could have your attention." Kaho announced as the bus slowed to a crawl upon reaching an open area that could've been used as a car park. She wanted to inform them that...

1233222212312232322111221.content:
"Due to the conditions required for our school to operate," Mizuki announced, "I'm sorry to say that we'll have to carry all personal belongings in with us." The reactions were of significant unease as to how each of them could transport so much material on foot.

"Mizuki-sensei," Chiharu spoke up, "How can we possibly carry all our luggage in by ourselves?" Kaho gave a wry smile and offered a cryptic answer.

"I'm sure we can all manage at least as far as reception. Once there I'll let everyone in on an easier way." There were a multitude of confused looks, but Tomoyo and Sakura looked between each other as they began to notice something in this that was unusual and familiar at the same time.

The woman who drove the bus provided some assistance in moving some of the luggage from the bus to the door leading to the reception, which struck the girls as most bizarre since it more closely resembled a large garage door, but once that was done she then moved the bus up a side road close to the cliff face. Once it had left what appeared to be some kind of car park or forecourt in retrospect the door began to open. Inside there was what looked like an extension of the forecourt bordered on two sides by a set of steps leading up to an unusually spacious reception area and a long stretch of open space that was reminiscent of a military depot, particularly due to the series of large hanger-like openings parallel to the reception area and the curiously high fence that had some surprisingly wide gaps between and a large sign that clearly was meant to be read from the opposite side. Once everyone's luggage had been brought in Kaho closed the door and asked everyone to gather round.

"This is the point of no return, I'm afraid." She explained. "What you're about to learn could cause a major shock to some of you but it should explain all that's necessary for the nature of this school and," She gave a meaningful look at Sakura, "I'm sure everyone will be all right." For a number of different reasons all eight of them tensed in preparation for what she was going to say. "The reason this school's able to function, its scale and distance from the local infrastructure and why this island's here anyway is because..." Tomoyo couldn't help but feel Kaho was being deliberately dramatic in her choice of pauses, "It's all been done with magic."

12332222123122323221112211.content:
"Ma...magic?" Chiharu double-checked, earning a nod from Kaho.

"M...Mizuki-sensei?" Sakura almost whispered uneasily in response to the decision to let everyone present know about this.

"This is a magic school?" Rei seemed to request confirmation.

"That's amazing!" Naoko declared, which seemed to let the rest of them settle down into this sentiment.

"As a registered school," Kaho explained, "We have a set of written rules that everyone's expected to follow with corresponding consequences of violating them." There was some sense of discomfort that she was talking about this already but a general resignation accompanied this feeling. "Due to our special conditions, as it were, there are some that differ quite strongly from the typical school." She then proceeded to detail the rules and consequences of breaking them:

No one on the school premises is to cause suffering unto anyone else no matter what their scale. First violation: Loss of privileges. Second violation: Reduction to normal-size. Third violation: Suspension.
None of the students may leave the premises in giant form without a permit. First violation: Verbal warning. Second violation: Official reprimand. Third violation: Loss of privileges. Fourth violation: Reduction to normal-size.
Every student receives a set allowance for sundry expenses.
Any damage caused will be reimbursed by the responsible party. First violation: Loss of privileges. Second violation: Reduction to normal-size.
Male visitors and guests must not be taken into any part of the school where the students are liable to disrobe. First violation: Official reprimand. Second violation: Loss of privileges. Third violation: Reduction to normal-size.
Students must allow any guests to leave after a period of one week unless an extension is granted. First violation: Verbal warning. Second violation: Official reprimand. Third violation: Loss of privileges. Fourth violation: Reduction to normal-size.
Every resident of the school has a responsibility to keep the premises neat and tidy. First violation: Verbal warning. Second violation: Official reprimand. Third violation: Loss of privileges.
No student can remain gigantic unless at least one staff member is also gigantic.
Visitors from offshore must book in advance.

"Loss of privileges," Kaho concluded, "May range from the fairly simple, such as extra hours caretaking, to the more hard-lining, where all opportunities for recreation are suspended. I haven't mentioned the disciplinary procedure of some of the rules on account that they're more the responsibility of the staff. Are you all aware of the rules, consequences and principles now?"

There were twin beds which meant, for the time being, they could demark one for sleep and the other for daytime, and there was a nook set up with the essentials for studying along with a built-in wardrobe and even a full-sized bookcase along with all the typical features of a bedroom. The en-suites were distinctly western in style in that the shower was fixed in a 400 foot tall booth.

124111.title: Hikaru (alternative choices)

1241112.content:
As Hikaru continued her journey across Cephiro with her friends Umi and Fuu, the girls decided to take a break in the middle of a clearing to eat lunch. Hikaru was given the task to get water from a nearby river to drink, which she did without hesitation, smiling as she carried a bucket to a nearby river. But when she got there, she saw a figure in the shallow end of the water. It looked like a human boy, no taller than maybe 4 or 5 inches, and he seemed to be entangled in something in the water, making him unable to move as he flailed his arms in worry. Hikaru quickly pulled the boy out of the water and saw that he was entagled in some sort of weeds, which she quickly snapped off from him. Having then rescued the boy and returning him gently to the ground, Hikaru quickly saw herself caught in a puff of smoke, coughing during it.

A few seconds she saw in the smoke the boy from earlier, who was now almost her size! When the smoke disappeared, she got a better look at the boy. He seemed to look no older than 9 or 10 years old, and he had short brown hair, big, green eyes, a skinny build, and was wearing a sleeveless black shirt and tathered, brown shorts that went with his brown shoes. The boy then smiled to Hikaru, kissing her left arm, causing her to blush and freak out.

"W-w-what are you!?" she asked, not so much scared as she was confused.

"I'm Adio", he told the girl, bowing his head to her. "A magic trainee, age 9. Pleased to meet you."

"My name is Hikaru Shidou, age 14. Nice to meet you too", Hikaru happily replied, bowing her head down as well.

"Eh!? You're 14?!" Adio asked in shock, who then noticed Hikaru's head hanging down.

"I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that", Adio quickly apologized, seeing Hikaru's smile return once again.

"That's alright", she told the boy, nerviously waving her hands as the boy continued to look depressed. "A lot of people confuse me for someone younger due to my short stature. I suppose what you did right now was...?"

"Yep, a shrink spell", Adio told the girl, now out of his worried mood from earlier. "As you can see, I'm not quite used to my magic yet. I was trying to levitate my body across the river, actually."

"I see", Hikaru said as she stood right in front of the boy. "So...how DO you do your spells, Adio-kun?"

"I just say some words and it happens. No book, no incantations, no wands or anything of that sort", Adio explained to the girl. "That's about it."

"Neat", smiled Hikaru. "I wish I could do that sort of thing."

"It's actually quite difficult to do so, Hikaru-san. In fact, I'm one of the youngest trainees in the history of the school, and I'm a novice at best."

"But the fact that you could wield such magic must be something you'll be proud of in the future", Hikaru said, smiling yet again. "I wish you luck in that regard." Hikaru then scooped up some water from the lake with the bucket Umi had given her and went on her way, waving good-bye to the boy. "Good luck, Adio-kun", she smiled to the boy once again, but Adio continued to look on at Hikaru as she walked away.

"That girl saved my life", he said to himself. "I made light of her height before, but now I'll make it so that no one ever makes fun of her height again." Adio then concentrated his body, putting his hands to his heart as he began to enchant a haiku that, following it, would make Hikaru about half a foot or so taller.

"Magic that I wield,
Please help this girl grow in height.
Help Hikaru-san!"

Just then the spell he performed manifested into a little beam of light that he aimed at Hikaru, aiming straight at her back. It didn't hurt Hikaru, though: in fact, the girl didn't notice it at all. But only a few moments later, Hikaru felt a strange wamrth all over her body.

"I feel really funny all of a sudden", she said, putting down the bucket. Hikaru then looked at her hands, which were now bigger than her head!

"AH!", Hikaru gasped, noticing her feet growing to twice their original size too. "What's happening to me!?" she asked herself as she watched the rest of her body increase in size as well, from her legs all the way up to her head. Each part grew bit by bit until every part of Hikaru's body, from her toes to her hair, was around four times the size it used to be. The formerly short 14-year old was now a 19-foot tall giantess. Hikaru then looked around her surroundings, more than a little scared of how small everything was in comparison to her. Then she turned herself around and saw Adio, who froze still like a statue at the sight of the giantess Hikaru.

"This is bad", he said to himself in fear. "I only wanted to make her grow to 5 feet and 5 inches or so..." Adio then tried to run, but Hikaru quickly saw the boy and walked to him, which was faster than his running speed. She picked up Adio with her hands, proceeding then to sit on the ground on her knees, placing the boy on her lap.

"Adio-kun, I appreciate you caring about my height and everything", Hikaru smiled a little, patting his head with her right hand. "But being this big kind of...scares me."

"But didn't you always want to be taller?" he asked the girl. "From your reaction earlier, you seemed upset by your height."

"Maybe, but not like THIS", she said, pointing to herself and looking a little scared. Just then, Hikaru heard Umi and Fuu's voices, causing Hikaru to freeze right then and there.

"Hikaru, where are you!? I'm getting hungry!", an annoyed Umi said from a distance.

"You've been gone for a while, Hikaru-san. Is something wrong?" Fuu asked, following Umi. The duo's questions would soon be answered when they got to the river and saw the giantess Hikaru in front of them.

"Hikaru!? / Hikaru-san!?" Umi and Fuu asked at the same time, both in complete and utter shock and disbelief. Umi then proceeded to pinch herself, hoping what she saw wasn't real, only to find out it was when she cried "Ouch" a few moments later.

"H-Hi, guys", a worried Hikaru said in reply, lifting up her left hand slowly to say "hello".

Hikaru slowly stood up to show her friends her new size, her friends standing up right behind her legs. They couldn't believe what they were seeing..their friend, formerly the smallest of the group, towered over them by 14 feet! The size difference was amazing to them! Although worried about her current situation, Hikaru decided to take this opportunity to show off her new size to her friends, who used to tease her for her short stature.

Fuu decided to step in then. "Do be careful Miss Hikaru."

"Alright, I give up." Umi said. Hikaru smiled and placed her once more on the ground before turning to Adio.

1241112112.title: This is GREAT!

12412.title: Alternative Choices

124122.content:
As Hikaru, Umi, and Fuu continued their journey across Cephiro, they found themselves caught in a bit of a windy day. The girls all felt the cold, heavy breezes of wind blowing on them, struggling with each moving step to press onward. While it wasn't enough to, say, lift them off the ground, it did knock them back a little bit. This continued for a couple more hours until the wind started to clear up.

"Finally", said an annoyed Umi, shivering a little from the cold winds that blew on her skirtfor the last 2 hours. "It's cleared up." Hikaru and Fuu, however, simply smiled, glad that the wind had finally cleared up..or so they thought.

Just then, a wind more powerful than the one from before began to blow. It was much faster and stronger now, and unlike last time, capable of lifting the girls up from the ground. As the girls foudn themselves 10 feet (and inching ever higher) from the ground, Hikaru tried to grab her friends' hands. She succeeded in grabbing both Umi and Fuu's hands, but the strong winds made it difficult for them to hold on.

"Hikaru-san, I can't hold on much longer", cried Fuu, finding it difficult to hold on to her friends' hands.

"I'n having a hard time as well", Umi added, looking very worried in the wind storm.

"Keep trying, Umi-chan and Fuu-chan!" encouraged Hikaru, looking worried herself. "We can't give up now. Cephiro is depending on u..."

But before could Hikaru could finish her sentence, she let go her grasp on Fuu's right hand, and Hikaru and Umi found themselves spinning in a sprial far left from Fuu's reach. Fuu, meanwhile, found herself spinning upwards higher and higher and to the right. Usually the most calm member of the group, Fuu was downright scared as the wind blew her every which way, though thankfully she hadn't hit anything during her travels.

Eventually the wind died down, and Fuu found herself proceeding slowly downwards to a small lake below her field of vision. Fuu hoped that the water was deep enough for her to land safely in, a question she found the answer quickly when she landed in it. The water was at least 20 or so feet deep, enough for Fuu to fall in and get out quickly without worry of it being too shallow. Once out of the lake, Fuu started to ring the water out of her school uniform, then proceeded to view her surroundings. But there wasn't too much for the girl to look at: outside of a few bushes here and there, trees, tree stumps, and a lot of grass around the lake area, Fuu couldn't see any animal or person there. Perhaps this was a place unnoticed by travelers?

But then Fuu saw a sight she couldn't believe coming out from a tree stump not too far away..a 10-inch tall ant! Fuu was amazed by its size, wondering if that kind of thing was normal in Cephiro. She then saw the ant nibble a little bit on something she didn't notice earlier in the bushes..some little, red berries in the bush. As the ant ate a single berry from the tree, he grew slightly bigger than he was before. When he ate a few more, the spurts were even bigger. Fuu was absolutely amazed by this.

Curious by the berries, Fuu proceeded to see the bush herself and picked up six berries from it in her left hand. She then heard her stomach rumbling, hungry after walking in the wind for two hours straight. Fuu then looked at the berries in her hand and questioned to herself if she should eat them. What if they were poisonous to humans? What if the effects will be different on her? Fuu was pretty hungry even for some small berries, contemplating until she heard approaching footsteps from nearby. Fuu decided to put the berries in her pocket and look around her. The Magic Knight then quickly drew out her sword, asking, "Who's there?" to the sound in front of her. The figure slowly emerged from the shady side of the tree: it was Ferio!

"Ferio-san!!" Fuu smiled to the boy, coming right up to him. "What a coincidence to see you here."

"I heard something over here and decided to check it out", Ferio told the girl. "That was quite a splash you made. Are you alright? And where are your friends?"

"A little wet, but otherwise I'm fine", Fuu smiled to Ferio, but then looked sad soon afterwards. "I got separated from Hikaru-san and Umi-san in a wind storm.."

"Yeah, it's a pretty breezy place around here", said Ferio, looking slightly worried himself. "I just hope your friends didn't get stranded too far from here. I heard a giant bird lives around the lake area."

"How big?" Fuu asked, nervous.

"About 30 feet tall or so", Ferio told the girl. "Apparently around here there's something that makes the animals grow big." When Ferio mentioned "something", Fuu noticed the berries she picked up before and showed them to Ferio.

"Ferio-san, I think these might be what's causing the animals to grow", she said to the boy, holding up the berries in her left hand.

"Nah. Those things are too small", he said in a teasing tone of voice, plopping the berries, one at a time, into Fuu's mouth, causing her to gasp. "It's probably something else.."

"No, it's true, Ferio-san!" Fuu tried to tell Ferio, pointing to the berry bush she ate from before. "I saw a ten-inch tall ant over there before. And now that you plopped those berries in my mouth, Ferio-san, I'm going to...to..."

"Get sick?" asked a worried Ferio.

"No...", Fuu sadly sighed. "I'm going to get..big..ger."

There was then a pause after this. A fairly long one. But it was broken by the laughter of Ferio.

"You're silly. People can't get that b..b-b.." Ferio continued to laugh until he saw Fuu glow slighty, scaring the girl as she glowed. He then noticed the sight of a growing Fuu, which freaked out even Fuu herself. The 14-year old Magic Knight watched as her body started to expand and grow before Ferio's eyes, beginning with the growth of her shoes, then everything upwards, from her legs, stomach, hands, arms, hair, until finally her head. Within 25 seconds the growth began and stopped, and right before Ferio stood a 40 foot-tall Fuu, her hands on her face in shock at the growth.

"Ferio-san!!" the girl cried as tears came down her face, sittng down butt first onto the ground and picking up the boy in her big hands, placing him right beside her backside.

"Fuu, I'm sorry", Ferio tried to apologize. "I didn't know it was true. I never even heard of those berries before." Fuu then proceeded to calm down, picking up the boy and slowly placing him on her chest. Then she gathered her arms together and gently hugged the boy.

"It was an accident, Ferio-san. You don't need to apologize", Fuu smiled to the boy, blushing a little over his being cute to her at her taller stature. "But now we won't have as difficult a time finding my friends, I suppose."

"And I'll help you find them", Ferio chimed in, looking confident as he placed his right hand on his chest.

"Thank you very much, Ferio-san!" Fuu smiled, hugging the boy once again, which caused him to blush rapidly. "I won't let you down."
124122.title: Fuu's Lakeside Growth

choices: Hikaru stops growing upon reaching her original height
Hikaru goes past her original height...and then some
1241221.content:
Hikaru and Umi thought it was a dream. Yes. It had to have been. How else could it explain how their friend became a 40-foot tall giantess? Only Mokona seemed to be cool with what he saw. Everything else (Ferio included) was simply awestruck to even ask what to do about the current predicament at hand.

"I'm sorry, everyone", Fuu apologized, getting on her hands. "I didn't mean for this to happen.."

"How did you grow so big in the first place, Fuu-chan?" Hikaru, now over the initial shock, asked her giant friend.

"Well...there's these berries from a bsh right behind me that have special powers that allow whoever eats them to grow in size. It seems that each time you eat a single one, it increases your default size by two."

"By two? How do you it's that precise?" Umi hesitated to ask.

"Because when Ferio-san force fed me the berries earlier, I was holding eight of them. And now look at me."

Fuu then proceeded to stand up straight in the air, watching as Hikaru and Umi stood backside to her gigantic legs. Carefully lifting the two normal sized girls on top of one another, Fuu was able to find out that they, indeed, were about one-eight her size.

"Wow! You weren't joking!" exclaimed Hikaru. "I personally wouldn't mind being a little bigger too, actually..."

"I don't think that's a good idea, Hikaru-san", warned Fuu. "I have no idea ow to reverse this, and if I do something else I might only make it worse."

Hikaru paid no mind to what her giantess friend said as she looked at the bush containing the berries. The red-haired Magic Knight noticed that the berries came in several different colors.

"Which color berry did you eat, Fuu-chan?" Hikaru politely asked her.

"They were blue. Why?"

"Because I see three other colored berries. Red, purple, and orange...."

Hikaru then grabbed a hold of two of each of the three different colored berries that Fuu didn't previously eat and held them in her hand. She then experimented with one of the orange berries, plopping it in her mouth and waiting for something to happen. Indeed something did...though it was no better than Fuu's growth. Umi gave Hikaru a very frightened stare.

"What's wrong, Umi-chan? You look sc...huh? What's wrong with my voice!?"

Hikaru still hadn't realized yet that she had shrunk to only a fifth her regular size! The berries she once held easily in her hand now felt like miniature bowling balls. Mokona looked like a full-sized bear. And Fuu looked even more like a towering giantess than she had earlier.

"Ah! What's going on!?" the short girl began to cry, slowing putting the red berry in her mouth. It wasn't easy, though, as its much bigger size took much looker for it to be gulped down that the orange berry did. Hikaru found herself relieved that she was slowly growing again, but no one knew how long it would last..

1243111.content:
Miho looks like your typical 9 year-old girl at first glance. But in reality, thanks to the help of two plush-sized dinosaurs, she has the ability to transform into a beautiful 15 year-old idol singer under the name Fancy Lala. Today, however, was one of Miho's days off, and the eager girl was in her room drawing away on her bed. One of her dinosaur friends, Mogu, was curious as to what Miho was drawing.

"What's that?" Mogu asked Miho as she drew. Upon questioning she stopped and proceeded to look at her.

"It's me standing next to a house," the cheerful girl explained, her picture showing her roughly thrice the size she normally was.

"I don't know recall you being that tall," Mogu told Miho in reply, causing the girl to giggle.

"Oh, I know. I drew it just for fun. Though if I DID end up that tall, it would be quite weird. Think of how much I would have to eat. My room would probably have to be rearranged just for me to sit down." Miho continued to smile to herself as she continued to draw. Of course, now that she talked about being bigger, curiosity sparked the little girl's mind. Miho got out her magic sketchbook and pen quickly drew up on a bottle the size of your typical water bottle with the words "growth potion" on it. She then said the words "dabu dabu", causing the bottle to come out of her sketchbook and plop down on her lap.

At first glance, there was nothing special about it. Aside from the words "growth potion" labeled on it, it looked like a typical water bottle. But for the sake of curiosity Miho quickly drank down its contents, causing Mogu and Pigu to look out in shock as to what she was doing. When she finally finished up the water she placed it in the trash bin in her room and then sat back down on her bed once again. The girl impatiently waited for something to happen, and the seconds turned to minutes, and then to hours. Lunch passed, dinner passed, she did her homework, she got a bath, and still no sign of growth. Even when she went to sleep she felt nothing, sleeping a peaceful, non-eventful sleep...at least for a while.

In what had to be pure irony, though, the growth started the next morning, which was a Sunday. As Miho was picking out he clothes for the day, the girl felt a strange surge in her body, like she had just been punched in the gut. She quickly ran over to her mirror and noticed she was growing! Miho was now at least a little over 5 feet high, about the height of most high school girls. She grew an additional 5 inches while staring in the mirror, now up to the height of 5 feet and 8 inches. Though her clothes were keeping up, Miho still thought it was weird that she was actually growing. She quickly proceeded to wake up Mogu and Pigu, who were more than a little shocked when they saw a 6 foot tall Miho before their very eyes.

"What happened?!" Pigu asked in shock and awe. Mogu was too speechless to reply.

"It turns out I can make myself bigger", Miho fake laughed, trying to cover up the fact that she was actually fairly scared of growing bigger. The spurts were getting bigger, and the length between them shorter. In less than a minute Miho grew from 6 feet to 6 and a half, then to 7 feet and 3 inches, then 8 feet and 8 inches, and then almost 11 feet. Miho finally stopped growing at 15 feet, the girl sitting butt down on the ground, her knees bending to prevent her from kicking down her own room's walls. As Miho observed her new size, she wondered what to do next.
1243111.title: A New Day, A New Height

choices: Miho suddenly remembered she had a photo shoot that day
12431111.content:
Miho decided to climb out from her bedroom to the tip top of the house, where her family kept a foray of flowers growing all year round. Being at that place always cheered her up even on the gloomiest of days, and it was really nice and bright outside today as well. Of course, at her new height she had to be careful about the ladder that led her up there, and she had to be even more careful about knocking the plants over..

Still, Miho made her way up there with no problem, pausing and stretching as she saw not only the plants, but the neighborhood as well. At her new height she was able to observe the town quite well, even seeing her friend Akiru's house from her perspective. Seeing the town at this new mini-giantess size almost wanted Miho to grow some more to see the town from a higher perspective. Almost. Unless, of course, something came up for the girl..
