1313321.content:
Hana and Uo awoke to find that they had somehow fallen alseep in a large traditional Japanese house. Looking around their initial thoughts were that they passed out in Tohru's room at Shigure's house but something was a miss. They couldn't make out the surrounding scenery but they were sure that it wasn't the woodland that you could see for miles at Shigure's.

"This is very strange." Hanajima commented in her classic monotone. "I can feel Tohru's waves coming from this area but I am unable to pinpoint her location."

"Well, that's a load of help." Uotani sarcastically retorted. "But I'm not worried; if Tohru's here she'll find us." She leaned back on the king size bed that was the central feature of the room they were in, hence their original assumption that they were in Tohru's present accomodation with the three Sohmas. No sooner had Uotani relaxed that tremors started up with such a rythmic pattern that they seemed unnatural.

"Tohru's waves are getting stronger." Hanajima commented as the tremors continued and the amount of light entering through the balcony window/door became significantly lower in such a short length of time. "She's outside."

"HANA, UO, HELLO!" Tohru greeted them, her voice booming and echoing around the room. Her sudden greeting caused them to jump and turn to the sound only to find themselves looking into the enormous vista of Tohru's face outside, beyond the balcony, bigger than than the door to the balcony!
1313321.title: Tohru's Tiny Friends

13133211.content:
Neither Uotani nor Hanajima could've prepared themselves for the sight of a ginormous Tohru; for a while all they could do was stare at the enormous blue eyes peering in at them as Tohru leaned in for a closer look at her tiny friends. Before long both Uo and Hana were having trouble standing up straight as they found that one of Tohru's eyes was bigger than the door/window that led to the balcony.

Eventually Tohru's eye lifted away, leaving Uotani and Hanajima flabergasted at what they just saw, trying to convince themselves that it's all a dream. Just then they looked out across the balcony to see Tohru's equally gigantic hand reaching into the bedroom. They recognised Tohru and had some trust in her but Tohru's immense scale made her so intimidating.
13133211.title: Tohru, a Titaness?

131332111.content:
Uotani's confidence in Tohru coupled with her general strong will and Hanajima's cool head and compassion for Tohru prevented them from losing their nerves as Tohru's mighty hand reached through the window/door. They really felt small now that they saw how tiny the king size bed looked in the shadow of Tohru's hand, her fingers already arching over them just as her wrist came in from the balcony. Uo wasn't sure if Tohru would be able to handle them without damaging the room and/or anything in it and Hana didn't think that Tohru could pick them up at such a massive size without taking the bed as well. Somehow Tohru managed to gently slip her two friends into her palm before wrapping her tree-sized digits around them, forming a protective wall around them with her fist.

Carefully withdrawing her hand from the bedroom, Tohru concentrated as hard as she could to prevent herself from dropping or squashing her tiny friends, who she felt such compassion for that they were the only ones she could treasure more than any of the Sohma family. Once she got her arm in a comfortable position, since she was already in a comfortable seating/standing position, she carefully released her grip on Uo and Hana. As Tohru looked down on them all three of them clearly understood their size difference; Tohru was a mighty mountain goddess to Uo and Hana and they were cute little insects to her. Eventually Uotani found the confidence to break the ice.

"W...What happened to you, Tohru?" She asked her massive friend who, in turn, smiled one of her sweet disarming smiles and replied.

"ACTUALLY IT'S YOU." Hana and Uo looked stunned, just as Tohru's smile faded into one of worry and concern. "I...I SHRUNK YOU." They were bowled over by this. "I'M SORRY, BUT I..." Tohru struggled to explain how she felt at the time before Hanajima cut her off.

"It's all right." Hana commented. "We owe you so much in life that I'm sure we would both give you anything at all in return." Uotani did not argue and Tohru expression of stress faded as her itsy-bitsy friends showed acceptance in their new size.

"So," Uo asked the titanic Tohru, "How did you manage this?" And Tohru began to tell her story of...
131332111.title: In Tohru's Hand

choices: "It started out just like any other day..."
1313321111.content:
"YOU SEE," Tohru informed her miniaturised friends, "I'VE DISCOVERED THAT I HAVE A POWER THAT ALLOWS ME TO CHANGE THE SIZE OF ANYTHING I WISH." As this revelation sank into them both Uo and Hana felt themselves being lowered as Tohru set them back inside the master bedroom of her specially made dollhouse. "I'LL JUST POP IN." Tohru mentioned as they looked up at her through the balcony door/window.

Just as she said this Tohru moved to sit on the edge of the table upon which the dollhouse was positioned. Going out onto the balcony Uo watched as Tohru shrank herself just by concentrating, so Tohru went from being this godlike mountain to being simply a tree-sized girl from their perspective. Once Tohru was only a head taller than the dollhouse she stood up on the tabletop and walked over to the 'house.

"That was incredible, Tohru!" Uo exclaimed, although seeing Tohru as bigger than Godzilla was overwhelming enough.

"Am I less intimidating now?" Tohru asked them as they stood on the balcony.

"I don't think we could ever describe you as intimidating." Hana commented. "But you are easier to comprehend when you are only about ten times bigger than us." Tohru simply smiled and then shrank even smaller until she could enter the main door to the 'house.

As Tohru made her way up the stairs Uo and Hana exited the master bedroom and went towards the stairs before they met on the landing.

"Wow." Uo commented. "You're more powerful than Hana here." Hanajima did not argue and simply said.

"It is astonishing, Tohru. Could you tell us how you discovered this power?" Tohru nodded and led them back to the master bedroom. Once they were seated on the king size bed Tohru began.
1313321111.title: Tohru's Mysterious Power

choices: Hana convinces Tohru and Uo to stay small a little while longer
Saki stays small, Tohru and Uo return to normal size
13133211111.content:
"In a dream", Tohru began to explain. "I visited a strange house in the middle of a wide, grassy field. However, there were no other animals there, or other people either. all there was was a single house in the center of the field. I went inside to ask someone where I was, but only saw a bottle and a note.

"The note talked about how the person knew I felt 'too small' at times when it came to having my opinions heard, which is weird because I don't think like that at all. It then explained that the drink was just a simply, ordinary drink, but that it contained a 'special something' just for me. I didn't drink the bottle, but when I woke up the next morning it was beside me next to my bed!"

"Hmm...that's quite odd", observed Hana.

"Well, that morning I thought that Shigure-san left me a drink or something for me to drink. The night before I came home late from work and was very, very tired, so I headed right up to my bed to sleep. Then I drank the drink the first thing this morning! And shortly after I shrunk to an even higher smaller height than we are right now! But then I wished to be normal sized again, and thus I grew back to normal. I also went to see if I could shrink by thinking about them as well, and I imagined my bed pillow shrinking to a tenth its size. It worked! It was really strange! But I didn't tell anyone else about it yet because I didn't want to burden them or upset them.."

"Then how did we shrink?" wondered Uotani. "I don't remember coming up to your room.."

"Well you see, when you and Hana-chan came by earlier this morning, I must've bumped into you guys and imagined you shrinking accidentally! I brought you up here as quick I could before anyone saw you."

"And you were waiting for us to wake up?" Hana asked her worried looking friend, who simply nodded in response. "Hmm....that's quite interesting."

"I guess, but I'm not a fan of being tiny. Tohru, you can reverse this any time, right?" shrugged Uotani as she left stepped further away from the room.

"Sure can!" Tohru replied with a smile. "As soon as we leave the dollhouse, I'll return you two to normal size."

"Actually, this is quite interesting..", Hana stated. "I never imagined shrinking would be part of our future when I first met you, Tohru-kun.."

"Eh? What are you saying, Hana-chan?" a confused Tohru asked her friend.
13133211111.title: Wish and you shall recieve!

13133211112.content:
"It started out just like any other day," Tohru told her friends, "I was just going about the housework as usual when I found I was having trouble cleaning under the chairs. I couldn't help but think that it would be better if I could get under it more easily, and the next thing I knew the cleaning materials and I shrank down until I could practically walk under the chair."

"And this never happened before?" Hana inquired.

"No," Tohru replied, "I did have childhood fantasies about changing size but it never really happened... until now. Anyway once I had made sure that the floor underneath one of the chairs was clean I came out into the open and looked around the room. No one else was in the house at the time since Kyo was training at a dojo, Yuki was out shopping and Shigure was visiting... some of their extended family." She did not want to say too much about the main Sohma house in case it sounded suspicious to her friends. "As I was saying I looked around the room and knew that it would take me years to clean the house at such a small size and wished I could be normal-size again and then I grew back to normal along with everything I'd been using under the chair."

"When was this?" Hana asked, Tohru thought for a moment and answered...
13133211112.title: Awakened Power

131332111122.content: Tohru thought back between now when she and her friends were sitting together in her dollhouse and when she first shrank herself and told them that the time that had passed was...
131332111122.title: A Month Ago?

1313321111221.content:
"One month ago." Tohru answered Hana's question. "Many complicated things happened in that time from a combination of my efforts to control myself and events relating to when I deliberately made things change size." Uo looked a bit concerned.

"What about us?" She asked. "How did we get into all this?" Tohru stared at her feet now and Hana could already get an idea of her answer.

"Last night," She answered, "I had worked late and so I was dashing back." Hana and Uo thought back to the previous night and remembered that they were going to pay a visit to Kyoko's grave as they sometimes did when they were worried about Tohru. "I must've suddenly bumped into you because I remember picking myself up and suddenly noticed that you were both unconscious and had shrunk to the size of mice; I couldn't help but think about how cute you looked and that caused you to shrink down to this size. I panicked at first and just scooped you up and slipped you into one of my pockets before I understood what I had to do. It was a tricky business but I went round to your places and gathered all your belongings and brought them back home with you two," She indicated the two stacks of luggage in one corner of the room, "And I put you two on this bed to give you some comfort. I wanted this morning to be a revelation for you." There was an emotional pause. "How do you feel about this?" She asked them.
1313321111221.title: A Slip-Up and a Soft Spot

13133211112212.content:
"I admit I was nervous," Uo said in answer to Tohru's question, "But now that I think about it it's kinda neat." Tohru looked rather surprised by this response. "I know I was aspiring to be six feet high but I might as well settle for one-sixth of an inch." The humour in her statement was all too clear for Tohru and even made her smile with a sense of satisfaction.

"It is a most out of the ordinary experience," Hana commented, "Although I do feel that this is destiny at work." Tohru was now in total bewilderment.

"Y...You're okay with being this small?" She queried. Hana just smiled at her and mentioned.

"You have given us so much in life, Tohru. We owe you so much that to give up our freedom to you is the least we can do." Tohru was stunned by this; Hana had just said that she'd be happy to give up all her rights as a person just to be her 'pet' as it were.

"Thinking of all that you've done for me," Uo added, "And the way I treated you when we first met I think I owe you much more than just my freedom." This was totally confusing to Tohru; she couldn' think what Uo would give her that would be more valuable than her freedom.

"Y...You're both seriously willing to remain like this?" She asked them, still at a loss for what they had said.

"It's not just a gift to you, Tohru." Uo answered. "Considering the responsibilities and problems we have and would encounter if we were normal-size I think it is yet another gift from you as well. I'm in no doubt that we owe you much more than simply our freedom." Tohru was still nonplussed; totally unaware at what Uo was trying to insinuate.

"Please," She mentioned to Uo, "What are you saying to me?" Uo made a knowing smile, which carried a hint of nervousness, and answered.
13133211112212.title: Tohru's New Pets

choices: They can serve her if they want
131332111122121.content:
"I'm sure that Hana would agree when I say that we are your humble slaves." Tohru stood agog at this, Uo was openly stating that they could be her slaves and work all day and night and only get the essentials of life in return.

"I...I couldn't make you my servants!" Tohru declared.

"Maybe not," Hana responded, "But we can make us your slaves." Tohru was still trying to get over this.

"I wouldn't want to feel that you're being forced to do things for me just because I can change the size of anything I focus on." Uo put her hand on Tohru's shoulder.

"You're not forcing us," She said, "We're openly volunteering. All you have to do is put us wherever we can reach what you'd like us to do and then ask us to do so." Tohru kept going over this in her head. Already they had accepted being hers but now they were willing to be enslaved. What is her decision?
131332111122121.title: Pint-Sized Chambermaids?

131332111122122.content:
Uo stood up and took Tohru's hands in hers as she prepared to explain herself. "I can give you my life." She told her. Tohru's eyes opened wide in shock; although she knew that Uo was offering to die for her she still did not know exactly what Uotani had in mind, but Hana had caught on to the idea and began looking between Tohru and Arisa.

"Are you really willing to...?" Hana asked, leaving the end of the sentence hanging in the air, knowing that Arisa would catch on.

"Yes." Uo answered before addressing Tohru again. "Tohru, if you can change the size of anything at all that means that you can look upon me as you have done as a tiny insect." The confirmation exclamative was left off as the way she said the sentence meant that Tohru could easily recognise the context.

"Yes." Tohru's answer had hesitation in it, pointing to her confusion.

"That means that a grain of rice could be as tall as I am." Arisa continued; the penny must've been dropping by now. Tohru's intense gasp indicated that she was catching on to Uo's insinuation. Barely two seconds later tears began to well up in Tohru's eyes.

"I couldn't do it!" She cried out, leaping to her feet. "I couldn't kill a person willingly! And that would be... MONSTROUS!" Uo put her hands on her shoulders.

"I'm sorry." Uo told her. "I didn't mean to upset you. However I do admit that I wonder what it would be like." Tohru's frantic behaviour calmed down and her watery eyes stared at Uotani.

"But," She informed her, "If I did it... you wouldn't be here anymore."

"Oh, yes I would." Uo commented with a sense of wit about her. "I would be one with you." Now Tohru got a determined look on her face.

"Uo." She declared, staring right in her eyes. "I want you to promise me that you'll never attempt that without my knowledge!" Uo looked at Tohru and could plainly see that Tohru wanted to keep her best friends alive.
131332111122122.title: Uo's Unusual Idea

13133212.content:
"The curse occurs three days after it's cast." Hanajima had told them. After the initial fear the Prince Yuki Fan Club felt sure that she was just bluffing but the third day came and the curse slowly came true.

For a few days there wasn't much to go on. Everything seemed to be going normally until one of the girls attempted to confront Tohru again and felt uneasy that she had to stand on tiptoe to confront her before her friends turned up.

"Why don't you drop it." Uo told the girl. "Yuki Sohma is not your club's private property, you know." This fan club girl knew about Uo's height but found her to be more intimidating than usual. Hana noticed the expression on the girl's face.

"Perhaps I can give you an explanation." She suggested and led the girl away from Tohru and Arisa, in spite of this girl's fear of Saki's powers.

Once they found a quiet spot Hanajima reminded her of the day she and two other fan club members visited her.

"I did say the curse would take three days." She told the girl, looking down at her.

"But," She complained in insecurity, "It's been seven days since we visited." Hana did not move.

"It is a slow-progress curse." She replied. "In case you hadn't noticed you're shorter than Tohru and myself." This girl looked bewildered. "The fact is that every member of the Yuki Fan Club is slowly and steadily shrinking."
13133212.title: A New Curse

131332121.content:
"What?!?" The fan club girl cried upon hearing Hana's words. "What do you mean by that?" Hana did not twitch a muscle.

"Exactly what I said." She replied. "You and every other member of the Yuki Fan Club shall constantly shrink, losing one percent of their height in four days, meaning that now, according to compound interest rules about percentages, your height is ninety-nine percent that of your original height." This girl understood that Hana had been studying thoroughly for her exams and so had managed to grasp the idea of compound interest. She attempted to do the same.

"My height has been five feet exactly." She thought out loud. "So if I take two percent from five feet I'll be..."

"Four feet and nearly eleven and a half inches." Hana finished for her. The fan club girl just shrugged her shoulders.

"It'll be hard to notice losing so low a height." She commented.

"What you fail to realise," Hana informed her, "Is that in a month you'll be four feet and just over seven and a quarter inches." The girl felt even more uneasy. "And there is a chance that it'll accelerate." Now this girl felt even more uneasy. Hana swiftly departed before the girl could inquire how thin a chance. She rushed back to the club to inform, check and discuss this situation.
131332121.title: One Percent?

1313321211.content:
Because this shrinking curse on the fan club was, at the time, a slow and steady process the girls did what they could to live with it. They were still suspicious and confrontational and simply tried to publicly ignore their loss of height. A few, including the club president, noticed that this was real shrinking as their weight was decreasing and their proportions remained the same. They were thankful that their clothes shrank with them.

Eventually they notified that it was a month since the curse must've been put on them, so they measured the height and weight of each member to see if they were simply slightly short girls from a one percent loss every four days. The girl who discovered the fact was horrified when she compared expected and actual height losses. Instead of being four feet and just over seven and a quarter inches she noticed that she had shrunk to four feet and a little over five inches. This meant that every fan club girl was now shorter than Tohru and the curse had accelerated to two percent every four days or one percent every other day.

"This is getting creepy." Another girl said when they all looked at the figures. "People are staring at us."

"Our pens and pencils are getting cumbersome." Another added.

"At this rate we'll all be under four feet high by next month." The president commented. "We'll have to make a decision." They begin to debate on whether or not to disband the club in the hope that the curse is only on the club and not the girls.
1313321211.title: Compound Interest and Deflation

choices: Two Percent Reduction for the Next Month
13133212112.content:
"We'll stand fast!" Motoko Minagawa, Yuki Fan Club president declared. "We will not be dictated to by a demoness. This club shall continue and we'll undergo a major recruitment drive so others shall receive the same fate." With that they immediately began planning various methods of getting most of the remaining girls in the school to join the club.

A few days later Hanajima was walking down one of the school corridors when a strange poster caught her eye; it had a photo of Yuki Sohma taking up a good portion of it and it was half an inch lower than most normal wall posters. She scanned the words. It read: "Don't let him be sedcued. Join the Prince Yuki Fan Club and save the school president."

"They are stubborn." Hana commented. "But they are fools. Anyone who joins shall be rapidly down-scaled to be amongst them, anyone who leaves shall no longer shrink but will not return to normal size. This curse is very strong but it'll have to be done to protect Sohma and Tohru." She ripped the poster from the wall and threw it in the bin. "Once they're less than two feet high I shall start my bit in this mission. Those who endanger Tohru shall not last."

The Prince Yuki Fan Club members all had their height and weight measured every month since the day they received the curse. They did get some more recruits who were shocked by their height loss until it was explained and, to Motoko's relief, the intensity of their shrinking did not increase by the next month. However there were other things to worry about.

Last week three die-hard members once again made a confrontation of Tohru, but they were getting close to the four foot mark at the time so Tohru was more surprised by their height than by their anger. The tallest of them only came up to Tohru's chin. Once Uo and Hana came along they were scared both by the fact that Hana had some influence over her younger brother so they thought that she could (indirectly) make their shrinking faster and by Uo's height, since she was a head higher than Tohru.
13133212112.title: Futile Defiance

131332121121.content:
During the next month Akito reached his thirtieth birthday and, due to the Sohma curse, died. Someone else was to be placed in this role in the curse but who that would be had yet to be decided. Tohru had noticed that members of the Prince Yuki Fan Club were getting shorter but she did not think it was anything serious. Nevertheless, the arrogance and selfishness of the club members would prove to be the catalyst for their shrinking.

Once the third month anniversary of the Yuki Fan Club curse arrived their heights and weights were measured once again. Of course certain elements were proving to be disturbing, like sitting at a school desk. The figures came through: Now it turned out that someone who was five feet high before the curse was now two feet and just under ten inches. Now they became reclusive as they attempted to find ways to adapt to the much larger world around them, avoiding contact with teachers and students alike but their HQ was still evident to the school as a locked room with signs that warned of anyone entering without seriously considering joining the club.

As Hanajima looked at the door she smiled slyly as she said to herself.

"It won't be long now. It'll take more than a lock and a threat to keep me away." She then set off to find Tohru and Uo.

Inside all fan club members adapted a self-sufficiency program. They took an undercover attitude whereby the sneaked round school during the night to salvage bare essentials and other materials for their aim to take revenge of Tohru and her friends in any way possible. However their extreme loss of height was due to their shrinkage being at five percent a week.
131332121121.title: Into Hiding

1313321211211.content:
The Yuki fan club continued to make plans on how to get revenge but their rapidly dwindling size made any plan they thought up become impossible to preform as they would suddenly lose another inch or two. They had also noticed another aspect of the curse, nobody thought that their lose of height was a big deal. Sure they noticed that the Yuki fan club had lost over three feet in height but no one really made a fuss about it.

Then the day came when the Yuki fan club found themselves to be the babyish size of two feet, just twenty four inches, tall. By now many members of the club where having second thoughts about their choice and where thinking about cutting their losses before they got any smaller.

[Click]

The door to the club room suddenly unlocked and the sound it made caused the gathered girls, seventeen in all, to shudder as they felt a cold, foreboding, pressure go down their spines. They watched with growing fear as the Demon Lord, Saki Hanajima, herself entered the club room, carrying a small box and with a small smile on her face.

"Wha... What are you doing here!" Minami called out as she stood in front of the other club members who were huddled behind her in fear.

Saki put down the box, smiled at the small group and calmly replied.

"I'm here to collect you all."

[SNAP!]

She snapped her fingers and suddenly the group found themselves rapidly shrinking to the tiny size of...

6 inches. (Doll size/Full Insertion size)

4 Inches (6 inches + Mouth Play Size)

2 inches (4 inches + Swallowable)
1313321211211.title: Plans end before they can begin

13133212112112.content:
The girls of the Yuki Fan Club could only stand their wide eyed as their already small two foot height diminished to a size of a girl's doll, AND THEN CONTINUED TO SHRINK!

With in ten seconds of the Demon Lord snapping her fingers the girls realized that they were now...

4 inches tall

Smaller
13133212112112.title: Smaller than a Doll

131332122.content: This involves the cast and setting of the original anime but without the Sohma curse. Instead Tohru Honda will awake one day to find that she herself is suffering from a curse that causes anyone she sets eyes on to shrink down so that her thumb would appear to be six feet long to them, however it is one shot and no matter how many more times she looks at them they will not get any bigger or smaller. Do you want to continue?
131332122.title: Alternative Version

choices: Tohru finds somewhere for the others to sleep in
1313321221.content:
Tohru was just helping out with the housework as she always did in return for her room and board at Shigure Sohma's household where his relatives Yuki and Kyo lodged with him. The Sohma family themselves had no curse to deal with but they did have close ties and Kyo had a tendency to see Yuki as a rival to his ambitions seeing as how Yuki often got in on family games even if he didn't want to and Kyo, even though he wanted to join in, all too often got rebuked due to the reputations of their parents. Just as Tohru had entered the living area she found Shigure sitting down, going over a manuscript, when he suddenly appeared to have disappeared before her eyes; she was so surprised that she dropped all of her cleaning materials and rushes over to where he was, and soon noticed that he had suddenly become barely two inches tall.

"Shigure-san?" She whispered, struggling to come to terms with what happened.

"H...Hey!" He replied. "What just happened? Why does everything seem so huge?" Tohru just shrugged her shoulders and, concerned for his safety, held out her hand for him to step into. Once he was sure of her intentions Shigure accepted her offer and, unsure of what to do next, Tohru just slipped him into her pocket and went back to the cleaning.

Only half an hour later Yuki came in from his vegetable patch and, upon seeing Tohru dealing with the dishes, said hello and, just as she turned round and began saying hello back, he too spontaneously shrank. She quickly dried her hands and went over to rescue him from the dangers of being in a giant world; unlike with Shigure Tohru just snatched him up with speed. She was now wondering if the house was now making men shrink so she decided to go out to where Kyo was practicing his martial arts after putting Yuki in another one of her pockets.

Upon setting eyes on Kyo he shrank too, whereupon Tohru leapt at where he stood and crouched over the tiny figure she had seen only seconds earlier. Picking him up she returned to the living area and set everyone down on the table.

"Why have you all become so small?" She asked.

"You tell me!" Kyo responded. "One minute I'm just minding my own business and the next thing I know you're looming over me!" Tohru apologised for her fast actions and explained her concerns for them.

"You don't think," Yuki suggested, "That for some reason everyone you look at becomes this small?" In spite of how rediculous it sounded Tohru felt as though that was exactly what was going on, between when Shigure shrank and the last time before that when she saw somebody she did have this bizarre feeling in her gut.
1313321221.title: Tohru's New Life

choices: One or More of Them Question the Convenience
Tohru leaves to get them some dinner
13133212211.content:
Making sure that the three Sohmas would be all right on the coffee table Tohru went around the house, looking for somewhere that would suit them. As luck would have it she found a dollhouse that was just the right size for them; it was rather classy compared to their original home with much sturdier walls. As Tohru picked it up and wondered where it would work best she couldn't help but think it was too easy to find this miniature house, especially since she'd never seen it before.

Eventually she found that Shigure's bedroom had the room, the elevation and the environment that would suit a home for people smaller than her fingers; every time she put the house down, though, it always felt that it wouldn't work until she placed it about eight inches away from the wall to the left of the door and one foot away from the wall that had the door in it, then it was like it had found its foundations. Bewildered but deciding not to look a gift house[sic] in the mouth she then went back downstairs to recover her shrinkees.

Just as she entered the living area she saw that Kyo was after Yuki's blood again and Shigure was doing whatever he could to hold him back. Strolling over to the table she swiftly snatched up Kyo in one hand and Yuki in the other; suspending them at shoulder height she noticed how her fists engulfed every part of their bodies below the shoulder blades. The sensation of being grasped by Tohru's mighty hands caused them to forget their animosity and instead look up at Tohru with a new sense of wonder.

"I just came back to tell you that I've found somewhere for you to stay." She told them; this made them cool off and go with the flow as Tohru slipped them into separate pockets and then pick Shigure up in one hand to carry them to their new home.

Having set them down at the front door of the 'dollhouse' Tohru explained to them how she found it.

"It seems a little too good to be true." Yuki commented.

"I know what you mean, Yuki," Tohru responded from above, "It's like it just dropped out of the sky." Shigure opened the door and looked inside.

"I'm not so sure about that." He said. "If it had fallen out of the sky all the furniture would be jumbled." This seriously bewildered the three outside; as Yuki and Kyo walked in to look at the living room that Shigure had spotted Tohru bent down to peer inside the bedroom windows. It was like a freshly furnished house with clean linen and fuzzy carpets.
13133212211.title: A Home for Little People

choices: ...as Tohru was getting ready for bed
131332122112.content:
"I'm going to get us something for dinner." Tohru commented as Shigure tested the comfort of the miniature sofa, Yuki checked out the bedrooms upstairs and Kyo gave the kitchen a once-over. "What would you like?" They immediately made for the front of the house where they could see their gigantic caretaker; Shigure scrambled to the living room window, Kyo dashed out of the front door nearly running into Tohru's knee and Yuki made for one of the front bedroom windows.

"Let's have a Chinese!" Shigure declared; everyone could hear him.

"Not another take-away!" Kyo moaned. "How about hiyamug (a type of noodle dish)." He was even louder.

"I'd rather go for some miso soup this evening." Tohru now found herself in a bit of a situation. Normally she'd be happy to make Yuki some miso soup and Kyo some hiyamug while Shigure would get himself a Chinese; as things stood she could never make such a variety on the correct scale so it fell to her to make the casting vote.

"Kyo," She asked him as he returned to the threshold of the little house, "You like miso soup, don't you?" Kyo did not really like giving in to Yuki but looking into Tohru's eyes, even giant ones, always made him settle for something if he was sure he could manage it.

"Fine." He replied. "Miso soup it is." Smiling at Kyo's willingness to compromise Tohru rose to her feet, making Kyo tumble back into the hallway of the miniature house, and thundered off to get their dinner ready leaving Shigure to make his silly moans over trivial matters.

---

When Tohru found that the soup was ready to pour she wondered how they would be able to eat it. She went over various possibilities:

1: She uses one normal-sized bowl and everyone shares; this would put them in danger if she became distracted and any of them fell in.

2: She takes three thimbles for their soup; they would still have oversized helpings and it might seem undignified.

3: ???

Stuck for a perfect answer she made as though she was going for the first option and then put the bowl in the oven to keep the soup warm while she went upstairs to check something with them.

Bending down in front of the 'house', she saw them waiting at the front door with, to her surprise, tiny soup bowls and what looked like spoons. Giving them a gentle smile she explained.

"Just checking to see that your crockery arrangements are satisfactory." With that she rose to her feet and stomped downstairs again.

---

Their dinner was an unusual affair for an unusual situation; the Sohmas were in the little dining room at the front of their new 'house' while Tohru knelt outside with her bowl of soup taking up the entire view from the dining room window. It was fortunate that Yuki had found a ladle to their size and that Tohru had procured a schoolbook for them to use as a platform to reach over the rim. A pre-dinner conversation led to them agreeing that, unless they could find a way to reverse this strange force, they would have to live as Tohru's tenants and effectively see anything normal-sized as belonging to Tohru regardless as to who owned it before they shrank.

Later on...
131332122112.title: A Night with the Tinies

choices: She Goes as She Always Did
1313321221121.content:
The evening was surprisingly smooth. Everyone was amazed to find that the 'house' for the Sohmas had a supply of electricity and water, allowing them to wash the tiny bowls and spoons; aside from shelter from the oversized natural world outdoors and food they were generally as independent as they were before shrinking. Even so they felt as though they owed Tohru for all she was doing for them.

While Tohru was turning down her bed a sudden thought occured to her; if she found herself shrinking people smaller than her fingers just by looking at them that would mean she'd never be able to properly interact with anyone normal-size again. There was a difficult decision she had to make: Cover her eyes and live blind outside the building she's come to think of as home to prevent anyone else being shrunk or become a caretaker for a new world of tiny people, including obtaining those she looks upon before they misinterpret her apparent gigantic stature and get lost in a huge and dangerous world. All through getting ready for bed she struggled with this decision; she wanted to help people, which would warranty becoming blind in the eyes of society, but she also wanted to be honest and sociable, which would mean looking at people.

As she got to bed she thought about the consequences of each. The next day would be a school day, meaning lots of people getting shrunk if she saw them. She asked her mother's soul what she should do.
1313321221121.title: A Difficult Decision

13133212211212.content:
When Tohru woke up she felt a bit befuddled as she remembered her dream. She came face to face with her mother who told her to be herself and look after everyone. Thinking it over Tohru realised that her question had been answered, she would have to spend her life looking after tiny people; she wondered how logistics would work if, when she went to pay for supplies, the people she would pay shrank. Deciding to cross that bridge when she reached it she got up and prepared for the rest of the day.

Having gotten dressed and everything she popped into what used to be Shigure's room and knelt down outside of the little house to say good morning to her friends. It was interesting to see; Shigure was in the living room looking to see if miniature writing equipment was available, Kyo was still in bed having taken one of the front bedrooms and, when she lay down beside the house, she could see Yuki in the kitchen. Once they had all said good morning, and Kyo had calmed round after Tohru mighty voice awoke him from his sleep, she informed them that she was going to get them some breakfast. Once again she inquired as to what they'd like.

"Pancakes." Shigure replied.

"Onigiri." Kyo told her.

"Porridge." Yuki suggested. Once again Tohru had to make a decision as to which of these everyone would indulge in. She decided against Kyo's suggestion this time and looked at the other two options.
13133212211212.title: Time for Breakfast

131332122112121.content:
After due consideration Tohru felt it would be easier for everyone if she made some pancakes and provided some flavourings as best she could for her deminished housemates; she didn't have any droppers yet so she would need to be very careful if any of them wanted something extra on their helpings. Going downstairs she considered the possibility of pouring the smallest amounts of batter possible into the frying pan in the hopes of making Sohma-sized pancakes instead of making herself full-sized pancakes and giving the others crumbs from her giant plate. This shocked her as she found that she was now thinking of herself as the giant one rather than her friends as the tiny ones.

Later on she prepared for her first attempt at making mini-pancakes, placing the smallest possible dribble of batter and swirled it around but not too much so there would still be a bit of thickness in it. The result was a pancakes the size of a large coin or the dining room table in the Sohmas' new lodgings; Tohru put it on her plate as a quick bite and tried again, resulting in the same thing.

Eventually Tohru had used up all the batter and had a large stack of pancakes the size of coins. Seeing no alternative she decided to give them one of these pancakes and let them cut it up between them. Looking at what could be used as flavouring she realised that they could not specify their selection, they'd have to settle for one flavouring to share. Sighing at the difficulty she was having Tohru took the plate and extras and went back up to what could now be thought of as the 'lodging room'.

Upon kneeling down in front of the house she noticed that there was a latch on one side; upon releasing it the whole facade could be swung open, allowing Tohru to access any of the front rooms easily, so she took one of the little pancakes and, after Yuki had realised what had to be done and fetched the biggest plate the kitchen had, set it down right in the middle. Once they were all seated she asked what they'd like on the pancake, fortunately they all agreed on maple syrup, so she managed to only place a few drops on the pancake before returning the facade to its original position and starting on her own breakfast.

Once they had all finished and Tohru had finished her washing up she returned to her bedroom to get her things together for school, only to discover...
131332122112121.title: Problems with Pancakes

1313321221121212.content:
Tohru was shocked by what she saw. Tucked in a corner but where she could easily see it was a back pack filled with different items. Going over and looking through she was most surprised by what was available:

A net like those used for catching butterflies, only with smaller holes; a lock-picking set with some bizarre device that could deactivate security systems, a gyroscope with tiny bedsits in it allowing her to hold it any way without the... rooms being tossed, a magnifying glass, a pair of tweezers and a logbook. Tohru could not fathom how this appeared nor figure out why she suddenly had such a convenient set of materials; it was as though someone meant for her to shrink everyone she came across.

Sighing in that way you do when you realise that something isn't particularly bad but you'd rather do without it when you can't, Tohru carefully took the backpack and reorganised the contents so they would be easier to access and anyone she found would feel more comfortable in transit.

She set this pack down at the top of the stairs while she considered what provisions she should make for those who were already tiny while she'd be out. She went downstairs and gathered together some perishables on a plate so that, if they wanted, they could get something to eat while she was away. Having set this down at a reasonable distance from the little house she explained all she could to them before saying goodbye for now. They were stumped by her monologue but would soon get over it.

Tohru locked the door to the Sohma house, now effectively her house, and set off up the lane. Will she meet anyone on the way to high school?
1313321221121212.title: Bit of a Coincidence, ne?

13133212211212122.content:
Tohru did her best not to set eyes on passsersby as she made her way to school; fortunately surprisingly few people were around and none got too close to her that it was impossible for her now to set eyes on them. Eventually she reached the school gate and took a deep breath, knowing she'd have to look at people soon and wondered how she'd be able to rescue them from the dangers of a giant world if they were scattered about outside. She entered the school grounds, only changing her angle of vision slightly so that anyone she did see wouldn't be too far to take, and felt at the handle for the net.

However hardly anyone was outside at this time and, before Tohru knew it, the homeroom bell sounded and, out of habit, her face shot up and she dashed through the corridors. There were people around but her eyes could not rest on them as she dashed to her classroom. Once at the door she remembered the shrinking hex her gaze had, understanding that no matter how late she may be as soon as the teacher turned to face her s/he would be immediately miniaturised. Taking another deep breath, drawing the net from her bag, she opened the door to the classroom and waited for the teacher to speak.

"Honda." He addressed her. "You're five minu..." She opened her eyes as soon as he started the word minute, causing him to apparently vanish as far as the other students were concerned. Tohru walked into the class and closed the door behind her before preparing for everyone else to be inevitably shrink.

"I'm sorry everyone." She said as she turned her gaze upon each and every student, including her two friends, and waited until all were invisible from such a distance and then put her bag down in front of the door in case the gap underneath was wide enough for them to squeeze through. Where does she start?
13133212211212122.title: The Incredible Shrinking Class

131332122112121221.content:
Tohru walked up to the teacher's desk and knelt down so as to look out for any tiny figure running in terror or otherwise. She soon noticed the little man scampering towards the underside of his desk, presumably in the mistaken idea that she would either not see him there or be unable to reach him there. With a swift but unpracticed and, therefore, crude flick of her wrist she brought the net right down on top of him, immediately making him her property. Retrieving the far end of this net she looked through the fine mesh at her homeroom teacher, cowering under her gaze. With a sympathetic sigh she fumbled with the net until there was nothing but his own shrunken clothes separating him from her hand. Now Tohru had to decide whether to put him in her... 'transport' was the only word she could find for the gyroscope, or put him in her pocket and grab some of the students before packing them away.

Thinking it over Tohru decided that she would make her homeroom teacher the first in the transport as he was the nearest catch and it would probably indicate to everyone else that making for the door would only make it easier for her to capture them. Having made her way over to the bag she opened it up and reached for the gyroscope, opening one of the 'carriages', as it seemed appropriate to call them, before depositing her teacher on the bed inside. Now she thought about all the students in the room with her; would they be on their chairs and easy pickings for her, on their desks and also easy pickings unless they could jump out of a window, or on the floor and vulnerable to her giant footwear.
131332122112121221.title: Tohru's Pet Teacher

1313321221121212212.content:
Tohru made her way over to the nearest desk, brandishing her net and with her magnifying glass in her pocket, while looking on the floor to see if any tiny people would running away from her mighty feet. Upon reaching the desk she knealt down and checked the surface; no miniscule person cringing before her. She turned her attention to the chair and there, curled up into a ball, a tiny boy trembled in terror. Considering the net to be overkill in this situation she put it down on the floor and carefully reached for her next captive.

"Don't be scared." She whispered to him, carefully placing her fingers upon his back. "I'm not going to harm you." Once his tiny head looked up into her eyes she gently slipped him into the palm of her hand and carried him over to the transport. Once he was safe inside Tohru now thought of who she should pick up next. Eventually deciding to do it systematically, going from the nearest desk along the rows as opposed to along the columns. She checked each chair and always identified the shrinkee on the seat before snatching them humanely and putting them in her bag.

She recovered the logbook after taking the last student on the first row and wrote down everyone she had possession of and even remembered enough to write down where and when she got them, including Shigure, Yuki and Kyo from yesterday. It really did seem to be becoming apparent that she was destined to take care of tiny people.

She continued her systematic gathering of the class; the gyroscope had 40 rooms in total but with enough space inside the rooms for them to be shared if necessary, allowing for a total of 80 people. She knew that her class had only 25 students plus the teacher meaning that she'd have 26 people at the end of this 'hunt'. Which of her friends comes first in this order?
1313321221121212212.title: Taking the Class

13133212211212122121.content:
Once Tohru finished the second row she realised that Hana sat on the next desk she'd get to. Having deposited her latest captive in her transport Tohru wondered whether Hana and Uo should join the others in these bedsits or if she'd keep them a bit closer to hand, in her pocket(s). While she still debated she slowly made her way towards the desk.

Saki was stunned by her sudden reduction in height; she felt both frightened and thrilled at the same time. She had seen Tohru plucking their classmates off their chairs and noticed that her aura had shifted slightly; it still registered the same demeanour and personality but showed a shift in Tohru's inner self, where elements that are out of this world show up. She soon deduced that Tohru was the cause for the shrinking but Hana was sure that it wasn't by choice. Having decided that Tohru was basically the same sweet girl she knew Hana now found herself cast into shadow as the enormous Tohru stooped over her.

"Are you all right, Hana?" Tohru asked her.

"As well as can be expected, Tohru." She replied, but she couldn't bring herself to shout so Tohru could not quite hear what she said as she plucked her friend off the seat and held her in her palm.

"I'm sorry this had to happen," Tohru explained, "But every person I set eyes on becomes this small, fortunately you don't shrink any further if I see you more than once. For some reason nearly everytime I enter my bedroom I find something that makes it easier for me to deal wit it, like..."

"Like someone wants you to do this?" Hana checked; being closer to Tohru now meant that the giantess could her her minute voice. Tohru nodded. "It's okay. The idea of spending my life in your clutches has some appeal; you may think of me as your personal property." Tohru was amazed. Hana was willingly surrendering all forms of freedom to her.

"Hana," Tohru asked her, "Would you prefer to ride in my pocket or with everyone else in my backpack? It would be comfier in my bag but you're special to me." What is Hana's decision?
13133212211212122121.title: Holding Hanajima

131332122112121221212.content:
"Considering the warmth I feel when you are near, even without being in your hand, I would prefer to ride in your pocket, Tohru." Hana informed her captor. Tohru was still a bit embarrassed by the power she had over her classmates but was happy with how close Hana would be to her physically during transit. With great care and almost reverence she slipped her friend into one of her pockets.

With Hana now snug in her pocket Tohru could now snatch a few more students before coming to Uo's desk. Looking down at the tiny tomboy Tohru performed a similar scene.

"Whoa!" Uo exclaimed upon seeing Tohru towering over her. "How's tricks, short stuff?" Though her voice was much weaker at her size Tohru could still hear her and giggled at this remark.

"Uo," She answered, "You've made me feel much better." Uo gave her a look of bewilderment. "The only choice I can make is if I look at someone; it is hard to avoid it but one look from me, even without eye-contact, and people get shrunk to your new scale. What's weirdest of all is the evidence that someone is trying to make me establish a community of little people." Understanding this Uo made yet another unusual comment.

"Nice to meet you, Medusa." This only brought Tohru's fear, shame and embarrassment back. Sighing she carefully reached for her friend and carefully stroked her with two fingers. What is Uo's reaction?
131332122112121221212.title: Uo's Under A Shadow

1313321221121212212121.content:
Although the sight of Tohru's tree-trunk-size digits reaching for her made Uo nervous, as they brushed along her back a few times she found quite soothing. Tohru was gigantic but still cared for in spite of her new status as a living doll.

"Does this mean...?" Uo asked, Tohru nodded with a muffled acknowledgement. "Well, it's not like my father would notice." Tohru sighed again and scooped Uo up in her hand.

"It is strange even for you to be sarcastic about this." She commented.

"Sarcastic?" Uo responded. "I'm serious! My dad wouldn't care if I ended up in your stomach." Tohru was doulbe-shocked by this; the idea that she'd eat her friend and the suggestion that Uo's dad didn't care about her.

"Well," Tohru spoke up after getting over the latest information, "Don't you worry about a thing, Uo. You'll live with me from now on; I promise I'll look after you." With that she pressed the penlid-size girl against one of her cheeks, demonstrating the love and affection she would adorn all familiar faces in her captivity. The sudden change in position knocked the wind out of Uo but she reached as far as she could with her arms, at one point feeling the edge of her lips with her fingertips; it really struck home how small she was, knowing that Tohru really could gobble her up if she wanted to, especially when she felt one of the giantess's molars through the skin against her leg. "Anyway," Tohru continued as she withdrew Uo from her face, "Would you rather ride in a speical compartment in my backpack like the other students, join Hana in my pocket, or have a pocket all to yourself?"
1313321221121212212121.title: She's a Gentle Giant

13133212211212122121212.content: Knowing that Hana is already in a pocket Uo decides to...
13133212211212122121212.title: Which One?

131332122112121221212122.content:
"I'd rather have my own space," Uo told Tohru, "After all, all three of us will be in the same garment anyway." Tohru couldn't help but giggle at Uo's casual attitude coming so soon as she carefully brought her down into her pocket. As she looked down Tohru saw Hana poking her head out of her pocket.

"I...I didn't cause offense, did I?" Tohru checks.

"Not at all, Tohru," Hana replies, "I just think that you might want to get a move on." Tohru checked the clock and answered.

"In these circumstances I actually have quite a bit of time." Suddenly aware of just how much stronger she is than Hana at this stange she whimsically pushes Hana back into her pocket with her fingers.

As Tohru went about gathering the other ten students Hana and Uo constantly went over the extraordinary situation in their thoughts. Each had slightly different attitudes; Hana was looking forward to being Tohru's pet with visions of being a living barbie doll in spite of her gothic fashion taste, while Uo was just happy to have a new life under Tohru's thumb even when her thoughts kept returning to how easily she could fit inside Tohru.

Once Tohru had taken everyone in class she looked at the clock and noticed that she still had plenty of time left in the day. She could go and look at another class, thus doubling her current catch, or she could leave the school grabbing anyone who'd stop her so she could off-load her catch and then come back for another lot.
131332122112121221212122.title: One Captive Class, Now What

choices: That which Momiji and Hatsuharu are in
1313321221121212212121221.content:
The classroom now apparently empty Tohru could make herself comfortable and think about what she would do next. She had 24 people in the carrier, each having their own compartment, as she pondered over this she knew that if she got 26 more people then 10 compartments would have to be shared; she was okay with this but wanted to be sure that she wouldn't get any turmoil from miss-matched shrinkees.

Not sure exactly how to take this approach she plucked her friends from her pockets and set them down on the desk she was sitting at. She then explained the situation to them and asked for their opinions.

"Well," Hana replied, "You've already got our class, maybe you could make some of them share compartments."

"I'd say 'first come, first serve'," Uo responded, "Have only one occupant per compartment and then just put those who remain in with whoever you want. You are our owner after all." Tohru was totally taken aback by this sudden submissive attitude from Uo.

"Actually," Tohru decided, "I think Hana has the right idea." Uo just shrugged her shoulders, determining it as being Tohru's decision for sure. Hana was somewhat relieved as they were returned to their respective pockets.

Tohru was very thorough in determining who should share compartments, making sure that there were no mixed gender ones, before closing the carrier and putting all her gear back in her bag when she suddenly wonders which class to go for.
1313321221121212212121221.title: A Brief Discussion

13133212211212122121212211.content:
With every student but in her carrier sharing a bedsit, meaning eleven shared and two single, Tohru gathered her things and prepared to make a swift stroll to the year 10 class that two Sohmas were sharing. Her line of sight was a bit higher now due to the confidence in there being hardly anyone out in the corridors at this time.

Tohru's swift movement created a sensation for Hana and Uo as being somewhere between a waterbed, a babycot and a fairground ride. It was fun and relaxing at the same time.

As Tohru made her way towards the class that Momiji and Hatsuharu Sohma were in does she look upon any one on the way?
13133212211212122121212211.title: Gone Kidnapping, Buh-buh-buh-buh.

131332122112121221212122112.content:
Finally Tohru reached the door to the correct year 10 class. She made an extensive hesitation, wondering if her silhouette would be visible from the inside. She looked down at her two friends, who were barely discernable in the gloom of her pockets but could still be seen lying on their backs smiling up at the giant face, and smiled back at them. She lowered the hand that she would not bear the net with into the respective pocket and petted the occupant, who even managed to return the favour and stroke her digits, while she gave a reassuring glance into the other pocket as the girl in there did what she could to poke her head out and acknowledge Tohru's kindness for effectively.

Once this was all finished Tohru had the courage to open the door and look at the class. She slid it open and looked around as the occupants turned to face her, all apparently vanishing as they did so. Once there was no one left within her field of vision Tohru closed the door behind her and put her backpack down, propped up against it, as she retrieved her net.

Does she do the same approach here as she did with her own class?
131332122112121221212122112.title: Tohru's Gaze Shrinks Again

1313321221121212212121221121.content:
Once again Tohru started with the teacher's desk. The tiny woman reacted differently to her own teacher; while he attempted to sprint for a tight corner she stood there staring at Tohru's shoes as they thundered towards her. Once Tohru began to crouch over her she slowly backed away having noticed the net she was carrying. She was quick to figure, however, that it would be futile to flee from such a huge girl and, instead, sat on the floor hugging her knees. A shadow fell on her and, before she had a chance to see, she was engulfed by Tohru's hand. There was a hint of a yelp.

"It's okay," Tohru whispered into her fist, "I won't harm you." With that she opened her hand and looked at the tiny teacher lying in the palm. She looked up and gasped in shock at the sight of Tohru's looming face.

"P...p...please," She squeaked, "Let me go." Tohru's look of concern intensified.

"If I did," She answered, "How could you be sure of your safety? I'll look after you and many others. I'll do what I can to keep you warm and well-fed. I'll even try to find ways to relieve any boredom you'll experience." The little lady swallowed; she still wasn't sure if Tohru would be so caring. However there was no option, she simply let Tohru carry her over to the carrier and be set down in a vacant bedsit.

Once again Tohru went around the classroom; across, then down. This time she had to keep her eyes on the floor as some of the students were standing up when she saw them; her net was of particular use here as they were constantly trying to escape, fearing she'd commit unspeakable acts on her captives. As for the two acquiantances of hers in this class, who does she find first?
1313321221121212212121221121.title: More Pets for the Giant

1313321221121212212121222.content:
"Well," Tohru mused, "May as well take everyone home now." With that she zipped up her bag and, with great care, slipped it on before venturing out into the corridor, keeping her field of vision low to avoid shrinking too many people in such an open area.

While on school grounds Tohru did not find herself setting eyes on anyone else. In her pockets Hana and Uo enjoyed the ride as the swinging of Tohru's hips made it feel like being a baby in a rocking cot.

On the way home does Tohru set eyes on anyone else?

13311.content:
At the end of this Saturday morning the 2nd class of Year 4 at Tomoeda Elementary were packing up and leaving. Just as Sakura Kinomoto fastened her backpack her closest friend, Tomoyo Daidouji, asked her a question.

"Could you come over this afternoon, Sakura-chan?" Sakura looked at her friend as she went over the chore rota in her head.

"Sure, Tomoyo-chan." Sakura replied with her characteristic warm smile before something occured to her. "What about Kero-chan?" She inquired.

"He can come too." Tomoyo answered. "I've got time to bake a cake." Sakura understood this all too well; Kero wouldn't let it down if he didn't get cake.

Less than two hours later Sakura entered through the gates of the Daidouji mansion. She was only a yard away from the front door before it opened and Tomoyo popped out from behind it to enthusiastically greet her friend and loved one.

Before long all three of them were in Tomoyo's bedroom whereupon Kero immediately flew up to Tomoyo's eye level and asked.

"Did you really bake a cake?" Tomoyo smiled and responed affirmatively, knowing all too well how keen he was on cake. Going over to the coffee table she opened a box to reveal a strawberry tart, which Kero looked upon with ecstasy.

"Kero-chan," Sakura told him, "We don't eat until we've dealt with what Tomoyo-chan asked us over for." While Kero sulked Tomoyo immediately produced a tape measure, expressing her desire to measure Sakura for new costumes. In spite of Sakura's confusion since she thought of Tomoyo's costumes always fitting her Tomoyo said that Sakura was going through a growth spurt.
13311.title: Little at Tomoyo's

133111.content:
Now Sakura was wearing Tomoyo's latest creation (Exactly the same as the original episode). Tomoyo felt so pleased with herself and thought about Sakura using and capturing the Clow cards wearing this piece. Of course Kero was getting impatient from there being cake around and no one (especially him) was eating it. Just then Sakura and Kero felt a presence within the Daidouji mansion. Confirming it as a Clow card Sakura released her sealing staff and began to follow its presence, informing Tomoyo to stay in the background for safety and Kero to stay with her.

Sakura followed the presence along the landing. There was no need to worry about the servants seeing her because Tomoyo had told her that it was time for one of their teabreaks and wouldn't be around unless summoned; fortunately Tomoyo and Sakura were the only ones in the mansion at the time to summon them. Finally Sakura pinpointed the Clow card's presence to...
133111.title: Where is Little?

13312.content:
"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo asked her, "Do you have any plans for the coming week?"

"No," She replied, "Touya's doing a summer job for eight hours from Monday to Friday and dad's away on a dig." It was the summer holiday and, unlike last summer, Sakura and Tomoyo had less homework and Sakura had actually gotten two items done. And it was the week where July and August merge. Sakura had invited Tomoyo over for a bit of afternoon tea and a chat.

"It's just," Tomoyo added, "I was wondering... if you would fancy having a sleepover at my house for this week. Sakura seemed both stunned and flattered.

"Oh, I couldn't, Tomoyo-chan." She responded. "I've got to do the chores round the house and Kero-chan's..." Tomoyo cut her off.

"It's all right, Sakura-chan." She said. "I can reason with Touya-kun and Kero-chan can come with us." Sakura still had her doubts.

"But..." She started but Tomoyo remained confident.

"It will be all right." Tomoyo told her. "Believe me." She kept her eyes locked with Sakura's, the floaty feeling she got when she did this always relieved the tension both for herself and Sakura.

"Okay," Sakura replied, "I'll try it." Tomoyo beamed with happiness.

"Thank you very much, Sakura-chan." She answered enthusiastically before calming down again. "But there's a catch."

"What catch?" Sakura asked, looking concerned for good reason.

"Well," Tomoyo seemed uneasy with saying this, "I want you to be tiny."

"WHAT?!?" Sakura cried out.
13312.title: Summer Holiday

133122.content:
Sakura was happy that the half-term had come round but was less than pleased that she still had to do homework during the holiday. She had been considering how to make the most of the half-term and wished to bring the subject to a conclusion. She had asked Tomoyo to meet up with her and they had arranged to meet at the Daidouji mansion.

Their talk was quite heated. Tomoyo wished that they could do something together but Sakura couldn't consider anything special they could do, since they had been playing together at just about every form of sport and child's play they could think of.

"Well," Tomoyo suggested, "Could you use magic to help with this?" Sakura had thought about this but was unsure.

"But, Tomoyo," Sakura replied, "I had always thought that the cards were only to be used in emergencies." Tomoyo just smiled as she thought of a loophole in her argument.

"Well Kero-chan wasn't too worried about emergencies when he wanted to make the most of my strawberry tart." She answered, Sakura sweat-dropped as she remembered that day.

She had her first encounter with the Little card. It shrunk her to the size of her thumb and also drained her magical ability, leaving her in a giant world with only her athletic skills to ensure her safety. It was fortunate that Kero caught up with her so she could catch up with it and return to normal.

As Sakura kept replaying these memories in her mind she found her imagination distorting two of the scenarios. One where she witnessed her brother on the move from such a small scale, and another when she caught up with the Little card before Tomoyo's eyes. Now she was imagining how it would've been if Tomoyo was the one to enter the kitchen. That thought caused this unusual feeling deep inside her.

"Um, Tomoyo." Sakura commented as she considered a compromise.
133122.title: Half-Term

1331221.content:
"Yes, Sakura?" Tomoyo inquired, noticing the beaming expression on Sakura's face mixed in with a feeling of cheek seldom seen in her, but she was a schoolgirl.

"I see your argument," Sakura replied, "And I've decided to use the powers of the cards." Tomoyo smiled but still noticed something about Sakura that suggested a 'but'. "However," She continued (Tomoyo nodded without Sakura noticing), "I have one particular idea in mind."

"What is it, Sakura?" Tomoyo asked, now feeling a little uneasy.

"I want to use the Little card on myself." Sakura replied. Tomoyo gasped, partly out of amazement but mostly out of surprise and alarm.
1331221.title: Chibi-Sakura

13312211.content:
"That's an amazing idea!" Tomoyo told Sakura. "I can't deny that I feel nervous about the idea but I'm sure you know what you're doing." Sakura nodded and said.

"But I'll need an alibi for my prolonged absence." Tomoyo quickly came up with an idea.

"Let's both go over to your house." She said.

Once there Sakura and Tomoyo discussed the idea of Sakura having a sleepover with Tomoyo. Sakura's father was quite keen on the idea of the girls spending quality time together but Touya had his doubts. Eventually Fujitaka wore down Touya's skepticism and even offered to help her pack.

Back at Tomoyo's home Sakura had set up all her gear in such a way the shrinking herself would also shrink this.

"Ready, Tomoyo?" Sakura asked.

"Ready, Sakura." Tomoyo replied with a smile. Sakura commanded the Little card to shrink her to the size of Tomoyo's thumb and her command was delivered to the letter.

As she stood in the thick carpet hairs Sakura craned her neck back, looking right up the tower that was Tomoyo Daidouji until her eyes now met those of her giant friend.

"OH, SAKURA." Tomoyo thundered. "YOU'RE SO CUTE!"
13312211.title: Cute Kinomoto
