13333122.content:
This actually takes place after Kaho Mizuki arrives in Tomoeda.

Sakura and Tomoyo were walking towards town for a spot of lunch after school had finished for Saturday when, all of a sudden Sakura started.

"Sakura-chan, nani ga warui no?1" Tomoyo asked her.

"Kuroukādo ga chikaku arimasu.2" She answered, prompting a gasp from Tomoyo before she asked.

"Dotchi?3" Looking round Sakura focused upon the presence of the card in relation to the layout of the streets.

"Sonoyōni bakkuappu shi, watashi wa omou.4" She indicated.

"Anata ga mite mimashou ka?5" Sakura paused for a moment before nodding; she was just heading up that way when Tomoyo had an idea. "Sakura-chan, watashi wa sonotōri o mirikitekina kafe o shitte iru. Anata ga sore o fūin shitara, wareware wa soko ni chūshoku o motsu koto ga dekimasu.6 Sakura sweat dropped and gave a sigh before consenting.

Once they had turned the corner they were most surprised by the lack of people around, although this would be convenient in order for Sakura to seal the card; however she was concerned.

"Sore wa doko ka koko ni aru ga,7" She affirmed, "Watashi wa sore o seikaku ni shimesu yō ni mieru koto wa dekimasen.8" Just then two figures came round the corner at the next junction down, having already finished their lunch; Sakura was uneasy at first until she recognised them. "Li-kun, Meilin-chan." She gave a wave not of cheerful greeting but of acknowledgement in a mutually significant situation.

"Kinomoto," Meilin sniped as she jogged over to them, "Anata wa Shaoran no hādo migi kuroukādo ni kaseida to kanshō tame ni koko ni iru.9" Sakura wasn't sure how to respond to her accusative tone when Li calmly walked up behind Meilin and said.

"Meilin, wa, sore wa kanojo to issho ni senkō tōshi suru koto ga okonawa remasen. Keroberos wa, watashi ga seitokuken o motte iru to iu jijitsu nimokakawarazu, kanojo ni shīrusutaffu no shiyō o kyoka shimashita.10" Meilin was about to emphasise the latter fact when both Li and Sakura looked round apprehensively as the card's presence built. A whirlwind started to pick up around the four of them and a swirling yellow disc appeared above their heads, provoking a synchronised cry of alarm before Sakura asked.

"Kore wa kuroukādodarou ka?11" Li frowned as he did his best to strain against the wind and deduce the signs at the same time.

"Watashi wa wakaranai.12" He replied as the wind grew stronger, evidently making for the yellow disc. "Watashi wa sore wa Windy ka Storm koto o kitai shitaiga, karera wa ryōhō no mippū sa rete kitashi, kiiro no fōmu wa, dochira ka to tekigō shinai. 13" Concerned about this Sakura wondered what might be able to subdue this magical force while reaching for her key, just then she heard Tomoyo yelp in surprise and alarm and cry out her name. She looked just in time to see Tomoyo tumbling through the air towards the disc that was now formed a fairly definitive vortex.

"Tomoyo-chan!" She yelled back, pulling out her key and preparing to release it when she caught sight of Li being swept up, which provoked him to try and summon his sword.

"Syaoran!" Meilin cried out.

"Li-kun!" Sakura added before turning her attention back to the key of the seal, when suddenly both Meilin and Sakura were swept up and sent tumbling up towards the vortex before it, the winds and the four of them vanished.

The Little card giggled and gave thanks to the power of the Move card for pushing the Cardcaptor away. Now the four students were no bigger than grains of rice and would be deposited before a familiar feminine face each and the two of them ensured that each of them would be having lunch at this time; nevertheless they could end up manifesting right before their eyes. This would occur thusly.

Footnotes
1  Sakura, what's wrong?
2  There's a Clow card nearby.
3  Which way?
4  Back that way, I think.
5  Will you take a look?
6  Sakura, I know a charming cafÃ© down that street. Once you've sealed it we can have lunch there.
7  It's here somewhere,
8  But I can't seem to pinpoint it.
9  You're here to interfere with Shaoran's hard earned right to the Clow cards.
10  Meilin, it doesn't do to be upfront with her. Kerberos did grant her the use of the sealing staff, despite the fact I do have the birthright.
11  Which Clow card could this be?
12  I'm not sure.
13  I'd expect it to be the STORM or the WINDY but they've both been sealed and the yellow form doesn't fit with either of them.
13333122.title: The Little and the Move combine.

choices: Switch to Naoko, Chiharu and the Li.
133331221.content:
Rika Sasaki sat upon the low wall at the edge of the playground with a lunchbox upon her lap. Though it was a Saturday and school was officially over for the day she still had piano practice that afternoon. She was about halfway through her lunch when she was surprised to see a yellow orb form before her eyes. It was eerily beautiful and gave her pause in her eating when she noticed a silhouette forming within the orb. Looking closer she could see that it was taking on a human form and the yellow light began to disperse once it was finished. Now Rika could see the human form clearly, the eyes closed as though asleep, smaller than her thumb, she recognised it.

"Tomoyo-chan?" Rika gasped in amazement, wondering if it was Tomoyo or if some spirit had taken on her friend's appearance if her eyes weren't deceived by more mundane means. Once the yellow light had completely dispersed Tomoyo came round just as the magical force keeping her afloat let go and sent her tumbling down, straight towards Rika's lunchbox. Promptly she cried out as she fell and Rika, startled and alarmed by this turn of events, found that the only option she had within the given time to break the shrunken girl's fall was the rice in her lunchbox.

Tomoyo struck the giant rice grains with a force akin to landing on a reasonably hard mattress, but the momentum of her fall meant that she went head over heels right into a selection of finely cut vegetables. In ten seconds Tomoyo pulled herself up into a sitting position and looked around her.

"Kyodai yasai?1" She mused. "Kyojin gohan?2" Tomoyo took it upon herself to climb onto the top of the vegetables. "Dakara, watashi wa Kyojin no bentō-bako ya... Watashi wa shukushō shite kita to omoi, ima, dareka no o bentō no dochira kada?!?3" Just then a series of vibrations caused Tomoyo to fall back into the various watery fluids that were seeping out of the veg.

Rika picked up her lunchbox and looked closely at the contents, having seen Tomoyo's tiny figure fall off the rice she wished to make sure what she saw was real. Once she had finished lifting the box she could see a piece of carrot move in a manner similar to a trapdoor. As Tomoyo once again climbed to the top of the pile Rika gasped, very nearly sending her little friend back into the waters that now soaked her skirt.

"Tomoyo-chan, sore wa anata ga hontōni aru?4" The sound of Rika's voice from above, greatly magnified by the size difference, startled Tomoyo who hesitantly looked up to see Rika's face filling the sky from her point of view. Nervously Tomoyo smiled and waved while calling out.

"Kon'nichiwa, Rika-chan. Mōshiwakearimasenga, kono yōna o bentō ni otoshikon motte iru.5" Rika could now confirm that either some otherworldly being had manifested as Tomoyo and was trying to dupe her or Tomoyo had somehow shrunk and teleported right in front of her. Thinking things over Rika figured there was only one way to determine the truth; she took her chopsticks and carefully lowered them down to Tomoyo's position.

Tomoyo looked nervously as Rika's chopsticks dropped down right over her, primed to snatch her up to the giant schoolgirl's eye-level. Tomoyo reassured herself that Rika's maturity and the fact that she could see her clearly enough meant that she wouldn't be facing anything serious at this point. The chopsticks pinched her across the waist but with no more squeeze than she'd expect from being picked up by a giant. As the landscape of food fell away from her Tomoyo figured that Rika would have to know more about the exact circumstances that led her to this situation and immediately realised that the other three were nowhere in sight.

Footnotes
1  Giant veg?
2  Giant rice?
3  So, I'm either inside a giant's lunchbox or... I've shrunk and am now in someone's lunch?!?
4  Tomoyo, is that really you?
5  Hello, Rika. Sorry to have dropped into your lunch like this.
133331221.title: Tomoyo and Rika's Bento

1333312212.content:
Kaho Mizuki was startled when she detected a major magical occurrence. This provoked her into going over to the window and see if she could pinpoint the source of the surge and maybe check for any visual clues as to its nature. However the presence was constantly shifting and she couldn't isolate it until it went right into the staff room she currently stood in, alone. As she traced it she espied an occurrence right above her lunch. Slowly she approached this, apprehensive as she could now identify the nature of this swirling energy.

"Clow Kādo." She whispered, just as she could see a tiny human figure manifesting in the centre of this vortex. As she watched the magical energy started dissipating revealing Sakura Kinomoto's figure floating in the air, to Kaho's alarm. Just as Sakura's eyes flickered open gravity reasserted itself and She yelped as She fell... straight into Kaho's outstretched hand, which provided Her with a sufficiently soft landing. "Kinomoto-san, daijoubu desu ka?1"

As Sakura recovered from Her sudden drop, wondering just what Clow card could have caused this escapade when the only ideas She had were ones already sealed, She was surprised and a tad alarmed to hear Mizuki's voice from up above. Looking around She was shocked upon finding Herself almost surrounding by human digits bigger than She was, whereupon She hesitantly followed the arm attached to the hand that held Her and cried out upon seeing the lady who it belonged to.

"EHHHHH! Mizuki-sensei!" She declared, in response to which She tumbled slightly as Kaho lifted Her up to her eye level.

"Kinomoto-san, shinpaishinaide kudasai.2" She whispered gently. "Watashi wa, koreha mahō no yōna jikodatta to shimasu. Anata dake no nani ga okotta watashi ni itte daijōbudeshou ka?3" At this Sakura became most apprehensive, reluctant to fully divulge what had been going on even though Kaho appeared to have more knowledge of magic than most would give credit for. She recalled Li's expressions of concern surrounding their teacher but still Kaho Mizuki's aura left Her feeling particularly relaxed.

13333222.content:
"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo encouraged, "Think of all the homeless, the destitute, the hungry." Sakura still felt uneasy about this.

"But what about their freedom?" She responded, Tomoyo just took a deep breath and answered.

"I'm sure that losing the freedom to go where they want when they want is a small price to pay for the opportunity to never suffer the hardships of poverty, war and famine ever again."

Tomoyo was visiting Sakura at the time and said that she had something to discuss; this was okay at the time but the prospect sounded unethical to Sakura but, from Tomoyo's point of view, it was the ultimate charity. Tomoyo had proposed that Sakura use the Little card on the worst off people around the world and look after them herself, whereby many problems that they used to face would come to an end; Sakura's view, although she has been known to be optimistic, was that she'd be imprisoning people against their will and treating them like animals. She continued to voice this paradox but Tomoyo kept finding reasons for her plan to work.

"It'll be all right, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo informed her. "You have the Libra card, right?" Sakura confirmed this. "Then you'd surely be able to tell if they would really prefer being your tiny pet to their current situation."

"That's a complicated spell, Tomoyo-chan," Sakura replied, "The Libra card is more suited to determining a 'yes-or-no' answer if someone's suspected of lying. To determine their feelings regarding your suggestion without asking them directly would take more power." Tomoyo accepted this; she knew that openly asking someone would cause raised eyebrows and probably stupid answers. "Think about it." Sakura continued. "How would you like to be shrunk down and spend the rest of your life as my pet?"

"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo answered, "I'd absolutely love it!" Sakura nearly doubled-over upon hearing this. "To be Sakura-chan's itsy-bitsy captive, to be held in her warm soft hand and carried around in her pocket," She continued in a daydream, "It would be pure bliss."
13333222.title: Tomoyo's Idea

133332221.content:
"T-Tomoyo-chan," Sakura attempted to reason, "If you spent the rest of your life as my captive you'd be unable to go on holiday wherever you wanted, you wouldn't be able to attend proper schools and colleges, you might never see your mother again and you would have great difficulty finding a boyfriend. It would just be a dull routine where you couldn't go anywhere without my supervision."

"Where you are concerned, Sakura-chan," Tomoyo answered, "No day would ever be dull. I would be subject to all of your whims and fancies, bringing great excitement in a giant world. And why should I want a boyfriend when I have you." Sakura now noticed something; Tomoyo always seemed to treat her like she'd treat Yukito or Syaoran.

"Tomoyo-chan," She asked, "How can you place even your best friend before someone to love?"

"I suppose," Tomoyo answered, "Now's the time to tell you. You are the one I love, more than anyone else I know." Sakura seemed to be able to comprehend the kind of love she was talking about.

"You mean," Sakura replied, "Like Yukito-san loves my brother; like dad loves mum?" Tomoyo nodded calmly. "I... I don't know what to say."

"Please, don't say anything," Tomoyo requested, "Not until you have made the decision as to what I am to you; I respect your feelings for Li-kun and I've always wanted you to be the happiest girl on Earth so I never said anything before. Now that I've said what I feel it's like a weight has been lifted; I'm ready to receive your judgement of my feelings." Sakura stood there dumbfounded. First Tomoyo was asking her to go round the world to shrink and capture the needy, now she told her that she loved her the most.
133332221.title: A Sudden Confession

1333322211.content:
"I'll get us some tea." Sakura stated calmly as she got to her feet and went downstairs, leaving Tomoyo in her bedroom. Once Sakura had left the room Kero popped out of his sleeping quarters and just kept his gaze on Tomoyo.

"She's still deciding what her feelings are." Tomoyo commented. "I wish she'll respond truthfully as I don't want her to feel unhappy inside just to try and make me feel better."

"You," Kero checked, "You really love Sakura?" Tomoyo nodded. "And all those things about being shrunk?" Tomoyo nodded again. "So why did you ask her to shrink many people neither of you have met before?"

"Knowing her," Tomoyo answered, "It would be a great service to humanity. Knowing me," She added, "I'd probably keep asking Sakura to play with me day after day if I was her pet."

Downstairs Sakura put the kettle on and began to get the tea things ready as her mind raced with this revelation.

'Never since Syaoran-kun told me his feelings,' She thought, 'Have I felt this way. I don't know who I should choose. If I do love Tomoyo-chan we'll both feel happy but Syaoran-kun would probably feel dejected and Meilin-chan would never let it down; if I choose Syaoran-kun Tomoyo-chan could hurt inside and I wouldn't want that.' As Sakura got some snacks out as well, remembering extra for Kero, she started having daydreams

She imagined Tomoyo in her nightdress, Tomoyo playing with people she had shrunk, Tomoyo in the palm of her hand, Tomoyo towering over Tokyo; so many different fantasies about Tomoyo flashed by, some practical and some magical. She wondered as to how she'd react if she were never going to have contact with the people she felt most strongly about. It would be discomforting if she could never see her father again but staying in contact would make it feel better, she didn't like waiting for Syaoran to come back to Japan but if he found another lover she felt like she could wish him the best of luck but, with Tomoyo, the idea of never seeing her ever again was too much. She carried the tray upstairs and set it down between herself and Tomoyo before looking her in the eye and saying.

"Tomoyo-chan, I love you too. To go on without you would be like... like going without water." Tomoyo smiled the brightest and most affectionate smile she ever smiled.

"Thank you so much, Sakura-chan." She replied. "I'm sorry if I was pushing the idea of a shrunken refugee camp," It was a deliberate euphemism, "But I was trying to think of a fun way by which you could help some of the problems with the world. Maybe you could shrink fugitives of true justice and punish them in the most appropriate manner." Sakura felt uneasy again at this prospect but felt that having little people might not be so bad if she could make it more bearable in some way.
1333322211.title: Love Hath No Boundaries

13333222112.content: Sakura thought the ideas over; she didn't like the idea of giving bizarre hospitality to the needy while punishing the cruel ones from around the world as it seemed hypocritical. After due consideration she decided that it would be better to...
13333222112.title: What will Sakura do?

choices: To let both Lis know of the development
They could become Sakura's pets too
133332221121.content:
"Tomoyo-chan," Sakura spoke up, "I have considered your suggestions through and through and decided to accept one option as I couldn't bear to refuse you. I will provide safety and comfort to those who need and deserve it." Tomoyo lit up at this; though she felt that she had already received the best news of her life this boosted her current feelings. "There is a condition." She continued. "I would like you to look after some of them yourself."

"Certainly Sakura-chan," Tomoyo answered, "But could we also find some time to have fun together?" Sakura was unsure about this as one of them would appear to be neglecting their tinies.

"I am unable to answer that as of yet." Sakura replied. "Let us see how it goes; there is a more pressing matter to attend to. Li Syaoran." Tomoyo understood this; there would be some difficulty on that front.

"It is a bit of a problem." Tomoyo acknowledged. "When Meilin-chan learns of this she'll be most displeased with him." Sakura nodded.

"I think Syaoran-kun will take it well," She stated, "But Meilin-chan will feel like she's given up her dearest gift only to find it on a shop's shelf."

"But gifts," Tomoyo pointed out, "Can be returned when both sides love them." Sakura nodded, still not sure how to break the news. "Or maybe you could have both of us."

"No!" Sakura answered. "Not only will that leave me with a legal dilemma but I could not deprive one while attending to another. Perhaps I should try matchmaking for Syaoran-kun." Tomoyo considered the idea before figuring...
133332221121.title: Love is a Splintered Thing

1333322211212.content:
"Maybe," Tomoyo suggested, "Li-kun and Meilin-chan could be little people as well." Sakura stared at her in disbelief.

"Wouldn't the 'dating pool' (I think it's called) be as small as they would be in such a situation?" Sakura asked.

"Meilin-chan is very fond of Li-kun," Tomoyo commented, "So maybe they could start again, have another go. Anyway, you never know if their soul mates will be amongst those in such need." Sakura looked at her newly-realised girlfriend's beaming face; it seemed to her that Tomoyo really did see being a tiny person in Sakura's captivity as the best life not just for herself but also for nearly everyone in the world.

"The face remains," Sakura stated, "That they will have to know about what has happened before such a thing can be done. But how to do so?" Tomoyo kept her smile and said.

"If you shrank them first then any blame Meilin may try to place on either of us would be ineffectual."

"But then," Sakura pointed out, "They would have no alternative to date other tinies."

"Unless," Tomoyo indicated, "They could find someone they really did love from peeping out of your pocket."

"Which would have to depend on love at first sight." Sakura added. With the discussion over it was up to her to decide how to go about it.
1333322211212.title: Shrinking or Speaking?

choices: Ask the Lis to come to Japan
Go to Hong Kong with Tomoyo
13333222112121.content:
"I'll have to tell them first." Sakura decided. "It would be wrong to shrink them and then say that I can no longer be Syaoran-kun's number one." Tomoyo let this sink in. "I don't wish to do it over the phone. Maybe when they come to visit?" Tomoyo shook her head.

"You can't be sure if they'll both come." She commented.

"What about that time when Meilin-chan came rushing to Japan because Syaoran-kun had to tell her about him and me?" Sakura checked.

"He phoned her and said he had to tell her something that could never be done by phone." Tomoyo identified. "I think the best option is for us to go to them, that way any possessions can be shrunk with them." Sakura was surprised by this; Tomoyo was actually suggesting that Syaoran and Meilin both be shrunk as soon as they broke the news.

"Isn't that a little sudden?" Sakura asked.

"Well, if the roles were reversed?" Tomoyo suggested. Sakura thought about it; being told that a relationship she's been in is now over but she could live with the second party in miniature form if she wanted Sakura understood there'd be misgivings. Even if they agreed voluntarily they may get second thoughts upon returning to Hong Kong to pack. Still, she felt that suddenly flying to Hong Kong unannounced was a bit forward. She decides to...
13333222112121.title: Words before Wands

133332221121212.content:
"Very well," Sakura conceeds, "We'll go to Hong Kong." Tomoyo nearly leaps at this. "Who's going to book the tickets?" Tomoyo paused at this.

"I wouldn't recommend going by plane," She advised, "There'll be many raised eyebrows in customs if they see two tiny skeletons on the X-ray." Not only that but the customs problem is still there." Sakura was about to ask how else they could smuggle two shunken persons into Japan when it dawned on her.

"Ready, Tomoyo-chan?" Sakura checked.

"Ready Sakura-chan." Tomoyo answered. At that they departed the house, Sakura remembering the doorkey as always, and then Sakura summoned her staff and combined the Fly and Dash cards. Before long they were soaring through the air as fast as any commercial jet, making a B-line for Hong Kong. Upon reaching Hong Kong will they find Syaoran and Meilin...
133332221121212.title: Flight 52 for Hong Kong

133332222.content:
Sakura lay upon her bed thinking over the events since she sealed the Hope Card. Generally it was no different to any other schoolgirl but, of course, her constantly rising power and a now-mild need to use the cards meant that there were a few instances where her powers had been put to use. They all yielded good results but there was nothing she did that really caused a major turnover with anyone's life.

Since turning 13 Sakura found that she was experiencing an overhaul of her sense of maturity. She was already familiar with romance for males ever since she was 9 and a half but now she found that she wished to make a much bigger difference than she ever considered before. She lay upon her bed wondering what kind of extraordinary deed she could bring about that would both make her and everyone else happy.

As she thought this over she found that her mind kept wandering back to the days when she grew beyond normal human size; in spite of her embarrassment and misgivings those days Sakura found herself desiring to look down upon people now. She pushed these thoughts into a reverse perspective, she imagined what it would be like for those she'd be looking down opon; surprisingly she always found that, while they'd be scared at first, they'd eventually accept their position.

After another half-hour of thinking this over Sakura found that she couldn't make herself change her mind; she'd begin her own tiny civilisation populated by people she'd shrink. Now all she had to do was decide how small they'd be and who would be included and who wouldn't.
133332222.title: Sakura's Surprising Idea

1333322221.content:
Sakura went things over in her head. She had a wide range for the size of her civilians, from the size of her finger down to the size of microbes.

Each option had its own possibilities. The larger sizes meant that they could interact directly but the room required meant that her brother and father would have to be included quite early on. At microscopic sizes the lodgings could be more discrete but any interaction would have to be via her magic.

What is her decisions?
1333322221.title: A Selection of Sizes

13333222211.content:
Sakura decided that she had better play it safe with regards to discovery. One thing was sure there would be plenty of magic being used, she knew she'd have to practice.

After a few days Sakura found that the only way was to produce a contained environment, which only she could penetrate for whatever reason.

Later on she decided that she had to confide in someone and there was only one who could take it in a calm manner and think it over, Tomoyo Daidouji.

---

"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo responded upon hearing her wishes, "That's the best news I've heard since Hiiragizawa-kun told you that you had become more powerful than Clow-san." Sakura hadn't expected Tomoyo to be so eager on the first response, so she continued with her explanation.

"So you'd be carrying these communities around with you?" Tomoyo checked once Sakura finished.

"Well," Sakura answered, "I suppose so." With this Tomoyo then suggested a medium that other people wouldn't give a second thought.
13333222211.title: Micro-Societies

133332222111.content:
"How about little worlds in pretty little rings?" Tomoyo suggested. "It would be very much like walking on the surface of a world." Sakura thought about this.

"How could it be broken in gently, Tomoyo-chan?" She asked. "I realise that it would be very Earth-like to the occupants, but what of the band?" Tomoyo thought for a moment before understanding.

"I tell you what, Sakura-chan," Tomoyo suggested, "The choir is supposed to be going to Osaka for a week for a chance to sing at the city's music hall. Why don't you put us in a prototype ring before we set off?" Sakura was stunned upon hearing this.

"But what about the chance that you'd have otherwise?" Sakura pointed out.

"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo answered, closing her eyes, "I'd much rather be a microscopic tenant in a ring on your finger than sing in front of the entire population of Osaka." Sakura is rather surprised by this; she knew that Tomoyo got rather carried away but this took the biscuit.

What is Sakura's answer?
133332222111.title: A Ringworld

choices: Earth-like, with custom-made homes for each
A World-class hotel with long-reaching gardens
1333322221112.content:
"It seems to be the only option I have at this moment." Sakura mused. "I'm still concerned about the effect the drastic change in plan will have on the rest." Tomoyo thought about this before figuring.

"We could still all sing afterwards, regardless of the audience or venue. That way it will be just a disappointment and not a significant frustration." Sakura sighed and accepted the idea. She now had ten days to decide on both how the ring would look on the outside and what would be inside.

The next day she got a moment with Tomoyo to discuss the outside appearance. Tomoyo had a drawing of a gold ring with a great opal that would hold a sort of outdoors but Sakura felt that the opal might draw unwanted attention. Tomoyo had several other ideas, each having a distinct feature, but Sakura found that she would only settle for a plain silver ring; a compromise involved a set of simple decorative grooves on the outside of the band.

For the next few days both Tomoyo and Sakura planned the interior where the choir would reside. Tomoyo envisaged a large hotel-like area with a long landscape garden stretching out at both ends. Sakura, on the other hand, wanted something that would be more like Earth with simulated sky and individual homes for every member, complete with a varied landscape that would have extremes hiding the fact that their world would not be completely round. Where Tomoyo was concerned she'd know for sure and she didn't have any qualms about vague hints as to their whereabouts like great walls rising at the sides and a simulated sky in the ceiling.

Which does Sakura settle for?
1333322221112.title: What's the Environment Like?

choices: Ask Kero to check it out
Seal her room and take a look herself
13333222211122.content:
"You can influence memory, right Sakura-chan?" Tomoyo inquired.

"Well," Sakura answered, "Yes. The Erase card can wipe memories but..."

"You don't wish to deprive anyone of their memories." Tomoyo finished. "It's all right, Sakura-chan, you could always make them think it was a dream." Sakura pondered over this; it wouldn't cover up the fact that they'd miss the Osaka concert but Tomoyo's design would be easier to realise.

"Very well." Sakura answered. "You can stay in a hotel." Tomoyo was thrilled, her mind now wondered whether to ask Sakura for a room that would look out onto the finger that the ring would be worn.

---

Two days in advance of the intended trip Sakura had finally managed to produce a map of the inside of her ring, giving her a better reference so that there would be little or no errors. With that in mind she practiced her creation technique. She produced her staff and the Create card.

"As this map is drawn produce a world within a silver ring that shall fit upon my finger, whereby gravity shall point to the bones within the very digit upon which it is worn... CREATE!" In a flurry of brilliant magic the Create card scanned the works detailing all and, in less than a minute, Sakura now saw the ring she had asked for lying upon the map. Reverantly she lifted the ring off it and set it down by her hairbrush. She paused as she looked at it, thinking of all that was inside and of the school choir that would be calling it home for a time; she thought how Tomoyo would be so small that the hairbrush would be the size of the Earth to her. She carefully put the map away and now wondered if the contents were as they should. What does she do?
13333222211122.title: Genesis

133332222111221.content:
"Kero-chan." Sakura called in a cheery manner. He looked up from a dessert recipe book.

"Yeah?" He responded.

"Could you do a small favour for me?" She asked. Steadily he drifted over to her.

"What's it worth?" He bargained; she knew him all too well and had a good idea for a reward.

"All the strawberry shortcake you can eat!" She offered; his sneer changed into a half-smile.

"Well...!" He started but caught himself. "Hang on, what would you like me to do?"

"Go inside this ring and see if everything is according to these plans." She produced the map from her drawer. Kero's jaw dropped but he soon recovered. With the choice between a brief jaunt into a micro world with strawberry shortcake for afters and continuing to moon over a recipe book he decided to take a chance.

"I'm in!" He answered and nearly leapt at the ring, desparate to get it over with.

"Wait a moment, Kero-chan." Sakura commented as she retrieved the Move and Little cards. She didn't even need to command as they lit up in her grasp and Kero now shone before his silhouette dissipated into sparkling glitter shooting into the ring. Sakura now stood there waiting for the feeling that Kero had done his task.

Eventually she detected the sensation and commanded the cards to undo their magic; a trail of glitter emanated from the ring and materialised into Kero, at one-fifth his normal size, on the nearby table.

"What the...?" He squeaked. "Sakura, you didn't say anything about this."

"Well," She answered, bending down to his level, "It seemed to make more sense, so you can get more out of less." She commanded Sweet and Create to make a strawberry shortcake, which manifested right next to her tiny Sun Guardian. Kero's pinpoint eyes lit up. "Now then, Kero-chan," Sakura indicated, "How was it in there?" Kero answered...
133332222111221.title: Kero Pioneers

1333322221112211.content:
"It seemed to be how you intended." Kero replied. Sakura smiled and, to add to the thanks, she used the Big card to slightly enlarge the cake.

"Thank you, Kero-chan." She said but he didn't respond as his face was immersed in the cake. While he was gorging away at the strawberry shortcake Sakura decided to put the ring on so as to get used to it. Once it was on her finger she now marvelled at her creation, thinking about the miniature world within.

---

The next day Sakura went about her normal activities while wearing the ring; several people appreciated it as a simple piece of jewellery and even her teachers didn't think much of it because it was okay to wear rings in school as long as there weren't too many. When Tomoyo saw it she was over the moon as she thought about the change in plans to the choir's school trip.

"One thing, Tomoyo-chan," Sakura checked, "How are you going to get your luggage in with you?"

"It's all right, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo answered. "We were expected to be away for a while so luggage would be necessary anyway." Sakura nodded in recognition of this fact before Tomoyo went on to ask. "Do you think I could have a room with a view?" Sakura was stunned by this and wondered what sort of a view she desired. At first she figured that it would be a view of the landscape garden but, just to be sure...

"What sort of a view?" She asked.

"A view of you, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo replied. Sakura was stunned.

"Y...You'd really be happy to have a view of my skin from your room?" She checked. "At such a small size?!?" Tomoyo nodded.

"There's no landscape that's as beautiful than one that is you." She commented in an almost dream-like state.

"Okay," Sakura conceeded, "Will it be a view of my finger or of my hand?" She sweatdropped at the thought of it. What is Tomoyo's choice?
1333322221112211.title: A Room With a View

choices: Tomoyo doesn't see Sakura beforehand; the spell is cast without them noticing
13333222211122112.content:
"Both options appeal Sakura-chan," Tomoyo answered, "But since you've given me a choice I'd like a view of your hand. That way I'm sure it'll be a panoramic view." The last sentence was in a whisper. Sakura gingerly slipped the Create card out of her pocket and telepathically asked it to create one room with a curtained window looking out across her hand with a few special measures.

"Only you will be able to open the door from the outside, Tomoyo-chan." Sakura informed her. "You can let others in if you wish. If anything serious occurs, like a bad accident, I'll do what I can to help." Tomoyo smiled, knowing all too well that Sakura would do whatever she could to stop any of them suffering.

"Do you have any recommendations for additional luggage?" Tomoyo asked. Sakura shook her head in a negative response.

"I've already accounted for what would normally be packed when expecting to stay in a hotel," She replied, "Anything else important will be readily available." She paused as she realised that what she just said sounded like some kind of tour guide.

"Well," Tomoyo stated, "I know what I'm bringing. If I don't see you before the time to depart I will now say 'Good luck' and 'See you out of the hotel window'." She giggled at the last comment. Then they went about the day as per usual.

How does the next day go?
13333222211122112.title: Final Arrangements

choices: In a room resembling a pantomime theatre
133332222111221121.content:
On the day Tomoyo was driven to school on account that she had brought a fair amount of luggage. As for her friends in the choir they all had just one suitcase and, perhaps, a second bag of some sort. Shouko Tsujitani, the music teacher, had actually brought two suitcases and her handbag. Because of the field trip their classes had been informed a few days in advance and Tomoyo had told Sakura exactly when they'd be going. Considering the time Sakura felt the only way this could be done is if she was to place her first class under a temporary charm. Unfortunately this meant using the Time card; even in a localised environment it would still take plenty of power. Sakura knew she had to act fast.

"Okay everyone," Tsujitani announced to the choir, "I'm glad we're all here. The coach driver phoned earlier saying he had to stop for fuel, so he'll be a bit late I'm afraid." But the choir did not complain and indicated that they accepted the reason. Tomoyo was the least of all to complain; she knew that the later the coach would be the more time Sakura would have. "In the mean time," Tsujitani continued, "I thought we could practice our scales." With that everyone took their usual seats in the music room while she sat at the piano.

Sakura had given herself no more than ten minutes to get to the music room, shrink the choir, and reach her first class of the day before the time charm wore off. Furthermore the less time she took the less magic would be used and the less conspicuously exhausted she'd be. She managed to reach the window of the choir in just two minutes, leaving her with eight. Looking in she identified where their things were and where they were all sitting. Having checked the whole room Sakura now made the command.

"Bring the choir and their luggage into the hotel in my ring, Little, Move." With that every student, every suitcase, every bag and the music teacher all glowed yellow and became a stream of glittering dots flying through the window like it wasn't there and right into Sakura's ring. When the stream had stopped Sakura dashed to the classroom she needed to be in. She now had between six and seven minutes before the charm on the classroom had to end.

The intensity of the spell cast upon the choir meant that they materialised unconscious, which would make them believe that they had suddenly dozed off. Where do they wake up?
133332222111221121.title: One Little Schoolgroup

choices: An exact copy of the school's music room
1333322221112211212.content: The choir in Sakura's ring had materialised in...
1333322221112211212.title: Replica?

13333222211122112121.content:
There was a duplicate of the school's music room inside Sakura's ring so that the choir could continue practicing if they so wished, but the arrangement of windows was slightly different as the view looked out onto a terrace and the garden beyond. The members of the choir came round at slightly different rates. Tsujitani was actually one of the second to come round and Tomoyo was one of the third.

"Wh...what happened?" Asked one of the students as they attempted to get her bearings. Many were bewildered but the teacher made an attempt to rationalise.

"Did we just doze off?" She suggested. "I could've sworn I had enough sleep."

"If we did just doze, sensei," Another student said while looking out the window. "We must've done a lot of sleepwalking. Come and look out here." Everyone practically rushed over to the windows and looked out at the beautiful garden, styled in a quintessentially Western European type of stately home garden. While everyone else gasped in shock Tomoyo just smiled and chuntered.

"Thank you, Sakura-chan." As everyone else struggles with their enigmatic situation who shall make the suggestion of looking round?
13333222211122112121.title: Waking Up to a Possible Holiday

133332222111221121211.content:
"Excuse me, Tsujitani-sensei." Tomoyo spoke up. "Since we can't be sure where we are, do you think we should try and find our bearings?" Shouko paused to consider this before saying.

"I admire you're ability to keep calm, Daidouji-san. However I can't be sure if there's any one unscrupulous lurking around. Therefore I suppose the only thing we can do is check out our surroundings as a single group." She now addressed the entire choir. "Please gather as much as you can carry for a long walk, just in case. Daidouji-san, please make your way to the front of the group while I stay at the back; we don't know if anyone's gonna sneak up on us." As they gathered what they could Tomoyo thought.

'I know no one's gonna be sneaking through this place; we're the only ones here.' She picked a shoulder bag to carry and stood as close to the door as possible.

"Okay," Tsujitani declared once the choir was lined up, "In light of where this room appears to be, once we're out the door I'd like us to turn..."
133332222111221121211.title: Ready to Explore?

choices: "We'll have to check all those rooms we passed."
1333322221112211212112.content:
"Because I doubt we're gonna find anyone creeping up on us from that end." Shouko said. With that Tomoyo opened the door and stepped into the corridor; she smiled at the sight of the soft red and black patterned wall-to-wall carpet and the upturned wall-lights, thinking how courteous Sakura was being to her tiny guests in giving them something this classy. She turned right and steadily led the rest of them down the corridor.

On the left of the group was a series of dark oak doors, each with a number on them in clean brass, while on their right was a number of fine artworks depicting scenes from Sakura's card catching days done in a slightly more surreal tone so as to give it that more 'artsy' feel to it, although now and again they'd pass a door or set of double-doors labeled by name in what appeared to be silver kanji. Where the walls were not decorated there was a golden wallpaper and the ceiling bore a light pink colour that was now and again interspersed by small chandelier-type lights. After about one hour walking along this corridor they came upon a great conservatory looking out over an ambient forest under a blue sky that seemed a tad off.

"Sensei?" One of the students asked. "What do we do now?" Tsujitani thought this over before answering.

Tomoyo woke up on a Saturday morning ready to greet the day. She got up and got dressed and generally ready to get going for the day. She headed downstairs to join her mother for breakfast. It all seemed perfectly ordinary, though Tomoyo had learnt about Sakura's magic only three days ago.

What Tomoyo hadn't realised yet was that she was now in a reality where women were bigger than men; about 200 times bigger! However as Tomoyo prepared to leave her mother said something she did not expect.

"Remember," Sonomi called after her, "Watch where you step!" Tomoyo turned to her mother with a puzzled look on her face.

"I'm sorry?" She asked. "I always thought you told me to look both ways before crossing the street."

"That's only for your own safety." Sonomi answered. "What I'm talking about is the risk of men getting crushed under your feet." Tomoyo was astonished. She always knew her mother would not make this sort of stuff up and the tone in Sonomi's voice added to the conviction. Tomoyo now knew that she was in another reality, one where men are tiny and women are gigantic.

14131221.content:
Sakura started from her bed as her alarm clock went off. She yawned as she recognised the situation and turned off the alarm. Just then her hyper-sensitive ears picked up her father's voice calling her downstairs for breakfast. Once she responded to his call she got dressed, brushed her teeth, did up her pigtails, grabbed her school bag and went downstairs. But this isn't Sakura as we know her. In this alternative universe all females are a hundred times bigger than the men, so she's about four-hundred feet high!

In this morning routine she would often find her brother sitting upon the table top at the men's table. As usual he would comment about her being a monster, although it now stems from her size as well as the sounds she makes at times. Another difference is that Sakura would merely sweatdrop and tell Touya to shut up.

It's amazing for her to hear her miniature family so well. Like virtually all other women and girls in this universe, Sakura has a adaptation that allows her to interact with the much smaller men without any difficulties. Such adaptations include hyper-acute hearing and eyesight, an extra-quiet voice, extra-sensitive touch for when she holds someone in her fingers and, in case of accidental ingestion, a special sense of taste that alerts her whenever a man has entered her mouth so she can immediately spit him out.

It was also a major feat for men to cope with the female-sized world around them. Touya and Fujitaka could get on with any household chores thanks to special vehicles designed to allow men to fill in for a woman's role wherever the need should arise, as it has done for the Kinomotos.
14131221.title: Start at the Beginning

141312211.content:
When Sakura was only three years old her mother, Nadeshiko, passed away. There were worries that the family would collapse as the only female left was young Sakura, but Fujitaka took it in his stride and got a few extra chore vehicles to compliment those he used when Nadeshiko was pregnant.

It wasn't easy for Touya to get the hang of these vehicles but Fujitaka was a patient teacher (no pun intended) and Sakura proved to be very mature, responsible and independent for her age. Such an arrangement made it manageable for the family to carry on as they were. Furthermore, since Nadeshiko's ghost visited regularly while Sakura was still a pre-schooler, her presence made it easier for Touya to cope with the situation.

As Sakura grew up from her 200ft-300ft height she showed herself to be quite helpful around the house; as such Fujitaka agreed that she could be included in the chore rota, which gave him all the more time for his job.

Touya's teasing was a rather dangerous activity for him as, when she was younger, Sakura might have proved fatal in reacting but she always limited her most severe reactions to being almost entirely verbal.
141312211.title: Family History

choices: Switch to Sakura in First Person
1413122112.content:
As Sakura looked down at her older brother on the tabletop he continued with his teasing.

"One thing's for sure," He said, "Even for a monster your appetite has got to be overwhelming." Just then Sakura took her rather witty response to his teasing by referring to their size difference in another way. She brought her index finger down right next to him and bent down to say to him.

"Just think yourself lucky that I'm not like Godzilla." As usual when she made this counter-tease Touya simply patted her finger and muttered agreement half-heartedly. Her assertiveness always ended here as she stood up straight again and went to see if her father needed any help with serving the breakfast.

Fujitaka had just been operated the arms of the cooking crane to get Sakura's breakfast onto the giant plate when he looked out of the cockpit to see his towering daughter peeping in.

"Shall I serve the breakfast, dad?" She asked him. Fujitaka just smiled and accepted her offer. Before taking the breakfast over to the table she held up her hand to the upper door of the cooking crane; her dad unbuckled himself and stepped out onto her middle finger. Sakura lifted him up to her shoulder, which he jumped onto, and then she carefully pushed the crane to one side before carrying her breakfast to the table.

Once she had set Fujitaka in his seat next to Touya on the table Sakura sat down and used a couple of unusual instruments to give them a small portion of her breakfast. Just the right size for them even though their portions were mere crumbs to her.

Sakura had no need to rush her breakfast because Touya and Fujitaka often relied on her to give them lifts to wherever they needed to go; however Sakura would rush her breakfast if there was a sense of urgency for either of them.
1413122112.title: Breakfast

14131221121.content:
Once Sakura finished her breakfast Fujitaka asked her to put his and Touya's plates in the dishwasher, which only catered for men, before she washed hers and the cooking pots. As usual Sakura showed great efficiency and delicacy in her endeavours.

While she washed the pots, her head and shoulders looming like a distant mountain from atop the dining table where Fujitaka gathered his things and Touya packed his school's football uniform.

Once finished, Sakura left the pots to dry in the dish rack and returned to (literally) give her father and brother a lift. She lowered her hand onto the tabletop for them to climb into and, once they did so, she slipped them into her front pocket. Once sure that they were in a comfortable position she grabbed her backpack, went to put on her rollerblades and pads, and exited the house.
14131221121.title: Preparing for the Day

141312211212.content:
Sakura whizzed down the street, taking the same route she always did on a weekday morning. She slowed down slightly once she careened along an alleyway lined with cherry trees in full blossom, but she soon got back up to speed again.

For all her speed, Sakura was so agile that she provided a smooth ride for Touya and Fujitaka (think like on a High Speed Train). In fact it hardly seemed like five minutes before Sakura stopped to drop her father off at a train station.

This station was on a network especially designed to help the male gender travel around towns and cities built to the females' scale; it was a bit like a semi-underground hi-tech tram network.

Sakura had just arrived as a couple made their farewells, the lady petting her husband on the back with her index finger before strolling off down the street. Now Sakura carefully extracted Fujitaka from her pocket and gently set him down on the ledge outside the entrance, which made sure that girls and women could easily drop off any family and friends without having to bend over too much.

Making sure he had all his materials with him, Fujitaka then waved a thank you to Sakura, whereupon Sakura made her polite farewell before setting off with Touya in her pocket for another rendezvous.

143311222211212.title: Tomoyo?

1433112222112121.content:
Rubbing her eyes Tomoyo rose from her bed; although she was still a bit tired she could never pass the option of spending as much time as she could with the one she loves, even if it did mean missing a few extra minutes of rest. Strolling across her bedroom to the en suite there was something about the silhouettes outlined by the light coming through the curtains that seemed different but she couldn't find the willpower to check it out so she continued to the bathroom to freshen up.

Once she had taken a shower and dealt with her ablutions Tomoyo returned to her bedroom to get dressed. As she put the last garment on she noticed the silhouettes more clearly now; although the typical garden silhouettes were still there she noticed that the more distant silhouettes were somewhat different. Just as she began to walk over to her window she heard a major cry that seemed to shake the earth; she could recognise Sakura's onomatopoeia but was surprised by how loud it was; she could almost understand it if Sakura were in her house but, as far as Tomoyo knew, she wasn't.

Having recovered from the shockwave Tomoyo could hear strange movements outside and occasionally found the light coming through the window being almost totally blocked; she tried to figure out what it was. The first thing that came into her mind was that it was a Clow card, which would've explained why she could hear Sakura as she would have to have shown up if she identified its presence but she couldn't figure what Clow card would do something like this. As she pondered on this she heard Sakura's voice at a more tolerent level, even though it was as though they were sitting opposite each other at an el fresco table when she couldn't see anyone in the room with her, but the light was being obstructed again.

"Tomoyo-chan," Sakura called out, "Are you ready to come out?" Judging by the direction of her voice Tomoyo figured that Sakura was outside her window; hoping to see her favourite girl suspended in the air brandishing the latest of her cards but sorry she was unable to tape the action Tomoyo grabbed her video camera and slung open the curtains... only to be met by the most heart-stopping, eye-opening, breath-taking, overwhelming, passion-firing, awe-inspiring, amazing, logic-defying humbling sight she'd ever seen. Sakura was right in front of her and above her; the biggest living thing she'd ever seen! In this moment she could already tell that Sakura far exceeded the tallest building she knew of.
1433112222112121.title: Waking up to a Whopper

14331122221121211.content:
Tomoyo stood there staring up at Sakura's face, dominating the sky, while emotions of all forms rushed through her. The sight was so overwhelming that she could not hide her feelings from the (putting it mildly) giant Sakura; whereupon the huge (no pun intended) smile slipped into an expression of concern.

"Tomoyo-chan," Sakura asked in a surprisingly quiet voice for her size, "Are you all right?" For a moment Tomoyo's turmoil of emotions settled down so that awe and curiosity became the dominant feelings.

'If she's bigger than a city,' Tomoyo thought, 'How can she see me, much less my face? And how can her mouth, which could gobble up this whole house in one bite, produce such a seemingly quiet voice?' Figuring that now was not the time to ask or dwell on these Tomoyo pushed her curiosity to the back of her head and let feelings of joy and love take its place. Once her astonishment had subsided Tomoyo reached for the handle to her window, or more appropriately glass door, and slid it open, stepping out onto the balcony all the while aware of Sakura's gargantuan eyes locked onto her relatively tiny form.

"I'm fine, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo called up to her tremendously titanic friend. Sakura still looked bewildered though.

"Tomoyo-chan," She replied, her voice not seeming to get any louder, "You know you don't have to yell just for me." Tomoyo was shocked now; even though Sakura could probably have the whole of Tokyo for breakfast she could hear her as easily as if they stood eye-to-eye. When her focus returned to the colossal cardcaptor she saw that one of her hands were now in view, her pinky outstretched and coming towards her at a rate of knots.

If they were just classmates Tomoyo would probably have retreated back into her house and commence to get as far away from her bedroom as possible in the expectation that Sakura's 'little' finger would crash through the glass doors and knock out the opposite wall; however Tomoyo's complete and unconditional love for Sakura kept her legs firmly planted on the balcony as her eyes followed the ginormous digit closing in on her. It wasn't even within her own arm's reach even if she leaned out from the edge of the balcony when it was all she could see; in spite of the incomprehensible situation Tomoyo started paying more attention to the appearance of the tip of Sakura's pinky, the fact that she could see absolutely no flaw in the smooth light-coloured skin and that the fingernail arched across like the roof of a modern airport building, for want of a better analogy. Tomoyo found that she did not have more time to admire it from her home as the lower end of the fingertip brushed against her and pulled her along with it as Sakura withdrew her humongous hand and lifted her pinky into the air, making sure that the teeny tiny Tomoyo would be able to stand up and perhaps pace about on the tip of her 'little' finger.
14331122221121211.title: Ultra-Enormous Sakura

143311222211212112.content:
Tomoyo had trouble believing everything that was happening. It was only yesterday that she had been at school with Sakura, sitting at the desk next to hers, seeing her pretty face and her cute smile, and now she was lying face-down on Sakura's fingertip and Sakura seemed to be acting as though nothing was out of the ordinary and, although out of the ordinary was becoming all in a day's work for Sakura, Tomoyo was sure that Sakura wouldn't be this casual if either one of them had changed size. Once the rush of being swept up into the air had stopped Tomoyo pushed herself up on her knees, noticing that Sakura's skin gave way like the mattress of her own bed but with the added bonus that there were no sheets to crumple and the gentle soothing heat eminating from her beloved Sakura. Turning round to take a seat on Sakura's pinky Tomoyo looked up into the heavens to see the same pretty face magnified thousands of times; there was so much of her to take in that Tomoyo attempted to follow the cardcaptor's face down from the fringe of her hair to the nicely rounded chin.

To Tomoyo Sakura's forehead had room for enough farmland to feed the whole of Tokyo and Yokohama combined and still have surplus left over for bad times; reaching the bridge of the nose Tomoyo felt like she was getting a bird's-eye view of the base of Mt. Fuji, looking left and right Sakura's eyes were great lakes of sparkling green with deep dark centres. As she looked into each one Tomoyo noticed she could see a reflection of a small figure in the lenses, that figure being herself. Continuing with her visual tour of Sakura's face she found that Sakura's nose had the most splendid slope and couldn't help but imagining everyone else in their class including herself going for a hike on this most magnificent ridge, stifling a giggle as she imagined Chiharu almost pushing Yamazaki up one of Sakura's nostrils. Then Tomoyo came to Sakura's mouth, which wasn't in a gigantic smile but had the lips pulled slightly downwards; going back up to the eyes Tomoyo saw Sakura's eyelids covering a fifth of the lakes of emerald and eyebrows you could go playing hide-and-seek in turned up. Sakura wasn't frowning or showing upset but was instead expressing concern.

"Are you sure you're all right, Tomoyo-chan?" Sakura checked, her voice never seeming to get any louder than what Tomoyo was used to. "You're acting like I've never held you before." Tomoyo now seemed to understand what had happened. As she prepared to explain things to her loved one she checked over how far away she was suspended from Sakura's face and figured that she must be...
143311222211212112.title: Vista Sakura

1433112222112121122.content: Rechecking Sakura's massive features so she wouldn't end up exaggerating her calculations Tomoyo deduced that Sakura must be...
1433112222112121122.title: 49 Miles?

choices: Tomoyo Confesses her Love Right Away
14331122221121211221.content:
"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo started in a slightly sombre tone, "I think that... I'm not the Tomoyo you know." Sakura was stunned and bewildered so, lifting Tomoyo closer to her, causing her little friend to be unable to see anything other than her eyes, eyelids, eyelashes and the bridge of her nose, she asked.

"What do you mean, Tomoyo-chan?" Tomoyo looked up into one of the emerald orbs, thinking on how Sakura must be speaking under her breath to get her voice that quiet, and did her best to relay her suspicions.

"I must've crossed into another dimension." She answered. "I cannot remember you being so... so..."

"Big?" Sakura suggested, this caused Tomoyo to giggle.

"Everything about you is the biggest, including understating." She returned, causing Sakura's lips, out of Tomoyo's field of vision, to crease up in a smile.

"Well," Sakura responded, "I can assure you that you're perfectly safe in my hand." Tomoyo nodded happily and gave the giant Sakura an entrusting smile. However, once Sakura's relief and Tomoyo's awe cleared up, Sakura now found herself feeling another sense of concern. "But, if you're a Tomoyo-chan from another dimension, then..."

"What of your Tomoyo?" Tomoyo finished for her. "Well, I suppose she's taken my place in my dimension. It makes feel like I'm being selfish." Sakura didn't ask as her eyes clearly indicated what she was feeling. "Well," Tomoyo continued, "I've now got tons and tons of Sakura-chan to love and she's going to be so disappointed when she finds that my Sakura-chan is no bigger than any other schoolgirl." Sakura listened to every word, amazed that the Tomoyo she was holding came from a world where she could fit in with the crowd, but also caught onto one particular word the tiny girl had said. She heard her own Tomoyo use it before but the context was clear now.

"You... love... me?" Sakura inquired and Tomoyo, noticing that the cat was out of the bag, moved over onto her knees, unfortunately the way Sakura had picked her up without damaging the Daidouji mansion meant that her shifting brought her precariously close to the edge.
14331122221121211221.title: Inter-Dimensional Tomoyo

143311222211212112212.content:
Just as Tomoyo prepared to tell a giant who could squish her instantly that she's the one she loves the most she suddenly found her sense of direction turning upside-down. She opened her eyes just in time to see that she was slipping off Sakura's fingertip; screaming in surprise and alarm she tumbled head-over-heels down the inside of Sakura's pinky. Up above her loved one watched with a slight amount of concern as her tiny friend continued to tumble through the air; she knew that Tomoyo would have a soft landing no matter how many miles she'd fall as her skin would always cushion the landing.

Tomoyo had to wait minutes before she found just how cushy her landing would be. She had fallen two miles before hitting flesh and now tumbled across the surface of Sakura's finger until she settled in the next knuckle down, three miles away from the tip of Sakura's pinky. Picking herself up and comically dusting herself off Tomoyo giggled at the thrill-ride she had been through and gave her giant love a cheery wave, at which Sakura sweat-dropped from the way that Tomoyo seemed to be rapidly getting over the fact that she was big enough to level entire prefectures.

"Sakura-chan," Tomoyo spoke up as she returned to the conversation before she fell, "I really do love you. You're my number one." Sakura took this in and wondered if her Tomoyo felt the same way. "No matter which version of you it is I love all Sakura-chans, from the smallest to the biggest." Sakura now found that she had to decide what her feelings were about Tomoyo.
143311222211212112212.title: Sakura-diving

choices: Sakura takes Tomoyo to her bed
Sakura takes Tomoyo to her dresser
1433112222112121122121.content:
"Tomoyo-chan," Sakura informed her, "I'll need some time before I can be sure if I can return your feelings through to the end."

"That is fine, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo replied. "So, is there anything you wanted before all this started off? Just so we can get through the day." Sakura looked at the speck of a girl in her knuckle; as she saw it this Tomoyo was now doing her best to fill in for her original Tomoyo.

"I suppose," Sakura responded while lifting her back up to her face, "I could show you around. If the Sakura you knew was the size you are then you must be curious as to how I live." Tomoyo looked up at her hostess with a mixture of surprise from her insight and joy from the prospect.

"Sakura-chan," She answered, "I'd love to be your little tourist! No matter what it is, as long as it involves Sakura-chan I'm sure I'll love it." Giving her a sweet super-sized smile Sakura now moved the index finger of her free hand over so that Tomoyo could jump aboard. She got the message as soon as she saw the outstretched hand alongside the one she was riding in; left to her own devices it would've taken Tomoyo ten minutes to get across Sakura's pinky to where she could sky-dive onto the tip of Sakura's index finger so Sakura tipped the hand Tomoyo was in slightly, causing her to slide down the valley of Sakura's knuckle and plunge onto Sakura's index finger in just four minutes.

Tomoyo soon realised why Sakura wanted her on this finger, she could see much more of the world around her. The first thing she saw was the Daidouji mansion spread out below them; it seemed to be on top of a cliff of some sort so Sakura didn't have to lie down to reach her. Looking beyond her mansion she saw a few more houses scattered around this clifftop and a tunnel in a wall out in the distance.

"Welcome to Kinomoto's Village." Sakura announced, causing Tomoyo to look up at her ride. "Because I'm so huge all my family, friends, fellow students, teachers and most of their relatives have to live in this cute little village in my bedroom." Tomoyo was amazed; so many people she knew were living on a.. surface of some sorts in Sakura's bedroom.
1433112222112121122121.title: Start the Grand Tour

14331122221121211221212.content:
Rising from her knees carefully so as not to unbalance Tomoyo Sakura turned round and showed Tomoyo some more of her bedroom. Tomoyo first noticed that Sakura had a lovely view of the sea from a south-facing window that had to be at least ten miles across; noticing the interest Tomoyo had in this Sakura once again gave running commentary,

"So as to make the lighting as natural as possible this window was installed to give all of us a proper daytime reference." Sakura turned again and Tomoyo espied another large furnishing. "Because we all sleep in the same room, in a way," Sakura continued, "I have to dress behind a fifty-five mile tall screen." Tomoyo had actually pulled out her video camera and was recording it all now. Now Sakura began to walk; her footfalls were impossible not to hear but Sakura lifted her arm up and down with them making it seem like she was gliding along to her passenger. Tomoyo couldn't help but take shots of the mighty Sakura Kinomoto covering the same distance in one step she would take three hours to cover on her comparatively puny little legs; she had already seen where Sakura was heading. A giant dressing table was directly ahead.

Tomoyo hadn't even realised they had arrived until she watched Sakura's face racing into the air as she was being set down on the dresser; she got the idea and when the descent stopped she strolled towards the front of Sakura's finger and slid down the tip until she stood on the underside of her fingernail, whereby she began walking again and jumping off the end onto the dresser. It was like jumping off a stage and, turning round, Tomoyo watched with astonishment as the massive digit soared away at close proximity before giving the giantess Sakura a respectful bow.

"Feel free to have a look round." Sakura advised her. Checking out the surface of the dresser she saw several Sakura-sized objects that defied comprehension. The was an angle-view mirror that could help keep the sun off the North Pole, a hairbrush with bristles the size of skyscrapers and possibly even bigger and an angle lamp that could place an entire National Park in permament daylight. What really caught Tomoyo's attention was Sakura's school uniform hat on the lamp; looking at the humongous item of clothing she started to imagine a few key cities hidden inside it.
14331122221121211221212.title: Tiny Tomoyo on a Dressing Table

choices: Tomoyo spots something under her fingernail
143311222211212112212121.content:
Once Sakura had set another massive digit in the surface of the dresser Tomoyo scampered back on board her enamouring colossus. As soon as she set foot on the underside of Sakura's fingernail set felt herself being lifted up; a reorientation of the finger caused her to tumble head-over-heels again but this time found herself lying on the fingertip, only 20 yards away from where the skin curved under the nail.

"What would my tiny Tomoyo-chan like to see next?" Sakura asked her. Tomoyo sat down upon her loved one's fingertip, having walked away from the nail for a few extra yards, and looked straight up into the emerald lakes of Sakura's eyes. She wondered what other extremely oversized items Sakura was lucky to possess and her first thought immediately went to where she slept.

"Can I see what mountain you use for a bed, Sakura-chan?" She responded; it was something of a tease to refer to Sakura as sleeping on a mountain and her hostess was used to that.

"Certainly." Sakura answered. "You're quickly getting used to this, Tomoyo-chan."

"Not really," Tomoyo replied, "Everything about you is still overwhelming but I see no reason to cower. After all, what difference would it make." This comment managed to make Sakura giggle, the vibrations resembling an earth tremor for Tomoyo. Sakura made her way over to her bed.

Tomoyo tried to look upon where her mighty friend slept but the extension of Sakura's fingernail blocked her view. To compensate Sakura rotated her wrist 90 degrees, giving Tomoyo the unobscured view she was hoping for. The vast expanse that served as Sakura's bed didn't look too dissimilar to a normal bed; there was a mattress, a pillow, sheets, and a blanket suspended by a frame that appeared to be made out of the same stuff as the dresser. Doing what she could to recognise the proportions from afar Tomoyo figured that the pillow must be 5 miles thick and 25 miles across. The sheets seemed to be thin enough but, considering the scale, Tomoyo wondered if they might actually be 100 yards thick.

Once the scrutiny of the magnificent bed was done Sakura prepared to show Tomoyo some more of her giant furnishings when...
143311222211212112212121.title: A Behemoth's Bed

1433112222112121122121212.content:
"Kinomoto-sama!" Cried a feminine voice. "Kinomoto-sama!" Turning round Sakura's hyper-keen eyesight espied a woman standing at the entrance to the Daidouji mansion; it was one of the maids. "Her ladyship wishes to know if young Daidouji-sama will be joining us for breakfast." Sakura knew of this kind of inquiry but it was totally unfamiliar to the Tomoyo she now held. She steadily made her way back to the mansion, lifting her passenger closer to her face. Down below Tomoyo looked up as Sakura's face loomed larger and larger until all she could see of Sakura was her mouth.

"Sonomi-san gets like this when I take you around in the morning." Sakura whispered to her. "It is up to you as to whether you'll have breakfast at home or with me." Getting the message Tomoyo pondered over the possibilities. She wished to spend time with her alternative mother but she kept thinking about how thrilling it would be to have breakfast with such an enormous Sakura. She felt like she would've gone straight for the latter but, due to her close proximity to Sakura's mouth, she couldn't help but think of how easily Sakura could just swallow her alive; when she watched the huge maw form the words Sakura spoke she kept seeing those enormous white teeth and imagined cars, buses and lorries all stuck in the gaps.

What is Tomoyo's final decision?
