1433112222222221112.title: Tomoyo?

14331122222222211121.content:
Tomoyo awoke to the sound of the alarm clock; though she was still weary she pulled herself up and looked across the room to see a maid standing by. Rubbing her eyes Tomoyo could now see that this maid was dressed in slighty different garb to what she was used to.

"Daidouji-sama," She said, "I'm here to help you prepare for the ceremony." Tomoyo got up but found herself confused by those words.

"What ceremony?" She asked, the maid seemed concerned but not shocked.

"You're still half asleep, my little lady." Came the reply. "I'm speaking of your inaugeration at the great temple." Tomoyo was now fully awake and started to go along with the maid's activities. As she was getting ready in this manner her mind continued over what had been said; she could not recall ever discussing a post at a shrine or a temple so she couldn't fathom what was going on. The biggest surprise was getting dressed as she found a wide variety of clothes to wear. The main article was not too big a deal as she had worn it before, a pearl-white dress with frills around the cuffs and collar, but there were accessories that did not seem too familiar: a green singlet that was to be worn over the dress, pink high-heeled shoes (which the maid reassured as okay for walking indoors in), a platinum tiara with a large emerald embedded in the forefront and a gold necklace with a pendant bearing a star that Tomoyo noted resembled Sakura's own star symbol.

Upon heading for the dining room Tomoyo found that her home seemed rather more complex than she remembered, as though a set of extensions and refurbishments had been made overnight, and there were various portraits on the walls showing many things that related to Sakura and her position as a card mistress.

"Am I in a parallel universe?" Tomoyo asked herself. "Is Sakura-chan more open about her powers in this world?"

Entering the dining room Tomoyo found her mother sitting at the head of the table, as usual, with a couple of servants on the flanks. As Tomoyo took her seat she spoke up.

"Good morning, Tomoyo." Who responded likewise. When breakfast was served Tomoyo was amazed by the extra effort that had been put into it. "I'm so proud of you," Sonomi continued, "This is such a big day for you!" Tomoyo now popped the question of what this was all about. "Goodness me!" Sonomi exclaimed. "You must've been ever so excited last night that it's affected your memory. You know of Sakura-san?" Tomoyo smiled brightly at this. "Yes, yes you do. Today you will be officially recognised as the key mediator between her and our society. Such an honour it is for an ordinary schoolgirl." Tomoyo seemed quite confident in knowing that she was now in a parallel universe where Sakura's powers were made public, furthermore everyone now viewed her loved one as a mighty goddess. It made much more sense now.
14331122222222211121.title: Tomoyo, Priestess of Sakura

choices: ...it rose high into the sky, beyond the clouds
143311222222222111211.content:
Having finished her breakfast Tomoyo was now excused so the maid would escort her, along with two bodyguards, to the temple of which had been mentioned. Tomoyo also noticed that the bodyguards were in an attire that was rather more tradtional than she was used to.

Outside Tomoyo first noticed that her home was indeed bigger than usual and the gardens were larger; this seemed very bizarre but she hoped to find answers eventually, after all where Sakura's concerned just about everything else could wait. Continuing along the driveway Tomoyo now understood that they'd be walking there, which made sense in spite of the technological level being as she remembered it, the first thing she noticed upon leaving the grounds was that there was much more green space than she remembered but otherwise it was still the same Tomoeda that she knew.

As they walked along Tomoyo couldn't help but think that there was something wrong with the sky; everytime she looked up there seemed to be an odd shine to it in places. Her most rational answer was sparse water droplets in the air causing an odd refraction of the sunlight. Diverting her gaze from this she looked around, seeing yet more indications that everyone was revering her beloved Sakura as a kami. Statues of her wearing the various costumes she herself had sewn stood in various public spaces, rising into the air in a posture of power and majesty and, interestingly enough, in almost perfect colour.

Eventually Tomoyo could now see a major construct on the horizon, which she soon deduced as her destination. It certainly looked quite impressive but it took another fifteen minutes or so before she realised just how impressive, it was the biggest structure she had yet seen, in fact...
143311222222222111211.title: The Great Walk

1433112222222221112111.content:
Tomoyo was astonished, the temple seemed to form the circumference of Tomoeda and, from what she could gather, appeared to be made out of solid gold! This was something she definitely had to see.

Tomoyo was really taken aback by just how large the temple was. Not only did it surround Tomoeda but the walls were no less than 100 feet high, most likely bigger even than that. Before long she stood with her escort in a great plaza stretching along parallel to the temple and, right in front, Tomoyo could see golden steps leading up to two doors of half green and white with handles that, as of yet, could've been either gold or brass. There were two figures standing beside these doors wearing red robes, which she figured had to be priests.

Once they had crossed the plaza, during which Tomoyo felt more and more enriched while the bodyguards seemed to be getting shaky, Tomoyo could now gauge the number and height of the steps. She counted nineteen steps, each one being about five inches high. Just then the bodyguards apologised that they were not aloud any further and stepped back; acknowledging this Tomoyo waited for prompting from the one remaining escort.

"After you, Daidouji-sama." She said, whereupon Tomoyo gingerly placed one foot upon the first step and began a slow steady ascent to the doors while the maid followed on close behind.

Upon stepping onto the platform in front of the doors Tomoyo noticed that the two priests were bowing very low, as such Tomoyo responded likewise but an arm stopped her from getting her head lower than her shoulders. She looked to her side and saw that it was her escort. Tomoyo did some thinking about this as she compared the rank that she appeared to be receiving with the etiquette of Japanese greeting.

"It is time, m'lady." One of the priests mentioned as they slowly opened the doors...
1433112222222221112111.title: At the Temple

14331122222222211121111.content:
As the doors were pushed open Tomoyo looked forth and saw a long hallway with a golden floor, of which two-thirds were covered in a seemingly endless Persian carpet, and walls of what looked like shining-white marble, upon which there appeared to be tapestries depicting the story of Sakura the Cardcaptor, and up above was a gold ceiling. The two priests did not enter but instead stood to the side in permament bow while Tomoyo's escort led her forward into the temple.

Not long after entering Tomoyo heard the priests closing the doors behind them. The minute the doors shut she now found that the hall was illuminated by a soft light that could not be traced, it was as though the whole ceiling should be a single light but it did not shine brighter than the rest of the hall, the only evidence being the way the shadows fell.

Tomoyo was led deeper into the temple, now and again corridors led off from the hallway. Tomoyo wondered just how big the temple was when it stretched so far away from Tomoeda. Sometimes they would pass a priest or two or even a small group who always bowed deeply as Tomoyo went by, at first Tomoyo made a brief response but her escort ensured her that acknowledgement was not necessary for her. Tomoyo noted that all the priests wore a set of robes composed of different colours of the spectrum, which she theorised denoted rank. Eventually they came upon a less austentatious door than the first set. Upon passing through this Tomoyo was amazed to see what reminded her of a metro terminal.

It was so bizarre to be in a temple that required a railway line to traverse it; Tomoyo found that they seemed to be going at a surprisingly fast speed (she even wondered if it was faster than a Shinkansen) and the carriage was very luxurious. Tomoyo even found that a crew was serving her lunch during the journey. But they eventually reached another station where the escort led her off the train and up a grand staircase.

Tomoyo wasn't sure but the golden elements of the temple complex, as she figured it must be, seemed to have been left far behind, which was a reasonable assumption. After some more walking Tomoyo was now greeted by a priestess clad in white.

"Great One," She addressed Tomoyo, "Your arrival is an honour. Come! We are ready to begin the ceremony." Tomoyo followed her down some more golden corridors, which she figured were only featured in key locations, while her original escort went elsewhere. In a relatively short time she stepped through a well-decorated doorway and into...
14331122222222211121111.title: The Long Journey

143311222222222111211112.content:
Tomoyo now found herself inside a vast chamber with great gold walls all around; including the one she came through she counted fifty-two doorways and sets of stairs, which were of six steps six inches high each, and a vast circular floor upon which a massive silver etching of the circle of Sakura shone in the bright light, standing out against the multi-coloured floor, which shared the colours of the robes of the priests. From the outer edge to where the star was outlined it went from red to violet and, inside the star outline, it was a brilliant shining white. Up above the ceiling swept inwards where it rose from the golden walls and, right above the floor, it became a vast sky blue circle.

The priestess in white stood at the nearest edge of the star to Tomoyo, facing her, as priests and priestesses clad in violet and indigo bagan to enter. Not wanting to get lost in a crowd Tomoyo descended the stairs and set foot upon the floor. With each step she surveyed the symbols that she had seen when Sakura would summon her staff, now blown out of proportion. It took her ten steps just to reach the first character as she approached the centre; by the time she came to the priestess in white priests in blue were beginning to enter, about twenty minutes after Tomoyo had entered. All around them priests in violet robes were accumulating.

"Let us take our places, ma'am." The white priestess said as she crossed over the broad line of silver and into the white zone; recognising what she was to do Tomoyo did the same. As they walked Tomoyo felt really cheerful for no reason she could find and the priestess seemed to be staring at the ceiling. Getting closer to the centre Tomoyo saw a thin gold circle, which had earlier been lost in the brilliant white of the centre. The white priestess did not cross this line so Tomoyo followed her lead. "Please, great one," She pleaded, "Take up your position." Tomoyo looked around, wondering what she meant. "As the one closest to the Goddess you must stand upon the epicentre." She gestured towards the circle. Tomoyo soon figured out how this chamber worked; seniority determined how close to the centre you'd be, probably considering it holy, and yet she could stand right at the centre. She slowly and steadily stepped across this final threshold and, in only a few steps found the middle of the circle.

As she stood there Tomoyo saw the doorways, now appearing way off in the distance, swarming with colour as many more priests entered. As the ranks grew Tomoyo now saw that the priestess in white had withdrawn to halfway between her and the priests in violet. Once the doorways were clear the white priestess raised her arms and began to flap them, all around the priests knelt from the edge of the star to the feet of the stairs.

"By the will of the Great Goddess," The white priestess announced, "Let us bestow her greatest disciple with our praise." She turned round and knelt herself as the room filled with rhythmic chants. A strange energy seemed to be flowing into Tomoyo from all directions until, suddenly...
143311222222222111211112.title: Let the Ceremony Begin

1433112222222221112111121.content:
Tomoyo suddenly noticed that she could not feel the floor under her feet anymore, looking down she noticed that it was rushing away from her. Tomoyo found this amazing but wasn't all that surprised by it.

"Must be the Float card." She mused as her eyes rose from the receding floor up to the approaching ceiling. She wondered what was going to happen as it raced towards her faster and faster; instinctively she braced herself as it came upon her. Opening her eyes she found herself surrounded by blue, her body could still be seen clearly but the great chamber was now out of her sight. "Is this what it's like to use the Through card?" She wondered as she seemed to be swimming in some kind of opaque air.

Eventually Tomoyo now found herself seeing much farther as her head poked through the other end of the blue. She could see the golden roof of the temple receding into the distance, and apparently curving over the horizon, while beyond she was amazed to see the endless depths of space.

"A goddess's place is in the heavens," Tomoyo said to herself, "So Sakura must be somewhere out here." As she looked back down as her feet exited the blue she first noticed that the area of blue went right through to this end, surrounded by the gold roof, while the temple seemed to be stretching on from what she perceived as east to west far more than north to south. Tomoyo could not understand why she could see no evidence of clouds, oceans or greenery. Trying to figure this out she now noticed something else; north of the temple she could see a great pale plain stretching on and on with lines that could've been furrows but the scale was too big, while due south a similar sort of plain seemed to spread out in all directions with some very odd arrangements of similar lines. Looking around for more info Tomoyo noticed that there were two more elongated plains stretching due north, one shorter than that which had the temple and one slightly longer, and in between Tomoyo caught sight of the endless sea of space. Further checks yielded another one next to the longer one that was about the same length as the first she saw; off to the right of this she perceived the sphere of Earth at a reasonable distance and the shortest, but widest of these elongations beyond that.

As she zoomed away Tomoyo took another look, something was very familiar about this. The elongations each had a smooth protrusion over the horizons at the ends. Now Tomoyo gasped as she realised that, in fact, the temple was a massive ring on a hand that was so vast that she could not find a single adjective that could readily sum it up. She took a deep breath as she managed to turn round and look up, straight at Sakura's visage.

It was incredible! Tomoyo had discovered that Sakura was now so huge that the Earth could not accomodate her. Small wonder then that everyone she had met was treating her like a goddess. Tomoyo was so full of wonder that the sense of joy overlapped the sense of awe. Eventually Tomoyo's flight through the vaccuum from the ring on Sakura's finger came to an end...
1433112222222221112111121.title: Goddess Sakura Revealed

14331122222222211121111212.content:
Between Sakura's eyes, Tomoyo started to look around before she found she had not quite landed yet. Actually falling through a pore right in the central base of Sakura's forehead, she found herself in a well furnished room, the walls of which were Sakura's own flesh.

Before she could wonder too much, a familiar voice suddenly entered her mind. "Tomoyo-chan! So good to finally have you here again." At this Tomoyo gave a start, for while she did recognise the voice as Sakura's; the word "again" confused her greatly.

"Sakura-chan, what exactly is going on?" Was all Tomoyo could think to say with the wonder still at an overpowering level.

"Tomoyo-chan! You... what's happened?" Tomoyo felt Sakura's worry in her very being. "Did something happen to your memory?"

"I don't know... yesterday was just an ordinary day, and today I wake up and everyone sees you as a goddess! I don't know how that could happen in so short a time... unless I'm in an alternate universe or something..."

"Tomoyo-chan..." Sakura paused. "That... oh no. I think that might be my fault. I was trying to prepare you for the journey to your room while you slept... and I saw you fluctuate in existence for a moment. I pulled you back quick... but... oh gosh! What if I pulled a different you back here? I..." The concern in Sakura's mindvoice was obvious.

"Well, if you did, it's fine with me, Sakura-chan... but what happened to the me that was here?"

"She must be in the universe you were in." Sakura replied. "Are you sure you're not mad?"

"I could never be mad at you, Sakura-chan." Tomoyo heard something similar to a waterfall when she finished that comment. She wondered if perhaps Sakura had a sweatdrop but decided to continue without mentioning it. "Um... so could you tell me what's happened in this universe?"

"Oh! Yes, of course..."
14331122222222211121111212.title: Between Sakura's Eyes

143311222222222111211112121.content:
"Well, first off, do you know of the Clow Cards in your universe?" Tomoyo nodded at this, then immediately felt silly wondering if Sakura could sense that or not. The walls trembled slightly as Sakura chuckled. "Yes, I can see you nod. Well, firstly, I absorbed all the Clow Cards' powers, since Kero-chan said I could just remake the Cards when I became ready to pass them on. But absorbing them made me wonder what else I could do, so I called to the stars and tried to see if I could tap their power more directly. I ended up absorbing two Suns into my eyes. This had the side effect of making me grow, which I didn't expect. My best guess is I'll keep growing until my eyes alone are the size of those Suns. With me so far?"

Tomoyo was full of questions but managed to just nod. "Well," Sakura continued, "After that there was no way to hide my powers from the world. I did what I could to aid as many people as I could. Luckily I wasn't feared... well mostly wasn't... and, actually, I was surprised when a religion sprung up around me. I chose you, my closest friend, to help me when I became too big to stay on Earth. I'm hoping that you are willing to come with me when I leave... my universe's Tomoyo was but I won't hold you to what she decided."

At this Tomoyo felt she had to ask something. "What do you mean leave?"

Sakura hesitated at the worry in Tomoyo's voice. "I will have to leave the galaxy eventually. It's hard enough for my magic to keep my size from affecting the Solar System. Trying to do that for the whole galaxy would be far too complex for me to figure out in the time I have. I'll have to leave Earth behind, I'm afraid."

Tomoyo was shocked by this, but after some thought realised its truth. "Well, I will come with you for sure. I can't stand the thought of you being alone, and I can't stand the thought of being without you, Sakura-san!" After Tomoyo's determined declaration, the room suddenly became warmer and took on a reddish tint, causing Tomoyo to become worried.

"Are... are you sure, Tomoyo-chan?" The tone of Sakura's mindvoice made Tomoyo relax, and even giggle. It was obvious that Sakura was just blushing!

"Yes, I'm sure. But why can't you bring Earth with you? Surely you'd have room for the whole Solar System somewhere you could carry."

"I thought about that, but sealing the Solar System away from the galaxy doesn't seem like a good idea. Earth is getting overpopulated as it is, and even one star system will eventually run out of room for people to colonise."

"But surely you could make more planets if you needed? What about the Create Card?"

Sakura's mindvoice came back in a surprised tone. "I ... didn't think of that. But how would people react to my doing that?"

"Considering you're their goddess now, I would think they would want you to stay with them."

Sakura's mindvoice sounded amused. "Tomoyo you never cease to amaze me. You've just discovered all this and already you're fine with helping me again." Then it was Tomoyo's turn to blush. "But anyway, where would I keep the planets so that my movements wouldn't disrupt them?"

Tomoyo responded: "Well you could just...
143311222222222111211112121.title: Sakura explains...

1433112222222221112111121211.content:
"You could swallow them!"

The room shuddered as Sakura blinked a few times. "Um... well yes... I... I could use the Shield Card to section off a portion of my stomach I suppose."

While Sakura pondered this, Tomoyo had actually started thinking deeper about her suggestion. "Um, Sakura-san... What do you actually eat at this size? For food, I mean."

At this Sakura sweatdropped again, and hesitated before responding.
1433112222222221112111121211.title: eat them!"

14331122222222211121111212111.content:
Again the walls turned red signal a blush.

"I Um... Alternate between creating meal my size or um... Umm.. E-eating Planets that are either deserted, a dying star or that I've already been creating with the create card. Somethimes if I'm lucky I can also catch a stray meteor shower or comet" said the giantess with her Mind's voice.
14331122222222211121111212111.title: "Um... planets..."

143311222222222111211112122.content:
"After I completed the transforming of the cards," Sakura explained, "My magical potential had little to exert itself on, so it kinda accumulated until the Big card allowed it to flare off by giving me this growth spurt." The room began to warm up as the goddess blushed. "So, I couldn't exactly cover up my abilities as I kept growing and then all the cards decided to merge with me. Eventually people began to worship me as a god, and you were particularly accommodating of their beliefs but you also made sure they understood that some of their expectations were either wrong or unnecessary. When I grew too big to fit on the Earth it was permitted for me to move Tomoeda into the ring I manifested, which doubled as the main temple-complex for the priesthood that decided to dedicate their whole lives to me."

Sakura awoke slowly, feeling very confused over a dream she had. The details were now lost on her but she remembered feelings of surprise, fear and reassurance. She looked around the room for a moment but everything seemed normal. That would change when she looked out the window.

Tomoeda didn't seem all that different at first, but she was stunned to find that the sea was visible just off to the side in the distance and where there were once mountains far off there was now topography more akin to foothills and the suggestion of an immense structure of some kind. She was stunned.

"W...What's going on?" She asked in a stumped manner. Just then Kero flew up to her, giving her an odd look.

"Something troubling you, Sakura?" He asked.

"Everything around Tomoeda's changed." She answered. "You shouldn't be able to see the sea from this window and what's happened to the mountains!"

"What're you talking about? There are no mountains round here and of course you can see the sea! It's over there between the land and the sky."

"But I wasn't like this when I went to bed last night." Kero felt her forehead for a moment and asked.

"Can you remember how tall Tomoyo is?" Sakura gave him a funny look before answering.

"Certainly. She's about the same height as me, give or take an inch." Kero corpsed for a moment before adopting a thinking posture.

"Sounds like a dimensional shift." He commented. "I hope there aren't too many differences." She gave him another odd look. "Perhaps you should give Tomoyo a ring before going anywhere."
143312111222.title: A New World

choices: Nine and a half miles tall.
1433121112221.content:
Sakura sat at the table while everything seemed to go normally. The teasing, Nadeshiko's photo, breakfast, all went as they usually did. The chore rota listed today as a free day for her, and there was no school on. A few carefully chosen words were all that was needed to ensure that Kero's remarks could be cleared up.

Why did Kero-chan think phoning Tomoyo would be the best course of action? She thought as she returned to her bedroom. Will she be able to explain everything to me? Is she somehow involved in all these changes? If Kero-chan's with me, then I still have those cards. She entered her room and picked up her mobile.

There were three rings before Tomoyo answered; at first everything seemed normal.

"Tomoyo-chan?" Sakura opened the conversation.

"Sakura-chan." Came the reply. "It's good to hear from you. How are things?" There was a pause.

"I don't know." She answered. "The view from my window doesn't seem to be the same as I remember. Kero-chan said something about a dimensional shift."

"Oh." Tomoyo acknowledged. "A sort-of quantum trip that makes two identical things swap places between two realities." Sakura gasped.

"If that's the case, then I must be doing something similar in the other universe." There was a hint of a giggle on the other end of the line.

"So, how big do you remember me being?" Sakura became concerned; Kero had asked the same thing, essentially.

"About the same height as me." She repeated.

"Oh." Tomoyo sounded both amused and concerned. "Well, you'll find I'm taller than that in this reality."

"How tall?"

"I don't know how you'll take this, but perhaps hearing it will make it less of a shock when you see me." Sakura sweat-dropped at the implications. "I'm..."
1433121112221.title: Telephone Tomoyo

"Ehhhh?!?" Sakura cried in shock and disbelief. "N...Nine and a half miles?!"

"Hai." Tomoyo answered. "Please, don't let it bother you too much."

"H...How can you manage if you're so... big?" There was another slight giggle.

"I've been given plenty of help. Oka-san and you have been especially helpful. Thanks to your magic I can live like a normal person up here."

"Hoe? Where?"

"Can you see the top of the hills from your window?" Sakura walked over and took another look.

"Hai. What exactly is...?" Sakura froze as the implications sank in. On the other end of the line Tomoyo understood why her tiny friend had stopped and gave a nod.

"That's my home." There was a long pause as Tomoyo waited for Sakura to ask more about how a titanic girl could carry on while Sakura tried to wrap her head round the idea. "Ano, perhaps it would help if..."

Sakura still took a while to answer. She thought about actually sleeping with Tomoyo when she could hold a city in the palm of her hand, but if this was the norm round here she shouldn't have anything to worry about.

"I don't know." She squeezed out. "It's rather short notice. I'd have to ask dad."

"Just let me check with mum and I'll call you back." Tomoyo replied. When she hung up Sakura sat down for a moment, thinking over how Tomoyo could be so casual when she could easily dwarf Mount Everest.

It was fifteen minutes before the phone rang. Sakura hesitated in answering it, wondering if excitement would cause Tomoyo's voice to be closer to her size and explode the phone with its power. She did answer though.

(I am taking some inspiration from this add right here, as he explained it better and I kinda wanted to use the feel here. Credit goes to him. https://www.writing.com/main/interact/it...)

Well Tomoyo surely has one special type of life, and a pretty good and big one at that. She woke up from her bed, ready to start a fun day in the summer with her friends. It was extremely thoughtful for her mother to have gotten her a private island with many things to do as she is a 400ft tall giantess (was going to make her a little bit smaller around 200ft tall to be more exact to Godzilla's height) who height easily matches those of some of the tallest buildings in the world. She sure has been the luckiest, and more importantly, the largest girl in the world.

Tomoyo surprisingly remembered a great portion of her growth over the years. You see, when she was just a baby, she started developing some growth spurts that was caused by an unknown disease that no one could even explain. It started small over the years, but by the time she was around 3 or so, she started to grow a lot bigger. At that point her mother and investors had talks with the government over the extreme conditions of her growth, and what adaptations would be needed to help the girl through her lifetime.

When she first entered school, many of the boys called her a Kaiju like Tomozilla, or Girlzilla, and very few girls came outside to play with a girl that was pretty big. Some were brave enough to talk to her and such, but it did took Tomoyo awhile to get used to it. The people did respect her privacy even though she was the talk of Japan in many aspects and there was, funnily enough, a talk about having her being registered as the world's first real life Kaiju; oddly enough that surfaced after an incident that helped her. You see, when she was around 6, she was actually called by some demolition groups to help destroy some buildings for reconstruction purposes, and that it would take them awhile to do it. Tomoyo was slightly nervous about this as she remembered being called Tomozilla by the boys and such, but her mother still assured her at that moment that she is still a great girl, and thanks to that pep talk she got that day, she decided to use her size and power to stomp and destroy those buildings with ease. The people went wild and came to like her for what she did. Tomoyo smiled as she overcame her fear of being mocked by those boys and not being useful to the community, though she still wanted a normal life as possible. It was also that day that she meet a girl named Sakura, who was awed by what she did, and she just transferred to her school after moving from somewhere else, but heard stories of her. She told her. "Don't listen to what those boys say to you. Sure you look like a monster, and feel like one. But to me, you are not a monster, and even if I did call you one, you are a friendly monster to me." And Tomoyo was moved by her speech. Sure she might have the height and power of a monster, but she isn't a monster, and if she is one, then she is a friendly one.

Over the years Tomoyo got bigger, and today she stands at the massive 400ft feet tall she is. The boys still call her Tomozilla, but at least she got used to the name, and doesn't mind it now as they and the girls are now both trustworthy of her. She was also surprised of the love that the people showed her, how they adjust the cities streets to adjust to the gigantic girl, or how they make clothes her size, or how they made a miniature city for her on her own island if she even wanted to destroy something for fun. She also shown a lot of love to them by being helpful, and even doing them a few Kaiju movies. Just as she thinks back on all those memories...
1433121221.title: A Kaiju-Sized Life for Tomoyo

1433121222.title: 4 Miles High!

14331212221.content:
Tomoyo rose from her bed, ready to greet a new day. She thought it was very thoughtful of her mother to have this annex built for her, especially since it was extremely spacious even for her. Considering that she had grown to a height of four miles even a room like that of a tent would be lucky so she was in no doubt that she had to be the luckiest, as well as the largest, girl in the world.

She remembered so much of her growth. It started when she was only three years old and it had been a month since her third birthday, she began to grow at a rate of half a foot every day, leading to her being as tall as her mother after just one week. Throughout the rest of her time as a three-year old the government, her mother and several others all argued about the cause of and the adaptations required for her condition of extreme growth. Once she was four she had already exceeded 100 feet in height, and yet she seemed to carry the disposition she had now since she was only 35 feet high.

When she was a first year at Tomoeda Elementary she was already bigger than the famous monster 'Godzilla'; she remembered how the boys had always called her 'Tomozilla' and how the girls hardly went outside when she attended, although there were a few who would brave the vulnerability but it took her a while to be able to have fun with any of them. Once she moved up to second year everything was settling down except her size. While she was the talk of Japan the people respected her privacy and her feelings; that was when her mother and several sympathetic investors comissioned her new room, built to acomodate a fifty-mile tall person! Back then she was only just scraping a mile and couldn't comprehend growing that big. It was also when the nickname 'Tomozilla' ended as the boys were always too stunned to make fun and the girls were ever so trusting of her, especially since 'the incident'.

That was when one first year had gotten up onto the school roof and had bent too far over the mesh fence, Tomoyo was the only one who saw her as she was so quiet that no one else figured that she got up there; everyone was sure that if Tomoyo's hand hadn't broken the young girl's fall then she would be dead. It was this particular act of kindness that convinced all her fellow students that she meant well. Another thing that people noticed as she grew was that all her senses and her voice and grip control became more and more acute, allowing her to handle anyone at all without the risk of breaking their bones.

Tomoyo also remembered when she first met Sakura. It was in the second trimester of her second year, just after she had grown past one and three-quarter miles when, during one break, Sakura came up to the roof to greet her. Tomoyo had never known any student coming on to the roof alone just to say hello to her; their friendship was sealed when Sakura actually asked Tomoyo to pick her up. The trust she placed in Tomoyo was so reassuring. At the start of the third year, when she was close to two and a half miles high, Sakura presented her with an industrial-size rubber, even though it looked so small in her hands; ever since it became her most treasured possession and she began to develop very strong feelings for this tiny girl.

As Tomoyo got on the five-mile mark stool (she had these stools in her annex as precursors to her expected height of fifty miles) and brushed her hair she thought back over her time as a third year, thinking over how her rate of growth changed from time to time, how the populace willingly and enthusiastically accepted periodical rebuilds of Tomoeda so the streets could accomodate her feet, the constant influx of clothing made to help her manage in her extreme size. She was in no doubt that she was so lucky to have all this plus good friends, a loving mother, and so much more when she made famous Japanese kaijuu look like puny insects. Just then...
14331212221.title: Start at the Beginning

choices: Sonomi shows up as Tomoyo's Having Breakfast
143312122212.content:
Tomoyo's super-acute hearing picked up a familiar voice calling her in a very honourable manner. Turning round from the dressing table she espied a maid on the balcony that was equal to her eye-level. It was very important for normal-sized people that a set of balconies starting at one mile and going up every quarter of a mile was installed in one part of one wall in Tomoyo's bedsit; a set of lifts made accessing Tomoyo's eye-level swift and easy so no one would find themselves struggling up thousands of flights of stairs. Getting down from her stool Tomoyo carefully thundered her way over to where the maid was waiting.

"What would you like for breakfast, my giant lady?" The maid asked; Tomoyo had no qualms about people using adjectives that emphasised her height and sometimes teased those who were closest to her at a relatively mild level.

"Well," Tomoyo mused in one of her quietest voices, "I've never tried domestic staff before." In spite of the twinge of primal fear the maid in question did not flinch at the suggestion; as she expected Tomoyo let out a giggle that was comparable to a rumble of thunder crossed with choir singers and extended one of her fingers to the balcony to pet the little maid on her back. "But seriously," She continued as she withdrew the mighty digit, "I'll settle for some porridge."

"And to drink?" The maid continued.

"I'd like a glass of orange juice," Tomoyo answered. "If there are enough oranges in the world." Both of them couldn't help but giggle at this. The fact of the matter was the bigger she grew the less food and drink she needed; even then it was incredible that there was always enough food for the mountainous schoolgirl without nearly everyone else in the world descending into famine. Not only was she a worldwide celebrity but also a miracle. To put things into perspective Tomoyo's breakfast would compose of enough porridge to fill five olympic-sized swimming pools and enough orange juice to flood Kyoto.

Because so much could not be singularly transported there was a kitchen dedicated entirely to Tomoyo under the floor of her bedsit with freight lifts adapted from shipbuilding cranes to get the tremendous crockery, cutlery and glassware up to Tomoyo's dining table.

On a remote island not too far from Japan and under Japanese jurisdiction there was only one town that had its own seaport and airport, vast tracks of farmland that produced unnaturally large amounts of produce and, disguised as mountains to those offshore, an impossibly huge mansion. Though the island was off tectonic plate boundaries earthquakes were all too common but never serious, in fact the locals take the quakes quite humorously. This is for a very simple reason, the mansion is home to the source of the earthquakes.

Tomoyo Daidouji was no ordinary schoolgirl; she had far exceeded all possible heights for living things. Her pinkies alone were a mile long each; her immense size could be very scary for those unfamiliar with her, which is why she lives on this island so a community could build up around her. There were no explanations for the vast crop yields from the islands farmland but it was fortunate that there were for Tomoyo consumed all the produce that the farms released and everyone else lived on imports; the mansion and farmland were property of Tomoyo's mother who maintained Tomoyo's ability to live as close to how a normal-sized person could.

It was unbelievable how much Tomoyo grew in just ten years. She always had a rapid growth rate as a baby but, when she was 50 feet tall on her 3rd birthday then eyebrows were raised. Governments and private companies around the world supported Sonomi in her efforts to adapt to Tomoyo's extraordinary growth. By school age she was already a mile high and it was quickly decided what had to be done, resulting in the island colony.

As Tomoyo grew strange things began to happen that would help her interact with the rest of humanity; her senses sharpened, her voice could range in volume so much that it sometimes felt like she hadn't exceeded eight feet.
143312122221.title: Tomoyo's Island

1433121222211.content:
Tomoyo Daidouji had always amazed everyone with her immense size and growth rate, at the start of the third year at school she had shot up to 18 miles tall; many thought it was physically impossible. Because of this Tomoyo had been attending regular medical examinations to determine how her body held itself together as well as any average girl; the results always showed the same thing, all of her body tissues had grown proportionally with her while her cells did not grow. It still didn't explain why she was so massive and could still physically operate like a normal-size girl.

Those who agreed to form the island community were either very open-minded or had dealings with the Daidouji family before, anyone else who decided to join the community would have to get used to the 34 mile high schoolgirl. The school Tomoyo attended was an annex to the mansion as it had to accomodate her tremendous form as well as all the other students; in fact the entire educational system on the island was integrated into the mansion complex so each year would be ready for the titanic student.

A major income for the island was tourism. You can't keep a schoolgirl bigger than Mt. Everest under wraps so she became something of a celebrity; as such Sonomi had set up a guided tour that would give tourists the sights they wanted to see and, because they're guided tours, could orientate them to work with Tomoyo's own schedule.

At school everyone was friends with Tomoyo as she was such a caring girl especially considering the extreme difference in size she exhibited but there were some who were closer than others; Tomoyo herself had no friend closer than Sakura Kinomoto. Their relationship was unique in that Sakura had successfully obtained a giant rubber when Tomoyo forgot her own; how she did it is unimportant. The fact of the matter is that, ever since, Tomoyo always thought of Sakura as her precious little gem and always ready to assist her more than anyone else where being bigger than Malta would come in useful.
1433121222211.title: The Story of Giga-Tomoyo

14331212222111.content:
Tomoyo awoke to a new day; she stretched her 12 mile long arms up in the air, her living quarters having been built to accomodate someone 100 miles tall, and gave a mighty yawn safe in the knowledge that no one would fly a plane in her bedroom while she slept, that way she could yawn without fear of swallowing anybody. Rising from her bed, which would be big enough for her as long as she didn't exceed 60 miles in height, she went across to where her bathroom was. Everything was scaled as close to her as the engineers could manage, with taps that gushed forth so much water Niagra Falls would be put to shame and a bath that could rival Lake Michigan.

When changing out of her night attire she knew it would be impossible for any motorised transport to lift, so she set it on the special conveyor system that was her personal laundry system, complete with a procedure that got it back in the appropriate item of furniture (e.g. wardrobe) for her to use it again. Anything she used that had a chance of getting dirty had this kind of treatment except for the bed where several extra-large cranes had to be used to change the sheets, otherwise Tomoyo would deal with it herself.

Once she was dressed Tomoyo exited her bedroom and went along a comparatively short corridor to her dining room, where major engineering works had to be installed to move the giant crockery, glassware and cutlery along with the vast quantities of food and drink to keep the titaness well looked after. As always as she sat down on her specially designed chair a maid appeared at a doorway that led onto the table from the wall it was adjacent to.

"I FANCY SOME SCRAMBLED EGGS AND TOAST TODAY." Tomoyo informed her, whereupon the maid bowed and returned to the kitchen.
14331212222111.title: The Start of a New Day

143312122221112.content:
The maid in question shook herself upon entering the kitchen, which looked more like an assembly line for nuclear-powered submarines.

"No matter how many times I do it," She commented, "I can't get over how enormous she is." The head chef smiled at this comment and walked up to her for the breakfast order. "She asked for scrambled eggs on toast." She informed him; he nodded as he immediately went about calculating the required quantities.

Before long a whole army of cooks were cracking eggs into a mixing bowl the size of a city while others looked on; when it came to the scrambling electric whisks the size of office blocks would be lowered into the bowl by hydraulics. The bread from which the toast would be made was homemade, whenever one loaf ran out another would be baked for these two were Tomoyo-sized; a single slice could obliterate Derby. The toasting process required a furnace large enough to engulf New York. The cooking of the scrambled eggs needed instense blowtorches against the mixer, which was appropriately thermostatic.

Once the vittles were ready they needed to be transfered to a plate the size of Greater London and, furthermore, while this was going on another maid had gone up to see what the titaness wanted to drink, which happened to be tea. Preparing a drink for someone so huge was another industrial task. First an entire factory's worth of tea had to be dumped into a vat as big as Osaka followed by water that was kept around boiling temperature in an urn the size of Mt. Fuji and this had to be left to mash for five minutes at least, with regular samples taken to test if it was strong enough, before a sluice that could be used as a radio dish would be opened sending the resulting liquid down an aqueduct as wide as the Missisippi and through wire meshes that could supply enough material to rewire the entire national grid in Belgium into a teacup the size of a standard reservoir.

Once the colossal meal was properly presented large hydraulically-powered lifts would get the material up to the correct level where they would be carefully transferred to massive railtracks of the kind used in rocket launch sites that would suspend the crockery as a set of motors would operate the chain drive that would pull the material out onto the table where Tomoyo would simply lift each item of the transport and set it down on the mats, cutlery would be presented just behind the meal.

Once she was finished the dirties would be lowered down to the industrial dishwasher under the floor of her dining area, this is where the mats come in so as to save time transferring them onto anything special because the mats are really platforms on top off hydraulic rams..

Tohru Honda looked upon the dawn of another school day as she left her tent clad in her school uniform. She always saw the positive side to things and took such joy in a bright sunny day. She peeped back into the tent to say goodbye to the picture of her mother before setting off.

It's just as well that Tohru saw the bright side of life. She was a giantess! She stood around one-hundred feet high and wore size 80 shoes (468.75 in Japanese shoe size). Here's a brief history of her kind on Earth:

For hundreds of years giants and humans lived together on Earth with an edgy relationship. Oftentimes one experienced discrimination from the other with severe consequences. However, after the Second World War, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights allowed the two races to live together comfortably. Unfortunately the War had left the world empty of male giants, so giantesses had to marry and breed with ordinary men. Curiously enough, no matter what, a giantess would always give birth to humans and only occasionally gave birth to a giantess.

Tohru's mother was a giantess and was, in fact, the last giant in her family. This made Tohru the last giant on her mother's side.

1441121.content:
Kyoko, Tohru's mother, was a rather conservative giantess; she was as conservative as a giantess could get in the second half of the twentieth century. She was the sort who saw it as right to crush criminals beneath her high heels and, when she was pregnant, she would actually eat criminals. This gave her a legendary status: To some she was a towering heroine, bringing the criminal underworld to its knees; to others she was a force to be feared as she strode through city streets.

When Kyoko was mothering Tohru her criminal hunting slacked off but she still saw it as a giantess's duty to hunt crime and tried to raise Tohru in this manner. When her husband passed away she felt such remorse that she gave up hunting and, instead, saw employment in construction. She enjoyed her work with the police as a government executioner but it was a limited wage; as a giant contractor she got a better income but was a tiny bit frustrated by the delicate procedure of her work.

As giants, both Kyoko and Tohru earned a goverment grant to ensure that they could have as human a life as possible.

As Tohru grew up she showed an extremely gentle nature for her size. She was the polar opposite of her mother. While Kyoko was an experienced executioner and had difficulty with the delicateness of her construction work Tohru could hold a mosue between her finger and thumb without harming it in any way and she saw no merit in killing people regardless as to whether or not they had it coming.

In their area of Japan Kyoko and Tohru were the only giants left; they were, effectively, an endangered species. This being so Tohru could look forward to major bonuses on her living grant if she married and had giant children. The general feeling amongst the people was that if you were a giant's friend then you were special/honoured.

1442122222222222222111.content:
12 year-old Mitsuki Kouyama, at first glance, looks like your typical girl. She’s a big fan of singing, but lives in a strict household with her grandmother, who despises music and doesn’t allow her granddaughter to do so much as hum around her presence. Despite this, she went off on her own from her house to audition as an idol singer. Why the sudden interest? Because only a few months ago she was told by two shinigami (death gods), Takuto and Meroko, that she was to die within a year. Not wanting her life to go to waste, Mitsuki selfishly asked Takuto to allow her to sing. He reluctantly agreed, much to the dismay of his partner. And with a special pill Mitsuki transforms from a 12 year-old to a healthy, blonde-haired 16 year-old girl who goes by the stage name of Full Moon. And since then she has continued to sing, despite pressure from both the press and her colleagues alike.

---

It had now been six months almost to a tee since Mitsuki had met Takuto and Meroko. She wanted to do something to thank them for allowing her to perform and sing, considering her finite time of life left in her. Unfortunately she couldn’t ask them for help; that would feel her feel awkward.

“What do you buy for people who are already dead? Maybe a simple ‘thank you’ might just suffice”, Mitsuki said to herself in her bedroom on a nice Sunday morning. As she continued to think to herself, she saw something lying on the ground. It looked very similar to the pill that Mitsuki ate to transform into her teenage counterpart, but this was blue instead of the usual golden color. Further examination showed that it had the look and even the smell of that of a jellybean, not the usual kind of pill that she was used to eating.

“It’s probably just a jellybean. Oh well”, Mitsuki continued to say for herself as she ate it in one gulp…until she realized she just ate something off the ground.

“Why did I just do that…? It feels like I was drawn to eat it or something”, the perplexed girl told herself as she decided to get ready for her work as an idol singer. Takuto and Meroko, who were still sleeping in their disguised forms around her bed (a cat and rabbit, respectively), woke up to the sound of Mitsuki moving around drawers.

“You sure are loud this early in the morning”, Meroko whined, turning back into her regular human form. In this form the girl had long, pink hair, with a clothing attire consisted of a small red bra with a zipper that covered her breasts, a short red skirt, a red hat (with bunny ears to the sides of it), white pantyhose, and dark red boots. And lastly, she had wings protruding from her back.

“What’s going on, Mitsuki?”

“Ah, Meroko! Sorry for waking you up”, Mitsuki apologized as she continued to get ready for her day. “It’s just that I’m trying to get ready for work and all, but…”

“And you’re having a hard time deciding what to wear?” the still tired shinigami replied, yawning and stretching her arms as she hovered across the room.

“Y-yeah. Could please wake up Takuto for me?”

“Don’t have to. I’m already up”, the groggy cat replied as he prepared to stand up. “Just choose something.”

“It’s not as simple as that. I can’t just wear whatever I please..”, Mitsuki explained to Takuto as she went through various dresses of hers, finally deciding on one at long last. It was a standard medium-length pink dress, with small ribbons on the back of the dress. IT wasn’t much, but considering Mitsuki’s newest gig was an appearance on a children’s morning show she didn’t need to dress fancy.

“Hard to believe it’s been six months already, isn’t it?” Meroko cheerfully asked both Mitsuki and Takuto as she hovered in peace a foot above Mitsuki. “So much has happened since then…”

“Yep. And each day brings new surprises in store”, Mitsuki chirped as she put on her pink dress. Meroko covered up Takuto’s eyes until she finished changing.

When Mitsuki was done changing, Takuto then reverted to his human form, much like Meroko. In this form he had short, brown hair, with a tiny ponytail behind it. He had short brown hair topped by a hat with cat ears, and he wore a white, unbuttoned shirt (with a black undershirt underneath it) with short, blue sleeves, blue jeans pants, black shoes, and a little backpack with small wings protruding out of them.

“Are you sure you’re ready, Mitsuki?” the annoyed shinigami asked of her.

“Yes I am, Takuto. Let’s go!” Mitsuki hesitantly told him as she proceeded to sneak out quietly from her room, watching as Meroko transformed herself into Mitsuki as she did so! Takuto quietly followed the 12 year-old as they proceeded to leave.

“Be careful you two”, warned Meroko. For some reason I feel that something really strange is going to happen today..

---

Mitsuki and Takuto soon arrived outside the T.V. studio she was to perform in today. The two quickly proceeded inside and headed to the nearest girls’ restroom, with Mitsuki hiding in one of the near-by stalls. Thankfully no one else was in there, so she decided to use a locked stroll to transform into her teenage form.

“Okay, Mitsuki. Here we go”, Takuto proceeded to tell her as he snapped his fingers. The then 12 year-old girl proceeded to transform into a 16 year-old singer before his eyes! Usually Mitsuki gained a few inches when she transformed, but today something was…off.

“You seem taller than usual, Mitsuki”, Takuto informed the girl, standing back to back with her. She was amazed to find out that she was only an inch or so shorter than him now.

“Ah! This is weird!” Mitsuki panicked, growing another couple of inches, now at a height of 5 feet and 10 inches or so. Her dress thankfully kept up with her growth.

“It seems that the more you freak out, the more you grow. Just stay calm and you should be okay..”, Takuto analyzed.

“You’re right”, a still worried Mitsuki replied, growing another 2 inches in the process. She was now exactly 6 feet tall.
