145331122121222.title: Meilin?

1453311221212221.content:
Meilin Li lived alone with her mother on a small farmstead in China. Although they were descended from a noble bloodline they had fallen on hard times. Because of the death of Meilin's father and her inability to use magic they could not touch the family wealth. Instead they had to get by with their self-sufficient farming. Their food was predominently vegetables grown in large allotments on the farmland but they also lay traps for wild animals, kept chickens for eggs, bees for honey and had one dairy cow to provide them with dairy. Surplus was always sold off to provide them with the money for clothing and tools, with any left over being saved to provide for any emergency or any breaks.

One day Meilin's mother went to milk the cow while Meilin gathered eggs. As Meilin set the eggs on the kitchen table a scream came from outside. Rushing with a feeling of dread Meilin found her mother kneeling next to the cow, sobbing. Looking around Meilin could find no source of danger and then her eyes fell upon the bucket. It was empty.

"What happened, mother?" She asked.

"She's dry." Came the answer. "Wu's run dry." Meilin understood now. Their cow had reached a form of menopause and would no longer yield milk. "There's only one thing left to do. She'll have to be sold. A good price and we can buy our dairy in the future." Meilin looked at Wu the cow. She had grown up with this cow and she knew that milkless cows were usually butchered.

"Mother." She asked. "Can I take her into town tomorrow?"

"Very well." She answered. "You can take her first thing. Remember she must fetch a good price."

"Um," Meilin wondered, "What if no one makes a good offer?"

"You'll have to opt for the best that's there." She declared. "But come now, we have other work to do."
1453311221212221.title: Meilin's Impoverished

14533112212122211.content:
The next morning Meilin's mother presented her with the end of a rope, the other end of which was wrapped around Wu, and sent them on their way. Meilin took the long stroll towards town. She passed several other farms. Some were prosperous and made her feel jealous of their success, others were on par with her and then there were some who were running into destitution who she pitied. On the way she spotted a person leaning against a fence post with the town visible across the fields behind them.

Who was this strange figure?
14533112212122211.title: Who's the Trader?

145331122121222111.content:
"Excuse me, miss." The man said. "Is that cow for sale?" Meilin hesitated; she'd heard about shady characters looking out for a quick wong and didn't want to be swindled.

"Err, yes." She replied.

"How much are you looking for?" He asked. Meilin wondered; her mother didn't mention an exact price.

"Well," She mused, "Make me an offer." He whipped a bag out from under his coat.

"This." He responded.

"Well, Mr..." Meilin considered.

"Just call me Eriol." He requested.

"Eriol-san," Meilin corrected, "That depends on what's inside." What does Eriol say?
145331122121222111.title: Meilin's First Offer

1453311221212221112.content:
"The answer to your dreams." Eriol responded.

"I wasn't born yesterday." Meilin confronted. "I'll need proof before I make a transaction."

"Very well then." Said Eriol and he opened the bag for a moment and closed it again. A swirl of colours appeared out of the bag and dissipated. Meilin stared.

"The contents are magic." Eriol assured her. "How they work depends on what you do with them. Eat them and you'll gain powerful magic, store them away and the magic will slowly improve your fortune but plant them and you're in for a grand adventure." Meilin looked at him dubiously as she decided whether a bag of edible contents that are supposedly magic was worth swapping Wu for.

What does she decide?
1453311221212221112.title: Meilin Must Make a Decision

choices: The Beanstalk will grow by the house.
The Beanstalk will take the house with it.
14533112212122211122.content:
"Well," Meilin considered, "You're making a curious offer but I think I must hear other people's offers before I commit myself."

"Certainly." Eriol accepted with a knowing glint in his shaded eye. "I'll be waiting for you." With that Meilin set off for town.

At the market she did her best pitch for Wu. Several customers came and looked her over but many dismissed her as useless or too old. Others made their offers but Meilin knew how much would be necessary at the least and not one offered anything gold. Before long the time came for her to set off, still no wealthier than when she arrived. As she returned she met Eriol again.

"Have you made a decision?" Eriol asked. Thinking it over anything that could be planted would be worth more than the offers made in the market, magic or not.

"Very well." She decided. "You can have Wu for those." With that they made the swap and Meilin set off home, wondering what her mother would say.

When Eriol was out of sight she peeped in the bag. There were seven beans, each one a different colour.

"Ohhhhh!" Meilin croaked. "That's torn it!" She made her way home, trying to prepare herself for what her mother would say.

Once she got back she explained what had happened, trying not to appear uneasy, and handed her the bag.

"Meilin!" She declared as she held the beans in her hand. "I can't believe this! You were made offers that wouldn't have got us dairy but could've been useful. You're reasoning was close but there's one thing you missed. You can't plant jellybeans!" She threw them out into the yard as she shouted this. "I hope you're not too fond of milk and its products because we'll be living without it forever." Meilin slumped in guilt, wondering what that Eriol fellow was now doing to Wu. Then she remembered what he said about planting the beans.

"What sort of adventure did he mean?" She pondered as she went to tidy the allotments before sunset.
14533112212122211122.title: The Deal is Made

145331122121222111221.content:
The next morning Meilin awoke feeling very sorry for herself. She wanted to find a way to make it up to her mother. She wondered if she could get a job as a farm labourer or a servant. She washed her face and other things before starting the morning chores. She was bewildered by the new shady areas outside and the greenish light entering the kitchen. She was just going out to get some water from a well when she saw it. A beanstalk composed of seven mighty shoots coming out of the ground and uniting into one massive column rising so high into the air that the top disappeared into the distance.

"They were magic!" She exclaimed as she stared. She wondered about the adventure but had something else on her mind. "How big are the beans it'll produce? We could make a fortune out of beans." Forgetting the water she dashed back inside and got out the emergency notepaper, the only writing paper they had. It was starting to go yellow but could still be used. She scribbled out a note in ink made from beetles using a homemade wooden pen. 'Beanstalk in yard. Gone climbing for surplus of beans. Back before sunset (I hope).' With that she slung a foraging bag over her shoulder and made for the beanstalk. She grabbed onto a nook in the stalk and began to climb.

It was much easier than she expected. There were handholds all over and the leaves were so large and firm that she could take breathers on them. She had already climbed over a hundred feet when her mother found the note. As she climbed higher she heard her mother calling for her to come down. Reaching a leaf she leaned over the side to respond. She nearly got vertigo but focused her effort and answered her mother.

"It's my fault we didn't get the money." She called down. "There could be beanpods galore up here and I'm going to find them." With that she continued as her mother contemplated whether she should persue or not when the clucking of the chickens persuaded her to stay.

Meilin continued to climb higher and higher. It was already halfway through the daylight of the morning when she got high enough that her home looked the size of her thumb, including the land that was in their ownership. She noticed thick cloud up above now, which she hadn't seen on the way up. There were still no beanpods around. She continued to climb.

Eventually she entered the cloud cover in her search. She quickly figured that there were no beans around but she noticed that her surroundings now looked more like underground than in cloud. She now realised that this was the adventure Eriol had talked about. She continued to climb. The land above was...
145331122121222111221.title: Meilin's Up The Beanstalk

1453311221212221112212.content:
Meilin stared at her surroundings as she sat on another leaf of the beanstalk. She could see its top now, rising high above the forest she was now in but she could tell it wasn't a proper forest. Even on this scale she could recognise the blades of grass rising high into the air.

"What is this place?" She gasped. Figuring that she wouldn't get much detail sitting on the beanstalk she made a clear leap onto the soil and began to explore. "This certainly is an adventure." She commented.

As she walked through this bizarre jungle of grass Meilin suddenly found herself at the edge. She stared across a stone plateau composed of flattened stones in geometric alignment, on the other side of which was more giant grass. Meilin knew of only one thing like this, a road. Figuring it was meant for heavy traffic she kept off the stone and made her way along the narrow dirt path between the stone road and the grass jungle. She couldn't understand why there was so little traffic on this road but kept on going.

It was nearly noon when she reached the next striking feature. A metal fence rising high above the grass. Looking it over she could identify hinges up above the path she was on and could see no way past the metal column holding them in place. Further observation told her there was a gate here but could not understand why since every animal, every person and every form of transport she could think of could just carry on right under it. Then she realised that she had missed a trick with all that she had seen before. If there were giant plants up here then surely there'd be giant animals. She scolded herself for not keeping an eye out for anything that could've eaten her. But this 'road' she had found and the fence told her that there were actual giant people as well.

"People mean civilisation." She reasoned. "And civilisation means the possibility of help." Going over this and hearing the sound of hunger in her stomach she decided she'd have to try and observe the residents of wherever she was without being spotted until she could determine whether they would help her or not. She slipped back into the grass jungle and made her way under the fence and into a garden. She had entered the property of...
1453311221212221112212.title: In the Land of Giants

14533112212122211122121.content:
Sakura stared out of the living room window across the garden. Although she lived here alone it wasn't her house. Her aunt Sonomi Daidouji had given it to her as lodgings until she could either pay the price of the house herself or find somewhere else she could live. She wasn't an orphan but she did want to try and get by on her own even if she was still a child. If she felt she couldn't cope she was free to phone the Daidouji residence and ask for help from their domestic staff but forced herself to only do so when necessary. She was desperate not to get lazy.

There was one problem that Sonomi couldn't solve for Sakura. Having spent several months in this house she now felt lonely. She had plenty of friends and her second cousin, Tomoyo Daidouji, would dedicate her life to Sakura given the opportunity but she still needed someone to share her home with.

---

Meilin returned to the footpath, as she now recognised it, and this time walked along the edge of the stone so as to give her feet a stable surface to walk on while being able to leap out of the way if any giants came strolling down the path. She was still wondering as to how it would be to meet a giant in this land but her thoughts were constantly interrupted by her growling stomach. She could now see the cottage up ahead, except that it appeared to be even bigger than her local town. She raced towards it, figuring that a house meant food and it would save her time for when she had to descend the beanstalk as she had promised her mother.

Finally she reached a point where the stone path seemed to circumnavigate the cottage and the vast jungle of a garden was left behind. She craned her neck to look at the cottage. It was a two-storey job with a slated roof and roses around the door, all gigantic like everything else in that land. She quivered as she now understood just how small she was here, about ant-size. She also got her first sight of giant animals. Along some flower beds next to the cottage itself butterflies the size of passenger jets fluttered about as they supped the nectar. Although she knew she was smaller than they were Meilin still found it a rather relaxing sight. Now she had to find an entrance. There were two steps up to the front door and she was reluctant to do more climbing, even though they would surely have imperfections she could use to climb them. The only other way, though, was through some crack in the wall and she could run into some dangerous and hideous animals inside the dark walls of the cottage. What is her decision?
14533112212122211122121.title: Sakura and the Cottage on Loan

145331122121222111221211.content:
Meilin was feeling starved now. She didn't get any breakfast and her only hope of finding lunch in this land was to enter the domicile before her. Not wanting to make too big a risk and worried about the amount of time it would take to find another entrance she dashed towards the front steps, preparing herself for the second climb of the day. Upon getting onto the first step she rested for a bit, trying to avoid too long a rest, before jogging towards the face of the second step. Finally she got to the top and stared up at the massive wooden door. Meilin now walked towards it and, as she approached, noticed the gap under the door. She wasn't sure but hopefully it would be wide enough for her to slip under. Then she got a whiff of something. Pausing she focused on the smell. Food. It was the unmistakable smell of cooking. Her stomach cried for the source and her mouth watered as she attempted to figure what was cooking. She made a final dash at the door.

Reaching it she could now determine that the gap was just over half as high as she was. She could crouch under there and crawling would give her plenty of room to raise her back. She commenced crawling into the colossal cottage.

Upon picking herself up on the other side she found herself in a hallway, which only had a couple of rugs for carpetting. Compared to her own home, though, even at her scale this would be luxury. The smell of food was all over and was sending Meilin's senses into overdrive. She had to find that food and then attempt to obtain some. Walking along the wooden floor she did what she could to follow her nose. She had just got to the doorway leading into the titanic dining room when she suddenly felt a series of earth tremors, which subsided as quickly as they started. Finding her bearings Meilin now heard a powerful voice bearing the tone and demeanour of someone about her age.

"LUNCH. ALWAYS JUST ME FOR LUNCH WHEN AT HOME." The power in the voice intimidated Meilin as she had a vague idea as to how big the individual who said that was but, at the same time, she felt pity from the sadness in that voice.

"Well," She declared, "It will be lunch for two today!" But then she wondered if she should be forward enough to just go straight for the food and introduce herself. If the giant was caring and observant she would definitely have an opportunity to end all of her desperation and her mother's but if not she could very well wind up dead.
145331122121222111221211.title: Searching for a Meal

1453311221212221112212112.content:
With her stomach feeling so empty Meilin just had to go with the quickest option and ran as fast as she could maintain across the massive dining room towards the source of the sound and smell. As she ran her mind wandered to her surroundings as it attempted to procrastinate the hunger. She could improve her mental picture of the giant. The six chairs at the dining room table could each cover one of the farms back home. The table had enough room for two country villages on either end. Along the walls she could see picture frames containing photos of giants, each photo being about one hundred and fifty feet tall. All things told her that this was a civilised abode but also emphasised just how tiny she'd be in the eyes of a giant such as this land was to scale with.

Eventually Meilin reached the near end of another doorway leading off the side into a kitchen. The smell of food was overwhelming now and what were once tremors could now knock her off her feet. She knew the giant must be in there and, thusly, crept up against the skirting board and braced herself for the sight of what and who were in the giant kitchen. Finally she peered round the side of the doorway. She stared agog. There was a girl who couldn't have been much older than herself towering high into the air. Meilin estimated her to be eight hundred feet high! And yet she had to use a step to reach the hob of the cooker. That meant that an adult must've been something like two thousand feet tall. The smell was unmistakably...
1453311221212221112212112.title: Seeing the Titaness

14533112212122211122121122.content: The smell was characteristic of...
14533112212122211122121122.title: Nabemono?

choices: Meilin tries to catch Sakura's attention now
145331122121222111221211221.content:
Is was nabemono. Meilin thought really hard about this. The first thing was to get up on the kitchen side, which was about five hundred feet or more above her level. Then she would have to determine whether to try and catch the giant girl's attention or to try and sneak some food without her notice. Considering the size difference Meilin figured that, in the case of the latter, it would be more likely that she would have to dodge giant chopsticks even if she was in plain view, on account that she would most likely go unnoticed by the giantess unless she was already aware of her. With this in mind Meilin dashed across the floor to the side, where she'd have to climb the far end to avoid any complications with a cupboard door. Her eyes spent most of the time on the giant girl, making sure that she wouldn't be taking the food away while she was attempting to reach it on the huge hob and to ensure that she wouldn't end up beneath a descending slipper.

"What luxury she has." Meilin mused, figuring that her thin sandals were not much defence against even normal splinters. Finally she reached the side and begin to climb. As she climbed the air was filled with a powerful vocal sound. Meilin knew the giantess was making that sound and was thankful it wasn't too loud or she'd fall. Approaching the top she noticed there were no words being made and understood it was humming. It had a characteristic quirkiness typical of humming while doing housework but also carried a hint of sorrow. Pulling herself up and onto the worktop near a massive mixing bowl Meilin mused again. "She is lonely. She wants someone to talk to." With that Meilin decided she would definitely risk revealing herself hoping that she wouldn't be mistaken for an insect or thought of as just another thing that's edible. Meilin couldn't get herself to run. The sheer size of this girl filled her with awe as she wondered how helpless everyone she knew would be to her, and this was just a child.

Meilin strolled past a salad dish and some cutlery before coming within arm's reach of the giantess. She looked up at her face, wondering what would be the best comparison for it but coming up with nothing.
145331122121222111221211221.title: Must Make Contact

1453311221212221112212112212.content:
The smell of nabemono registered all across her body. Her stomach was crying out for her to reach the food while her brain said to wait for the opportune moment and her heart said to greet the mighty titaness. Meilin strolled closer to the arm that was using a wooden fork to stir the giant noodles. As she got closer Meilin felt more and more uneasy as she realised just how small and pathetic she was compared to the mountainous young girl looming before her. She fought off these feelings as she told herself that she had come this far and she had to get some food, so she took a deep breath as the giantess stopped humming and bellowed as loud as she could.

"GIANT MISS!!!" She took another breath and shouted again. "PLEASE HELP ME!" With that she now jumped up and down, waving her arms up at the colossal girl.

---

Sakura was stumped. She could've sworn she heard a distant voice calling for her. Yet there were things that didn't add up. It appeared to be coming from somewhere in the vicinity of the cooker and seemed to be calling her 'giant'. Bewildered she checked over all that was there; everything seemed as she remembered until she spotted something moving just under her right arm. There was something jumping on the worktop. Her first thought was a flying ant with a broken wing until she noticed the shape was wrong. Breaking off from her cooking she crouched down until her eyes were level with the surface. They bulged out as she recognised what was jumping on the side. It was a tiny ant-size girl! What does Sakura do now?
1453311221212221112212112212.title: Hello, Giant One

14533112212122211122121122121.content:
Wondering how a girl ended up so tiny and how she got on the worktop Sakura figured that she most certainly needed help. With great care Sakura raised her hand over the belittled girl and curled her thumb and forefinger into a vice-like shape. She watched as the girl cringed in the shadow of her hand and felt really sorry for her, all scared and alone in a world where any person or animal could present a hazard. Small and alone, just as she was feeling while making lunch. With great care she pinched her between her fingers and effortlessly lifted her off the worktop.

Meilin stood recovering from her frantic actions as she watched the amazed giantess crouch in front of her but unease soon returned as she saw a massive hand rising over the edge of the surface and engulfing her in its shadow. Realising just how easily she could get killed she curled up, knowing she couldn't outrun someone so huge. Then she felt it. Two massive pillars of flesh bumping into her and holding her between them. As she was whisked into the air by the giantess she found that it was difficult to get enough air in her lungs, meaning she could only manage so much.

As Sakura scrutinised her between her fingers Meilin managed to get her arms up and rest them on each digit. Sakura watched as she squirmed in discomfort. Realising the power of her grip Sakura quickly brought her left hand forth, palm up, and set Meilin down right in the centre. Remembering her lunch Sakura carefully reduced the temperature on the hob ring and continued to stir the noodles with her right hand while holding Meilin very close to her face.

With Meilin recovering from the pinching while being overwhelmed by the awe of Sakura's massive emerald eyes and Sakura attempting to make out Meilin's face on her ant-size body who shall speak next?
14533112212122211122121122121.title: Plucked Like a Goose Feather

145331122121222111221211221212.content:
"Please," Cried Meilin as loud as she could without hurting her throat, "I don't wish to be crushed or swallowed. All I ask is to share some of your food." Sakura could see more about Meilin now. Her clothes were rags and she was terrified of becoming nothing more than a resource.

"It's okay." Sakura whispered, trying not to upset her with the volume of her voice. "I won't hurt you. Lunch is nearly ready; let's share it and then you can tell me all about it." Meilin wondered what the last bit meant but was happy that she was being so charitable to someone smaller than her fingernail.

Sakura realised that she'd need both hands to get the lunch together so she'd have to put Meilin down somewhere, at the same time it needed to be somewhere she wouldn't be forgotten. Finally she set her down on the lip of the salad bowl, giving her about sixty feet clearance between the edge and the salad. "Don't move." She mentioned as she got a plate ready and began to spoon the noodles onto it. Meilin watched in amazement of such a simple domestic act becoming almost god-like on such a scale as this. Sakura now grabbed handfuls of salad from the salad bowl and mixed it in with the items on the plate, always making sure that Meilin would not be accidentally snatched up with them; for Meilin the sight of Sakura's massive hand descending in her direction caused great discomfort for her as she remembered how difficult it would be to spot her on this scale.

Finally Sakura had her lunch ready and carried it into the dining room. She found that the knowledge of sharing her food with someone small enough to accidentally be food to be theraputic to her lonliness, especially as she knew that Meilin would not be able to take her eyes off her. 'She's alone in a giant world,' She thought, 'I must help her return to normal size somehow. I cannot allow myself to think of her as a pet.' With that she returned to the kitchen and crouched in front of Meilin. This time Sakura held her hand out, giving her a fleshy crash mat to jump on. Getting the message Meilin decided to not let the side down just because she was so puny. She took the best running leap she could muster and plummeted back into Sakura's palm. Doing what she could to keep her hand steady Sakura ferried Meilin into the dining room, every step resonating with her tiny guest, and stood by her seat, wondering where to put Meilin.
145331122121222111221211221212.title: Charity from a Giant

1453311221212221112212112212121.content:
Sakura figured that Meilin would be able to help herself if she was on the plate but, at the same time, she was mindful of how terrifying chopsticks would be from such a position. She finally settled on a possibility and, plucking Meilin from the palm of her hand, set her down as close to the right-hand side of the plate as possible without the risk of sliding right into the nabemono.

Meilin nearly fell on her front when Sakura's fingers released her upon the ceramic surface of a giant plate. She looked up at the landscape of food and her nostrils were overwhelmed by the smell, she so wanted to leap in there and eat away to her heart's content, but she forced herself to look up at Sakura and figure how easily she could end up as a part of this meal.

"EAT AS MUCH AS YOU WANT." Sakura declared, her voice being like that of a god. "I'LL START FROM THE LEFT AND HEAD RIGHT, THAT WAY, AS LONG AS YOU DON'T PLUNGE INTO THE FOOD, YOU'LL BE QUITE SAFE." Meilin nodded, still feeling rather sober from the reminder that she could accidentally become an appetiser. "ITATAKEMASU!" Sakura roared as she lifted her chopsticks over the edge of the plate and plunged the tips into the left-hand part of the nabemono, lifting only a few noodles amongst some of the other ingredients. For Meilin this was only a confirmation of her helplessness; she deduced that the same amount would provide enough for a banquet attended by the entire population of the prefecture where she resided. She watched in awe, adrenaline beginning to surge, as Sakura silently opened her mouth and shoved it in, with only enough noodles protruding from her lips to equal enough food for Meilin and her mother to last a week, in two seconds they were slurped into the massive maw. A terrible groan and ache from her own stomach reminded Meilin why she came here. She walked towards the apex of a curled noodle and knelt upon the plate to tuck in.

"Itatakemasu!" She declared, feeling like her own voice was naught but a tiny squeak having heard Sakura's thundering declaration. She bit into the noodle; the soft pasta still quite maleable in her mouth suggesting that the consistency of giant food was the same as normal food, only greater in volume.
1453311221212221112212112212121.title: Lunch with a Giant is a Feast

14533112212122211122121122121212.content:
By the time Meilin had knawed her way through the noodle, breaking it in two, Sakura had already cleared a quarter of the nabemono from the left-hand side. The noodle just stimulated Meilin's stomach and now she saught out to eat as many different parts of the dish as she could. Within arm's reach was a salad leaf; she decided to nibble on that for a while but, while her arm could reach it, her mouth couldn't. Grabbing onto it with both hands she pulled to either bring it closer to her or vice-versa. A shifting from up above made her feel uneasy as she thought that her haste would bury her under one leaf ergo to be part of Sakura's last bite, fortunately her weight wasn't enough to bring it down on top of her and, instead, she found herself jumping to take bites out of it.

Sakura made regular glances at Meilin's tiny form, making sure she didn't get lost in the chaos of the noodles. But upon seeing her doing pull-ups to eat a salad leaf she just couldn't help but giggle, which most certainly did not go unnoticed by Meilin as she suddenly let go of the leaf and tumbled over part of the noodle she had earlier bit through.

"CAREFUL NOW." Sakura teased. "YOU DON'T WANT TO GET INDIGESTION." Meilin looked up at Sakura's looming visage, once again reminded as to how easily she could be killed here. She then noticed something else; her ragged clothes were sodden, she was being soaked by the sauce. Not letting such a major opportunity for good food pass up she began licking her hands clean of the sauce. "WOW!" Sakura boomed. "YOU SURE ARE HUNGRY." Meilin suddenly looked at her in a new way; not out of fear and awe but with a tone of bother. Sakura, too far away to notice this, returned to clearing the left-hand side of the plate, a single mouthful once again hitting home their difference in size. Meilin continued through whatever she could get at along the right-hand edge of the meal.

"SO," Sakura asked sometime later, "HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN LIKE THIS?" There was clearly concern in her mighty voice but how does Meilin interpret the question?
14533112212122211122121122121212.title: Sakura Throws Back the Nabemono Front

14533112212211.title: Choose your Character.

145331122122111.content:
Sakura was just turning in for the night. Things had been tough recently and her family had taken to using the garden as a vegetable patch. She had been tending to the beans for a while and felt low. She knelt at her bedside, looked out at the stars and prayed.

"Noble kami who look over all that is true." She recited. "In the face of such little yield for all my family's hard work I beseech you to help me alleviate our conditions. However it may be as long as everyone is more well-off I shall see if I can be of service to you." With that she went to bed.

The next morning she rose slowly, the low light suggesting an overcast sky. As she began to get herself together she noticed something unbelievable, a massive beanstalk stretched right past her window. Getting a better look she found it rose ever higher, right into the heavens.

"So, we can have super-size beans?" She checked. "And what must I do to repay the debt?" She then remembered the dream she had; a mysterious figure told her. "As the gods judge, you must explore beyond what you know to find fortune. The quest is the repayment to them and the fortune is your reward." With that Sakura went up to the balcony and hauled herself onto the gigantic green growth.
145331122122111.title: Entertain the Gods for Prosperity

choices: Field. (She's in the grounds of a giant Girls' School)
Garden. (She's in the grounds of a mansion)
Park. (She's close to a playground for giant children)
1453311221221111.content:
Sakura climbed steadily, recollecting the times she'd climb trees to retrieve lost items or the PE practices from school to keep her pace and not rush her ascent. She'd been climbing for half-an-hour before she paused and sat upon a giant leaf, looking over herself as she realised she was still in her night attire. She took a glance down to see how far she'd come, which turned out to be five hundred feet above the ground, but she also noticed that the beanstalk took up the whole of the vegetable patch.

Doing her best to console herself Sakura concluded that, in keeping with the kismet as it was presented, she'd continue to climb and see what she'd find. She kept climbing, focused on reaching the very top, until she'd been climbing for nearly two hours. Eventually she was engulfed in thick cloud that seemed to keep getting thicker to the point that it got so dark it was like being underground. After another pause she glanced round and realised that she was underground; all around her was soil with light filtering down through the fronds of the beanstalk. She continued to climb, wondering what this would lead to before finally emerging into bright daylight and the top of the beanstalk proper, where one solitary leaf held steady.

Sakura took the opportunity to rest on this leaf and have a look round at this strange new land she'd discovered. It was a beautiful display of the local flora, but she gawked and yelped slightly upon realising that it was all gigantic. Everything she saw was huge, even the grass must've been taller than a grown man in this...
1453311221221111.title: Up the Beanstalk

choices: The front door of the house opens.
A powerful voice rings out from behind Sakura.
Sakura looks for somewhere to rest.
Sakura continues towards the giant mansion.
14533112212211112.content:
Sakura gazed in awe at the colossal shrubs with enormous flowers, glancing round nervously at the thought of the insects she figured must belong in such a garden as this. Recollecting the dream again she took a deep breath and began to climb down the other side of the beanstalk, however one of her feet settled down on a grass blade causing her to slip and fall down, the grass making the fall more like a slide but the landing was a bit rough. Rubbing her backside in response to the discomfort she stood up and walked through the grass, occasionally having to shove a few blades off as best she could before she came upon a wide open space with periodic breaks.

Recalling the view from the beanstalk Sakura concluded that she'd reached what looked like a path and wondered which way she'd go. Stepping up onto one of the paving slabs she walked around in search of anything when a noise momentarily startled her before realising she was the source of the sound. Since it was two hours at least since she got up and she hadn't had breakfast she was feeling the classic busy-morning hunger. Looking up she caught sight of the corner of the house round one shrub and, thusly, had a ready bearing to use and began to make her way towards the house.

It was another long haul for Sakura as she had to leap across the gaps between the paving stones. She figured it would be after noon by the time she'd reach this house and began to flag from the combination of steady exercise and lack of food before slumping down to get her breath back. Looking up after a couple of minutes she gawked again as she realised that this was a very big house even when compared to the size of the plants in its garden.

Giant plants, She wondered, And a giant house? So, to help my family I must visit a giant? She became most nervous about this, wondering what kind of temperament the resident of this house would have for someone like her.
14533112212211112.title: Major Hike through the Garden

145331122122111124.content:
Wiping the residue of perspiration from her forehead Sakura got to her feet and continued towards the massive house, taking note of the stairs leading to the front door and concluding that she'd have to find another way in through a crack in the wall or something. It must've been close to midday by the time she reached the bottom of those stairs and readily identified that they were much too big to climb up even if she wasn't worn out by the trek to get here. She looked off to the side where a bed of giant roses seemed to frame the most readily available entrance to her, a small crack in the wall.

Sakura had just gone into the crack and thusly found herself somewhere very dark with no idea what could be hidden in this place. Unsteadily she put one hand on the side and walked inwards, starting at every little sound but not the larger sounds that came from outside of this makeshift tunnel. Fortunately she didn't have to walk for long before she caught sight of bright light coming in through another crack, although it was clear she'd have to climb some of the wires and pipes she could just make out in the low light of the cavity wall.

Sakura was practically exhausted when she reached the way through to the house proper, her pyjamas were partially torn, covered in dust and dirt. She felt like she was a sorry sight for anyone to behold and, as such, dreaded how whoever lived in such a massive house would react if they saw her. She rested one hand on the side of the crack and looked out into the gigantic room beyond, which was...
145331122122111124.title: Weary & Hungry

1453311221221111243.content:
Sakura gawked as she gazed at the enormous room laid out before her eyes. She guessed that the crack she was looking through was in a skirting board hidden under a table as the view up above consisted of a wooden brown cast into shadow and bare boards were laid out before her in shade. To her right she saw a mass of dark blue that looked like upholstery, possibly an armchair or such-like, while to her left she saw the same floorboards illuminated, although not quite as much as if it was in direct sunlight, leading to a great big door painted in turquoise. The rest of the view was a panorama of the gigantic room from where she could see a coffee table, a sofa, a chest of drawers, some gigantic trinkets and ornaments, a wardrobe and, off to the side in the distance, a great bed with a teal-coloured bedspread laid across it. The whole thing screamed opulence, order and, what Sakura took note of the most, civility; the giant that would call this place home must surely be a very rational individual.

Sakura was so awed and so taken aback that she hadn't realised that she'd walked out onto the giant floorboards underneath the table. Her feet left little in their wake even accounting for her comparative size as the floor was so clean. Sakura came to a stop right where the shade of the table would give way to the light reflecting off the walls from the windows that she knew must be there, but she still couldn't see.

As Sakura began to get a hold of herself and try to fathom what it would be that her fate dictated should be her next action she felt some very heavy thuds that built steadily, accompanied by the sound of footsteps magnified considerably. Someone was approaching this room, someone gigantic, someone just the right size for this room. Still worried about how a giant would react to finding her Sakura summoned up enough energy to duck behind one of the table legs and peeked out as the mighty quaking footsteps abruptly stopped. The knob on the door turned with a sound like a clatter but more organised and it swung open, buffeting Sakura with a strong gust, and she gazed up at her first sight of a giant. It was...
1453311221221111243.title: King-Size Suite

1453311221221221.content:
Tomoyo awoke from her sleep. It was a pity to leave her comfortable bed but her strong sense of morality compelled her to rise. Sonomi had done well to instill such morality in her, in fact it was said that Tomoyo had even stronger morals than her mother.

Later on, in her day clothes, Tomoyo went downstairs for her breakfast. It was always a family meal because it was the one where her mother would definitely be able to eat with her.

"Good morning, Tomoyo-chan." Sonomi greeted her as she entered the dining room.

"Morning, mum." Tomoyo replied as she took her seat. It was a good breakfast that combined Japanese and western cuisine in the most appropriate way.

When the time comes, what reason shall Tomoyo have to go down the beanstalk?
1453311221221221.title: Morning in the Land of Giantesses

14533112212212212.content: Is Tomoyo creating a model city that is much more than a model?
14533112212212212.title: Collecting Buildings?

145331122122122121.content:
"How's your little city coming along, Tomoyo?" Sonomi asked her.

"It's still a long way from being a real city," Tomoyo answered, "I'm sure that a city must compose of more than fifty buildings."

"Even tall ones?"

"Yes."

"Well," Sonomi inquired, "Why are some of them on the floor and some on a shelf?"

"I keep the more recent ones on the shelf," Tomoyo responded, "So I can plan out where they'll go in the actual city itself."

"You never miss a trick." Sonomi commented with a grin.

Once breakfast was over Sonomi asked another question.

"Will you be going out for more little buildings?"

"Yes," Tomoyo answered, "I'll be going..."
145331122122122121.title: Tomoyo: Building Collector

1453311221221221212.content:
"Say about half past ten?" Tomoyo checked to see if it was all right. Sonomi smiled and said.

"Sure Tomoyo, just don't go out again after five." Tomoyo acknowledged this with every intention of keeping to this time limit. She was sure it wouldn't take that long to gather some buildings from the wonderland underground. It was bizarre that such a large beanstalk sprouted out of a hole that a grown woman could squeeze through. Anyone could shimmy down the beanstalk and climb back up. So far Tomoyo knew of no one else who did, though it was common knowledge in the village.

Once breakfast was over and done with Tomoyo returned to her room to acquire what was needed to gather the model buildings. She had no idea who had made such an amazingly detailed miniature world underground nor how a beanstalk could grow so large so quickly; the greatest marvel was each building appeared to have electricity and plumbing as far as she could tell, looking through such tiny windows. As she did this again she giggled as she thought about real people occupying these little buildings.

At half past ten Tomoyo set off as intended. Equipped with a wicker carrier for the model buildings and a special trowel-type tool for getting the buildings out of the ground, since the first time she needed to wash her hands afterwards.

It took her ten minutes to reach the beanstalk, which had become quite a sight in the village. She wondered why every time she went down or came up it few people ever noticed or made a deal of it. Slinging the carrier over her shoulder and sheathing the 'trowel' she grasped onto the stalk with both hands before jumping off the grass. She commenced to shimmy down. Through dark soil and rock before coming into the strange model world exhibited with a very realistic sky, sun and cloud before the landscape was revealed, spread out below her.

Where is the beanstalk growing?
1453311221221221212.title: Beginning to Descend

14533112212212212122.content:
Tomoyo loved the countryside. With it exhibited in miniature below her it made it all the sweeter. Steadily she descended, not looking down too long in case she developed vertigo. Finally she landed on the ground with a thud. Checking her watch she noted that the time was now five to eleven. It never seemed to take that long.

She randomly strolled in search of a suitable batch of buildings. It amazed her how real everything appeared. Every step she took left a clear footprint and, when she forgot herself, how realistically a fence splintered and flattened beneath her shoe. Just before stepping on a forest she stopped and looked across some rolling hills.

A city! Just what she was looking for, complete with model office blocks and similar multi-storey buildings. She was sure she'd be spoilt for choice and she slowly approached.

Unbeknowest to her and unknowing of her a solitary figure wandered through the streets. It always seemed so desolate lately in this city; this individual was making their way home. What is their gender?
14533112212212212122.title: Tomoyo in Minuteland

14533112212212212122112.title: Naoko?

145331122122122121221121.content:
Opening the door to the block of flats where she lived Naoko suddenly noticed a slight shockwave passing through the ground. She hesitated for a moment.

'I hope we're not going to have an earthquake.' She thought as she finally entered the building. A second stronger shockwave came as she crossed the foyer. 'Oh dear. I'd better take the stairs.' With that she made for the stairwell. As she ascended the shockwaves became stronger and stronger but she didn't register that these shockwaves were rhythmic.

The shockwaves stopped by the time she got to her floor. Realising this she entered her flat and looked around.

'Good.' Her mind declared. 'No damage.'

Outside Tomoyo now loomed high above the city. Residents who did see her panicked and fled, mostly searching for where they could not be seen from above. Because of this Tomoyo still did not realise that this miniature world was not a model but real.

Checking over the available buildings she got her 'trowel' and commenced to unearth some of the buildings. Down below terrified citizens watched as she lifted away two derelict towers, a currently empty department store and the very block of flats that Naoko resided in.

As Tomoyo lifted the building up into the air did Naoko notice that something was amiss?
145331122122122121221121.title: First Catch

1453311221221221212211212.content:
"What the...?!?" Naoko cried out as she felt her world changing orientation. Quickly she grabbed onto one of the legs of her bed as Tomoyo now shifted the block of flats into her open palm.

Tomoyo wasn't all that keen on the derelicts but they were still in usable condition and the department store had some interest to it but the building now in her hand was of particular interest with its high quality structure.

"Wow! What a find!" Tomoyo declared, creating a warm drizzle over the city. "This one's definitely a keeper." Inside Naoko could hear every word Tomoyo said but was in no condition to get to the window. Instead she meekly asked.

"Who said that?" Cringing as the world seemed to change position again as Tomoyo, as carefully as possible, put her home in the carrier.

Is Tomoyo satisfied with her current catch?
1453311221221221212211212.title: A Prime Example

choices: Was coming back to her room
14533112212212212122112121.content:
With four buildings in tow Tomoyo took a look at her watch. She was feeling slightly uneasy as she found that it was half past eleven already. She had been out of the house for an hour. Putting her 'trowel' away she immediately made a b-line for the beanstalk, each footfall resonating with the tiny populace resulting in a more earthquake-like experience.

Inside the carrier Naoko could feel the swinging of Tomoyo's hips. As the outside had gone rather dark she figured that a prolonged earthquake had struck. She had to check every room once it was over and she had allowed for aftershocks.

When Tomoyo began to ascend the beanstalk the experience for Naoko was a major shift followed by reasonable tremors. She didn't want to risk it so she crawled to the nearest door and wedged herself in it, awaiting any aftershocks. Once Tomoyo got up top her jump onto solid ground and brisk walk home came through as an aftershock in Naoko's mind.

Tomoyo made it back by midday. She was fortunate in having fifteen minutes before lunch would be ready so she commenced to get her current catch onto her sorting shelf. The process of doing so was the biggest earthquake Naoko had known but she was thankful that the walls didn't fall and she didn't hear anything break. By the time she was sure there would be no more aftershocks Tomoyo had already finished her lunch and...
14533112212212212122112121.title: Taken Home

145331122122122121221121212.content:
Tomoyo had gone on a second jaunt, hoping to acquire more buildings of a preferred design. It was incredible that Naoko was only the first tiny person she had unwittingly carried away. Sure there were going to be no more shockwaves Naoko checked over the apartment. She put some stuff back but found nothing had to be replaced. It took her quite a while and, once she was finished, Tomoyo had returned. Each footfall once again resonated with Naoko but they didn't seem quite as severe as the first time.

'Oh no,' She thought, 'Not again.' She was bewildered as to why there were so many shockwaves so she returned to her bedroom and looked out. It was a major shock to see the view had become so clear that she wondered how her home was unscathed when the rest of the city was gone. Then she realised that the view appeared to be through a large glass object, which made no sense. Then Tomoyo approached the shelf, ready to put some more finds on it. How does Naoko react?
145331122122122121221121212.title: A Brand New Vista

1453311221221221212211212121.content:
"*gasp* Oh, heavens above!" Naoko announced as she saw Tomoyo's face looming before but, apparently, unaware of her presence. "You are one really big girl, aren't you." This was one heck of an understatement and Naoko quickly realised that, inside her flat, she was too small for this giantess to see. She noticed that Tomoyo was putting office blocks and department stores on the surface that now served as her ground; she understood now. Her home had been whisked away; her assumption as to why was this massive girl was collecting buildings in excess of two stories as a hobby, like someone would collect stamps.

What is Naoko going to do now she's in this state of mind?
1453311221221221212211212121.title: Overwhelming

14533112212212212122112121212.content:
With her mind still in shock from what she had seen Naoko's legs moved on their own accord. Bringing her down the stairs and out into the open, her footwear coming into direct contact with the surface of the massive wooden shelf. Now she was outside Naoko gained control of her own legs again and could see a shadow between the buildings. Feeling a sense of foreboding Naoko edged herself along the outer wall of her block of flats and peered round the side.

Looming higher than any building she'd seen in this place Naoko looked upon Tomoyo's titanic face, her mouth slightly open but enough for Naoko to understand that a three-storey luxury house could be nothing more than a quick bite for her. Naoko pulled back, not wanting to be seen by the giantess and not wanting to dwell on how many large things she knew of could fit inside her mouth.

"AHH, THAT'S ENOUGH FOR TODAY." Tomoyo thundered. "I THINK I'LL HAVE FORTY WINKS NOW." With that she settled down into a chair right underneath the shelf. Naoko breathed out as she watched the shadow retreat.

"She sounds so casual," She commented to no-one in particular, "And yet she could kill me and everyone I know in a second." She quivered in a combination of fright, awe and excitement.

What does Naoko do with the knowledge that Tomoyo's taking a kip?
14533112212212212122112121212.title: Outside but Inside

choices: She Felt a Sense of Urgency
145331122122122121221121212121.content:
Slowly Naoko stepped out from behind the block of flats and looked out across the wooden plateau to where Tomoyo was looming over all buildings there. She could see some more of the giantess's room now, which really put things in perspective. She figured that, to Tomoyo, she wasn't more than an ant and could be extinguished without a care.

"I must escape," She told herself, "Before I become a smear or a snack." She dashed out into the open and searched for something that would give her a safe descent from such a height. Finally she settled on a box of dental floss nearby.

As she struggled with the line from the box, attempting to get it over the edge of the shelf, she wandered back again to just how huge Tomoyo's mouth was. If she could use Tomoyo's floss as a rope then Tomoyo could use steel rope as string. Finally she looked over the side of the shelf and then wished she hadn't.

Tomoyo was right there, dozing away, her mouth slightly agape and her chest rising and falling with her breathing. Naoko looked back at the floss. There was no way she could get down to the floor with it so there was only one option. Lower it to within a few inches of Tomoyo's head and then attempt to climb down her body.

It took a while and Naoko struggled to keep the gigantic floss under control but, finally, she had it as close to Tomoyo's skin as she dared. Making sure that her weight would not change the orientation of the box she then swung her legs over the side, trying not to think about the four-hundred foot or so sheer drop to Tomoyo's forehead, and held onto the floss with one hand as she tried to curl her legs around it. Once that had been accomplised she held on with both hands and shinnied down a few feet at a time.

Her descent was very slow when compared to the distance she had to go. Once she had gone sixty feet she began to feel a strange breeze on her legs and the floss-rope swaying slightly. She didn't want to look down but qucikly deduced it was Tomoyo's breath she was feeling.

"I can't believe this!" She squeaked. "I'm dangling from some floss over a girl the size of a mountain. It's impossible!" She continued to descend.

When she was two-hundred feet below the shelf Tomoyo's breathing made it even harder to descend, slowing her down substantially. Just then...
145331122122122121221121212121.title: Going Floss-Climbing

choices: Tomoyo Plucks Naoko off her Nose
1453311221221221212211212121211.content:
There was a strange creaking noise coming from somewhere up above. Although she was uneased by this Naoko didn't look, thinking it must've been wood straining from heat exchange. Her current priority was judging the distance down to Tomoyo's head, and it was very hard for her to take her eyes off such an enormous girl. When the creaking became continuous she felt compelled to look up, just in time to see severe twisting and fraying in the giant floss. Before she had time to make a contingency plan the rope of floss snapped!

Naoko could not hold herself back. As she plummeted through the air she screamed wildly, expecting the worst. Suddenly she landed on something that cushioned her so that it was like jumping off a high-dive onto a crash mat. With the wind knocked out of her she lay there in a bit of a daze before she commenced to find her bearings. However her screaming and landing had not gone unnoticed.

Tomoyo returned to reality as Naoko's minute scream entered her ears; she didn't have time to wonder as to its origin when she felt something hit her nose. It didn't hurt but she was compelled to open her eyes. She looked down her nose and was astonished to see a little girl no bigger than her fingernail, if that, sitting almost on the tip.

When Naoko realised where she landed she was thankful that the skin was so soft and supple for someone so huge, until she realised that the giantess's eyes were open and trained on her. She swallowed in fear as she thought of all possible outcomes that such a gigantic young lady could produce. Her mind was stunned, and was currently recognising the giantess as human, so all she could do was say.

"Uhh, hi." Tomoyo could just make out the tiny lips of this tiny person, who's age could not have been much different to her own, forming a couple of syllables but her giant eardrums could not be moved by the sound produced. What happens now?
1453311221221221212211212121211.title: Discovered

14533112212212212122112121212112.content:
As Tomoyo stared in surprise and interest at the tiny girl on her nose Naoko's primal instincts were the first to reinstall in her overloaded brain. Screaming in terror, but at a different tone to that she cried as she fell, she leapt off Tomoyo's nose onto her cheek and dashed downhill to her chin. From there she slid down her massive neck and, to Tomoyo's embarrassment and amusement, slid under her shirt.

The sensation of a miniscule person who's weight was negligent running across her skin tickled Tomoyo. At first little happened but, as Naoko made a blind panic run down her, Tomoyo began to twitch from the feeling of such small feet patting upon her body. Naoko was only just crossing her tummy when she could hold it in no longer.

"HA! HA! HA! HA!" She gaffuffled. "OOH, STOP IT." Unable to remain in the chair she leapt up and landed on her knees, trying to resist the urge to press where it tickled.

The swift movement of the giantess was enough to make Naoko change direction in the low light beneath her clothes. She tumbled a fair way until she slipped out through the flap along the buttonline and was flung onto the waistline of the skirt. Tomoyo, still giggling from the tickling, unwittingly sent her flying off her skirt and plummeting towards the ground.

It was a longer fall but the landing was even softer. Naoko struck one of the carpet hairs on the side and slid into the forest-like gloom amongst them; the sliding took away enough of her velocity for it to be very much like an actual slide. Picking herself up and dusting herself off she looked up beyond the hairs to see Tomoyo looming like a mountain; her laughter was still swamping the air.

"OOH! THAT TICKLES! PLEASE! HA, HA! STOP!" Even with her ears covered they still entered clear as day.

"Ah!" Naoko screamed and ran like the wind again. Her rational mind was creeping back but, in her current location, she was sure she would be hard to find.
14533112212212212122112121212112.title: A Wild Dash Down Mt. Tomoyo

choices: Snatch Naoko Before she gets to the City
145331122122122121221121212121122.content:
Naoko continued to run as straight as she could through the forest of carpet hairs. Though she had been running for several minutes Tomoyo still loomed high above her like a living landscape. Having been relieved of her tickling Tomoyo attempted to gently reach for where she last felt the tickling. She felt only her own skin and the fabric of her clothes and, fearing the worst, lifted her pinched thumb and forefinger to her eyes. She was relieved (this time of her dread) to find no sign of a flattened human there but wondered where the tiny girl had got to. There was no way she could've imagined it, the tickling of such tiny feet felt all too real.

"Hey!" She spoke, not bothering to raise her voice. "Where did you go?"

This only served to enourage Naoko to run all the more, sprinting through the colossal carpet searching for waymarks. She was sure she had to hurry as Tomoyo was checking every square foot (Naoko's perspective) of herself and the carpet.

Just then Naoko sees a skyline of buildings above the carpet. Their scale was just right for her. Stopping for a moment she mused.

"A city? There must be somewhere I can hide there." She wheezed, not used to such intense running. She made for it just as Tomoyo spotted a tiny object moving through the carpet with a clear direction in mind.

'My model city?' She wondered as she watched Naoko dash for the limits. Tomoyo has a decision to make. What is it?
145331122122122121221121212121122.title: A Metropolitan Sprint

1453311221221221212211212121211221.content:
"Little girl." Tomoyo whispered, "Please don't run." Tomoyo knew her voice would be quite powerful for someone so small, which is why she whispered. She watched as Naoko entered the city. "I promise I won't hurt you." Her voice was quite sweet even for someone who could hide in her voice box. This, coupled with the apparent security of the city, made Naoko slow down as it drained her adrenaline.

Naoko jogged round a corner before stopping to catch her breath. It was a large alleyway from her perspective. She listened to Tomoyo's pleas as she caught her breath.

Tomoyo didn't bother keeping her eyes on the city; she figured that even the best runner at such a small size would rest under cover before trying again. She looked back to the chair to find clues as to how this tiny girl ended up on her nose. She saw the box of floss, the broken end and the loose piece lying next to the arm and quickly deduced what happened. The wonderland she had found was not a model but a real tiny world with plants, animals and people. She had carried off an occupied building. 'No wonder the poor thing's so scared.' She figured. There seemed to be only one option now; try to look after her.

"Please come out," She asked as she turned back to the city, "I only want to take care of you."

Down below Naoko's panic had retreated and was replaced with a sense of despair; she had tears in her eyes.

"REALLY," Tomoyo's reasoning echoed off the concrete, "THERE'S NO REASON FOR YOU TO HIDE."

"Why me?" Naoko whinged. "Why should I be a giant's prisoner?" As she let it out the despair slowly transformed into acceptance. She slowly steps out into the street and...
1453311221221221212211212121211221.title: Bargaining Giant, Frightened Tiny

14533112212212212122112121212112211.content: As she let it out the despair slowly transformed into acceptance. She slowly steps out into the street and... Walks towards Tomoyo slowly
14533112212212212122112121212112211.title: Walks towards Tomoyo

14533112212212212122112121212112212.content:
Tomoyo watched as Naoko steadily made her way along the street, which was only wide enough for three of her fingers, and stepped into a nearby high rise. She could tell she wasn't trying to shy away due to the slow pace she was travelling at. Understanding what Naoko's actions must be for after a few moments of thinking she lay upon her stomach and carefully brought her face closer to the building in question.

Naoko made her way up the stairwell within this building, which was meant for offices where it came from, thinking about whether or not to go all the way to the roof or to only go as far as one of the upper floors. When she reached the third floor she broke off from the stairwell and looked through an office to the outer window. She could see Tomoyo's chin at this level, clearly indicating the need to go higher.

"Incredible." She breathed as the whole scale sank in. "She's so vast!" She continued her ascent, figuring that she'd have to get to the tenth floor at least. Eventually she found the tenth floor and, being leg-sore and weary, decided to try and interact with the giantess at this point. She entered an office that provided her with a view up to the bridge of Tomoyo's nose.

"YOU POOR THING." Came a mighty voice with a tone so gentle that she must've been whispering. "YOU MUST BE WORN OUT." Naoko nodded but quickly realised that it would be difficult for the giant girl to see her nod. Figuring this she made her way over to the window, taking a deep breath as she felt a rush of adrenaline but with more control, and opened it as wide as she could.

After shifting the furniture for a few minutes, amazed at Tomoyo's patience and endurance, Naoko then made a running jump out of the window with a shout similar to that of a bungee jump. After what felt like an hour but was less than half a minute, she landed on the tip of Tomoyo's nose, right where she had first been spotted.

Tomoyo was relieved as she saw Naoko's miniature form leaping out of one of the thumbnail-sized windows and right onto the tip of her nose. She slowly lifted herself up into a sitting position, making sure not to send her tiny passenger flying anywhere else in the room.

"THERE WE GO!" Tomoyo mentioned, her voice resonating around Naoko as she attempted to steal herself for the re-establishing of communication.

"Um, nice giant." Naoko peeped. With Naoko having overcome her primal fear and Tomoyo happy that they were in direct contact now who makes the first introduction?
14533112212212212122112121212112212.title: A High-Rise Tomoyo Dive

145331122122122121221121212121122121.content:
"GIANT?" Tomoyo queried. "IT'S RATHER EMBARRASSING TO BE CALLED A GIANT." The discomfort showed in her massive eyes.

"W...Well," Naoko struggled to say, "How else can I address you as?"

"SURELY YOU HAVE A NAME JUST AS I DO." Tomoyo murmured as Naoko clung onto her nose. "I'M TOMOYO DAIDOUJI."

"I'm named Naoko Yanagisawa." Naoko peeped, still trying to get over Tomoyo's great size.

"IS IT ALRIGHT IF I CALL YOU NAOKO?" Tomoyo asked after due deliberation. Naoko couldn't really understand why someone who could obliterate her hometown with no real effort would actually ask her permission of anything.

"Do as you wish." Naoko submitted, not willing to give a straight answer. Tomoyo gave a gentle smile and raised her hand up to her face.

"IT MUST BE TIRING TO HOLD ON SO." She guessed. "PLEASE HOP ONTO ANY PART OF MY HAND." Bewildered Naoko chanced a look down and saw Tomoyo's hand waiting for her, palm up. Performing a rushed calculation as to her size relative to Tomoyo she decided to leap for...
145331122122122121221121212121122121.title: Making Contact

1453311221221221212211212121211221212.content:
Naoko let her legs dangle off the end of Tomoyo's nose, swinging to and fro as she tried to judge the best place to land. The giantess began to look anxious and began to sweat-drop.

"P...PLEASE," Tomoyo rumbled, "Jump off soon. I think I'm gonna sneeze." Realising the implications Naoko threw herself backward and landed on her hostess's index finger, lying on her back in the first knuckle. Tomoyo put the same finger of her free hand to her nose, managing to stave off the sneeze before it could send Naoko flying across the room. With that out of the way she lifted the tiny girl up to her eye. "YOU DO LOOK CUTE, YOU KNOW." Naoko sat up and held the back of her head in a gesture of embarrassment.

"A...Actually," She replied, "Now that I think about it, you're quite a charming lady yourself. Even if you are the size of a mountain." Tomoyo held her cheek with her free hand in a show of embarrassment, but with more composure than Naoko.

"THANK YOU, NAOKO." There was a long pause. Neither of them had any experience in socialising with someone who's size was so drastically different. What common ground did they have?
1453311221221221212211212121211221212.title: Riding a Giant's Finger

choices: "I did spot your hometown from a way away." (Yes)

14533112212212212122112121212112212121.content:
"Um, I haven't taken you away from your parents, did I?" Tomoyo asked as she wondered about Naoko's life in the tiny land below. She noticed her tiny guest scuff a foot upon her finger.

"Actually," Naoko answered, "My parents aren't around any more. My father died when I was two and I lost my mother only last month. I just got back from her funeral when you took my home." Tomoyo felt tears well up as she heard this, but did her best to avoid outright crying as she worried that just one tear would lead to Naoko going the way of her parents.

"Oh, you poor little thing." Her voice resonated like a rumble of thunder but the tone of sympathetic sorrow gave it a relaxing quality for Naoko. "You're an orphan." Naoko understood how Tomoyo felt only too well; after all it would be hard to hide tears large enough to fill a pond each.

"I...If you hadn't whisked me away," Naoko mentioned in an attempt to relieve her gigantic hostess of her guilt, "I'd have to move into an orphanage in the next couple of weeks." She caught sight of Tomoyo's free hand wiping those colossal tears away. "I suppose I could stay with you, you've been ever so kind, considering how I reacted to you." At this Tomoyo smiled and said, with a very minor giggle.

"It's all right. I don't know how I'd react if my home was engulfed in a girl's hand just after I returned." This remark made Naoko momentarily start and look at her own hands in wonder, wondering what this whole matter was like from Tomoyo's perspective.

"Do giants have better eyesight than people like me?" Naoko asked out of the blue, prompting Tomoyo to ponder for a moment.

"I couldn't say for sure." She answered. "But...
14533112212212212122112121212112212121.title: Bespectacled Orphan

Tomoyo then returns to what Naoko said about her being an orphan.
Tomoyo asks Naoko to show her which building she was living in.
Truth is Naoko has nothing to worry about with these giants.
145331122122122121221121212121122121213.content:
At this Naoko snapped her head up and stared into one of Tomoyo's eyes, figuring she couldn't look her in both eyes properly. "Daidouji-sama, I have noticed your voice doesn't seem quite so powerful as before." She felt Tomoyo move her finger slightly, making the crevice of her knuckle more like an easy chair for her new friend.

"Please, call me 'Tomoyo'." Tomoyo's cheerful smile had returned, stretching right across the mighty cliff-sized face. "And it's true, I can see those cute little spectacles on your little speck of a face, and your adorably tiny voice is actually registering in my ears." When she heard this, despite how the adjective put the whole matter into perspective for her, Naoko rested an elbow on a ridge of Tomoyo's skin and thought about what this meant.

"So, could something be changing us so we can interact better?" She suggested. Tomoyo then gaped in realisation, giving Naoko an adrenaline rush as she could now see right into the back of her mouth just long enough to understand just how many people she could swallow in one gulp.

"OF COURSE!" Tomoyo's voice blew upon Naoko with such force that she fell flat on her back before she was lifted closer than ever to one of those deep blue eyes. "There are some old legends about the origins of our land that mention little people and magic, so if my ancestors were tiny like you and magic made them as big as my family are now..." Though she'd paused to decide on the best way to describe her thoughts Naoko finished the sentence for her.

"That magic flows through this entire land and it's letting us interact more easily." Naoko stared and beamed into Tomoyo's enormous eye.

"So maybe you'll grow as big as me one day?" Tomoyo suggested, both happy that Naoko could potentially integrate with her society and disappointed that she wouldn't have a tiny girl to share her deepest feelings with.

"I doubt it." Naoko replied. "It could've taken a fair few generations for your kind to grow so big. Still, if it makes it easier for you to avoid..." She thought about the view right up to Tomoyo's uvula and couldn't continue. However Tomoyo knew what she was driving at.

"Naoko-chan," She spoke with a distinct tone of authority, "I promise you that I'll do whatever I can to keep you safe."
145331122122122121221121212121122121213.title: Where do Giant Come From?

These are the dos and do nots:

DON'T include explicit nudity
DON'T include sex references
DON'T go out of character
DON'T use strong swear words, mild ones are tolerated
DON'T allow a protagonist to die, unless s/he comes back in some way (alive)

DO mouth play is encouraged
DO soft vore is allowed
DO include gay/lesbian stuff where relevent (especially lesbian)
DO allow body adventure
DO use grow or shrink
DO have fun!

Please keep canon history, I can allow occurances within a series if the previous episodes are taken into account. Alternative storylines to canon are permitted as longs as the general storyline is unaffected (e.g. If doing an alternative episode of Cardcaptor Sakura make sure it won't affect the series ending).
